name: Tournament List Set-up
description_book: Volunteers are needed to set-up the Tournament Lists. Come out and be part of the magic. No special skills required.
description_web: Ever wonder how the List Fields are magically set-up? Be part of the action! Volunteers are needed to set-up the Tournament Lists. Come out and be part of the magic. No special skills required.

name: Workout at War
description_book: A workout class to keep your edge during war! Shake off your hangover / greet the day strong. For **all** fitness levels, by a NSAM certified trainer.
description_web: A workout fitness class to keep your edge during war! Shake off your hangover and/or greet the day strong. For **all** fitness levels, taught by a NSAM-certified trainer. The class will focus on bodyweight exercises (no weights); core and conditioning. Bring water. Wear comfortable shoes and clothes that function well for movement. They need not be period, though it is encouraged just to stay in the spirit of things. We will be working out on bare ground, so bring a mat of any kind if you wish.

name: Range Set-up
description_book: Volunteers are requested to help set up the Archery Range on Monday, Aug. 1, starting at 9 am. Archery marshals and non-marshals alike are welcome.
description_web: Volunteers are requested to help set up the Archery Range on Monday, Aug. 1, starting at 9 am. Archery marshals and non-marshals alike are welcome.

name: Range Setup
description_book: Set-up of thrown weapons range. Set-up will be divided between two days.
description_web: Set-up of thrown weapons range. Set-up will be divided between two days.

name: Introduction to *Kumihimo*
description_book: Learn the ancient Japanese art of *kumihimo*. This is a hands-on class and each kit contains all you need to complete a *kumihimo* cord.
fee_itemization: covers cost of  instruction sheet, the bobbins, weights, and disk and thread.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.

name: Introduction to Spinning *Poi*
description_book: Decorate your own *poi* and learn to spin it in this beginners' class. Focus on proper spinning techniques and foot placement along spinning planes.
description_web: In this one-hour workshop, you will learn some of the basic *poi* movements and terminology necessary to get you started. *Poi* spinning is a great low-impact workout that will help you to improve your coordination and give your fitness routine some "flair"! Fee includes your choice of Home of *Poi* - Sock *Poi* and a storage pouch. Handout with class review and contacts. Refreshments are also served. This year we will be decorating our *poi* to give them our own personal twist...We hope to see you there!
fee_itemization: Material fee includes your own poi to decorate with fabric pens provided, handout with brief history & class outline & refreshments served.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work started in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work started in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Basic Middle Eastern Percussion.
description_book: Learn the basics of Middle Eastern rhythms and counting. This class covers the basic foundation rhythms of North Africa and Central Asia.
description_web: Come learn the basics of Middle Eastern rhythms and counting. This class will cover the basic foundation rhythms of North Africa and Central Asia, as well as how to interweave these with the common Western and South African rhythms commonly heard at most SCA drum circles. Basic frame drum and *riq*.

location: Denys the Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs. AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: Discusion on Use of Siege Weapons in SCA Combat
description_book: Classes and open discussion on siege weapons: types, tactics, deployment, logistics and multi-platform use.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period runes were rarely used for divination, but many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system for using runes this way.
description_web: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to create magickal tools, effect change at distance, work weather, awaken inanimate objects, world walk, heal/ relieve pain (even migraines), and more. An optional booklet, with additional information, will be available for $5. [Note: This class is not medical training. I am not a doctor and don't even play one in the SCA.]

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.
description_web: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.

name: Tournament List Set-up
description_book: Volunteers are needed to set-up the Tournament Lists. Come out and be part of the magic. No special skills required.
description_web: Ever wonder how the List Fields are magically set-up? Be part of the action! Volunteers are needed to set-up the Tournament Lists. Come out and be part of the magic. No special skills required.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Workout at War
description_book: A workout class to keep your edge during war! Shake off your hangover / greet the day strong. For **all** fitness levels, by a NSAM certified trainer.
description_web: A workout fitness class to keep your edge during war! Shake off your hangover and/or greet the day strong. For **all** fitness levels, taught by a NSAM-certified trainer. The class will focus on bodyweight exercises (no weights); core and conditioning. Bring water. Wear comfortable shoes and clothes that function well for movement. They need not be period, though it is encouraged just to stay in the spirit of things. We will be working out on bare ground, so bring a mat of any kind if you wish.

name: Beginning Netting
description_book: Create that final piece of 14th-century bling, a netted hairnet. Learn how to cast on a circular net, use a gauge stick, and tie the netting knot.
description_web: Create that final piece of 14th-century bling, a netted hairnet. I'll teach how to cast on a circular net, use a gauge stick, and tie the netting knot. Netting can be scaled down to make hairnets of silk, or scaled up to make fish nets or tote bags using a sheet bend knot.
fee_itemization: The material fee covers the cost of the prewound netting shuttle, the gauge stick, and the base rod.

name: Stained Glass: A Look at Medieval Windows
description_book: We'll show you three distinct periods of medieval windows in England and France as described by Hugh Arnold. Use of beautiful color pictures.

name: If Looks Could Kill
description_book: Discussion of "evil eye" lore and amulets in antiquity.
description_web: Discussion of "evil eye" amulets and lore in antiquity. Slide show of amulets and hands-on examples.  Great way to take your persona to the next level.

name: V&A Study Room: See the Embroideries
description_book: See photos of over 100 period embroideries from the Victoria and Albert Textile Study Room.
description_web: See photos of over 100 period embroideries from the Victoria and Albert Textile Study Room. Due to low light conditions, color values are not always great, but the stitches can be seen in many of the close-ups. The handout lists each, with access codes and background information, for easy Internet access back home.

name: HS Summer Math Help and Challenge Problems
description_book: Teenagers (and others)! Do you have summer math work? Algebra through AP calculus. Get some help, help one another, or try the challenge problems.
description_web: Teenagers (and others)! Do you have summer math work? Algebra through AP calculus. Get some help, help one another, or try the challenge problems. Don't make your parents have to remind you to open the book you carried to Pennsic. ;-)

name: Introduction to *Kumihimo*
description_book: Learn the ancient Japanese art of *kumihimo*. This is a hands-on class and each kit contains all you need to complete a *kumihimo* cord.
fee_itemization: covers cost of  instruction sheet, the bobbins, weights, and disk and thread.

name: Forest Law in England
description_book: Beyond Robin Hood, we'll explore forest law vs. village law, the animals of the forest and men who worked there.
description_web: Beyond Robin Hood, we'll explore forest law, as opposed to village law, and how they interacted. We'll also cover the animals of the forest and men who worked in the forests, and the shifts over centuries.

name: My Favorite Pennsic Market Basket
description_book: Students will be able to take home a sturdy, useful handmade basket. This is the basket I use for all my Pennsic (or any event) shopping.

name: ASHI Basic First Aid
description_book: Created to help students develop basic first aid knowledge, skills, and the confidence to respond. Cost is $20 for card only, $30 including book.
description_web: Basic First Aid was created to help students develop basic first aid knowledge, skills, and the confidence to respond. The program is an excellent choice for both the community and workplace setting, and is consistent with recommendations of the 2010 National First Aid Science Advisory Board and OSHA’s best practices for first aid training programs in the workplace. Class length: 6.5 hours. Cost is $20 for card only, $30 including book.
fee_itemization: Separate fee for card or course materials. Cost is $20 for card only, $30 including book.

name: Intro to Woodworking, Part A
description_book: Introduction to woodworking with only hand tools. Includes modern SOPs and safe practices for the purposes of building medieval-style furniture.
description_web: Two half days Tuesday and Wednesday; an overview of hand wood work, with an opportunity to try things out. We will start on Tuesday morning with a chunk of a log and by noon we should have some boards or other furniture parts using wedges, axes, froes, drawknives, spokeshaves and wood planes. On Wednesday we will look at making joints, boring, and maybe a bit of carving. Covers saws, chisels, and planes. Extensive instructions on the selection, use and maintenance of all these tools will be covered. The class will be taught both first week and again second week. Students who cannot attend the whole class are encouraged to drop in or out at their convenience.

name: Range Setup
description_book: Set-up of thrown weapons range. Set-up will be divided between two days.
description_web: Set-up of thrown weapons range. Set-up will be divided between two days.

name: Fool's School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/10, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Theories on Garments Found at Pskov
description_book: A Norse or Varangian outfit was found at Pskov, Russia. Discuss the find, and then possible ways the dress and underdress may be reconstructed.
description_web: A 10th-century Norse or Varangian silk and linen outfit was found in Grave 3 at Pskov, Russia. How might the dress and underdress have looked and been worn? We will discuss the find, and possible ways to reconstruct the garments.

name: Tool of the Flame
description_book: Discussion of tools and equipment needed to make glass beads.
description_web: Hands-on discussion of tools and equipment needed to begin making glass beads. Students may see and handle tools and discuss the cost of a start-up kit

name: Simply Plaited: 14th-Century Women's Hair
description_book: Theorized period methods of achieving 4 simple 14th-C hairstyles popular in England and France with archaeological & artistic examples. Instructional.
description_web: Theorized period methods of achieving four **simple** 14th-century hairstyles popular in England and France. Period archaeological and artistic examples will be shown/demonstrated. Discussion of the use of modern materials also included. There should be time to try out the hairstyles on hair in class if wanted.

name: Beginner Knitting
description_book: Learn how to cast on, knit, purl, and cast off. Feel free to bring your own needles and yarn.

name: Henna: The Good, the Bad, and the Awesome
description_book: Interested in henna as hair dye? Already using henna? Want to learn more? Discover some recipes and tips on how to make it work for your hair type!

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Juggling 101: Beginner
description_book: Learn to juggle three balls in the simplest pattern. Equipment available for use or purchase.
description_web: The most basic 3-ball cascade juggling. Juggling balls will be made available for use by the class and may be bought afterward from the instructor.

name: Glass *Fatamids*: What Are They?
description_book: Learn about *fatamids*, the glass weights used to weigh coins in the Islamic world. They were also thought to have been used as money.
description_web: Learn about *fatamids*, the glass weights used to weigh coins in the Islamic world. They were also thought to have been used as money. Class covers the finds and their use.

name: Mad Words: Comedic Theatre of Japanese *Kyōgen*
description_book: *Kyōgen* is a style of comedic theatre begun by 14th-century Japan and continued today, often as a companion to more serious *nō* dramas.
description_web: Often translated as "mad words", *kyōgen* is a style of comedic theatre begun by the 14th century in Japan and continued today, often as a companion to the more serious *nō* dramas.

name: Slavery in Viking Culture
description_book: Discussion of slavery and how it was treated in Viking culture. Co-taught by Grimhild Gunnvoldsdottir.
description_web: A class discussing slavery in Viking cultures. It includes how it was started in myth as well as the laws and devices used in the slave trade. Recreation of items from the time may be available for use as examples.

name: It's a Fine Line, or The Devil's in the Details
description_book: Learn how to better recognize and execute 1300-1600 period details, including paint and brush control. Hands-on.
description_web: Want to know how to amp up your illumination and take those extra steps that make people stare? This class will teach how to better recognize and execute 1300-1600 period details, including paint and brush control. Hands-on. Bring pictures/books of illuminations you love, paper or pergamenata, a 000 or finer round brush, a sharp pencil, and your paints. **Please bring your own supplies**

name: Beginning Glass Bead Making
description_book: Join us to learn how to make glass beads. This class is a hands-on, beginning course.
description_web: Join us to learn how to make glass beads using a hot head propane-fueled torch. We will discuss how these beads were made in period and their significance. This is a hands-on class and all materials and equipment will be provided for use during this class. Required: hair pulled back; closed-toe shoes; clothing appropriate for working with a flame, i.e., no hanging sleeves or bodice parts.

name: Organizing Your A&S Display
description_book: How to organize and lay out your research, show your process, display your creation, and present your work.
description_web: This class will demonstrate how to plan your Arts and Science display. Research, work-in-progress photos, failed attempts, process, and what you learned should be carefully laid out and presented. My background is in architecture, portfolio design, and verbal presentations.
fee_itemization: Recommended reading and visual examples of layouts.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Runes: Elder/Anglo-Saxon *Futharks*
description_book: EF runes were used for business, graffiti, and magic until the Vendel period. A/S runes were derived from the EF, with many variations.
description_web:
Runes: the Elder Futhark. From the origin(s) of runes to the early Viking period,
these characters have not only been used for mundane purposes (business
correspondence and shipping labels, indicating ownership of jewelry, etc.) but also for magic. We will explore both angles in this class, as well as the origins and meanings of the individual runes themselves. The Anglo-Saxon *Futhark* was derived from the Scandinavian-Continental Germanic Elder *Futhark*. These have the  earliest documented rune names, and perhaps the widest variety in rune numbers and forms.

name: *Gracca Amorosa* for Beginners
description_book: Come learn *Gracca Amorosa*, one of the most popular 16th-C *cascarde*. Dancers of all ages welcome. Prior dance experience helpful but not required.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.

name: *Bodhran* 101
description_book: Introduction to playing the Irish frame drum. No experience necessary. Please bring your drum.

name: Intermediate Naalbinding: Beyond Oslo Stitch
description_book: A class meant for those with a solid understanding of naalbinding to learn additional stitches.
description_web:
For those with a solid understanding of naalbinding and who would like to learn additional stitches as well as discuss some methods of the construction of items such as mittens and socks. 
Yarn and some spare needles will be available. Best to bring your own favourite needle. Instructor is right-handed.

name: Make Your Own Medallion Cord
description_book: Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult.
description_web:
Why wear a plain white string? Learn *Slung*, a method for cord-making that can best be described as juggling with strings! Children welcome with adult.
*Slung* is also known as Viking whipcording. It is not only useful but a lot of fun for all ages. Can be done as a children's activity or at demos. Bring a friend! People will be taking turns on a limited number of set-ups. Showing up late is perfectly fine.

name: Advanced Viking Wire Weaving
description_book: Do you love Viking Wire Weaving but yearn to up your game? Come and learn double and triple weave. Students must know basic Viking Wire Weaving.
description_web: Do you love Viking Wire Weaving but yearn to up your game? Come and learn double and triple weave. This will be hands-on class, teaching students double and triple weaving techniques. Students must know how to do single Viking Wire Weaving.

name: Introduction to Card Weaving
description_book: What is card weaving and how to get started. You'll walk away with the knowledge and materials to finish making a small belt.
fee_itemization: cards, yarn/string to make a belt

name: Wet Felting: Viking style
description_book: Come learn the basics of wet felting and leave with a simple felted project.
description_web: Come play with wool roving, water and lots of suds and learn the art of felting wool. Make sure you wear clothes that you can get wet and soapy. This class has a limited attendance so make sure you arrive early for a space.
fee_itemization: Materials to make a felt pouch or small felted item.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to Gypsy Persona
description_book: Don't know how/where to start with this persona? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-Century Italian C
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy.

name: *Tafl* Games
description_book: The *Tafl* family of games were played through the Norse lands. The rules are simple and easy to learn, and the game play can be quick or complex.
description_web: The *Tafl* family of games were played through the Norse lands. The rules are simple and easy to learn, and the game play can be quick or complex.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: The Medievalist Abroad: What to See in Italy
description_book: A tourist itinerary of medieval attractions, based on extensive personal experience, starting with Venice, Florence, and Rome, and going on.
description_web: Medieval Italy is sadly neglected by tourism bureaus that emphasize classical and Renaissance attractions. This class will highlight some of Italy's many medieval glories, financed by a golden age of profiteering from the crusades and crusaders.

name: Multi-Coloured/Multi-Strand Naalbinding
description_book: This class is meant for experienced naalbinders. Discussion & practice of techniques based on *Eura Luistari* and *Kaukolan Kekomäki* fragment.
description_web:
This class is meant for experienced naalbinders. We will be discussing and practicing the techniques for continuous mutli-coloured, striped naalbinding that can be found in the *Eura Luistari* Grave 56 textile fragment and the *Kaukolan Kekomäki* fragment.  
Students should bring 3 different colours of fingering weight yarn and their favourite naalbinding needle. Some yarn and spare needles will be available as well. Instructor is right-handed. Limit of 15 students.

name: Make Your First Glass Bead
description_book: For those who want to make their first glass bead!  A short class on lampworking basics, and hands-on making your first glass bead!
description_web: For those who want to make their first glass bead!  A short class on lampworking basics, and hands-on making your first glass bead!
fee_itemization: fuel for the torch and glass

name: Hand-Sewing 101
description_book: A discussion and hands-on of hand-sewing of garb, etc. This is not embroidery, but useful stitches. Please bring needle, thread and light cloth.

name: Beginner Beadwork
description_book: History of beadwork within the SCA period. Techniques for beading on fabric.
description_web: History of beadwork within the SCA period. Techniques for beading on fabric. Focus on fill work, pearl work and glass beads.

name: Pilgrim's Bag
description_book: Thought about carrying a pilgrim's bag? Free up your hands; keep your modern items out of sight. Learn how to make a cloth or leather pilgrim's bag.
description_web: Ever thought about carrying a pilgrim's bag instead of carrying a bulky basket? You can free up your hands, and it is a great way to keep your modern items out of sight. Learn how you can make a pilgrim's bag out of cloth or leather and learn a few facts about pilgrims.
fee_itemization: There will be handouts available.  No charge.

name: **Creative** Anachronism in English Country Dance
description_book: Part of SCA is "Creative." Lord Hakon will discuss the process he went through creating three new ECD dances this year and then teach them, if time.
description_web: Part of SCA is "Creative." Lord Hakon will discuss the process he went through creating three new English Country Dances this year, including considerations of music and dance steps. Then we will learn them as time allows.

name: Middle Eastern Dancing for All Shapes and Sizes
description_book: If you love to shake your shimmy or want to try dancing for the first time, come out and join us.

name: Introduction to *Carnatic* Music Theory
description_book: An overview of *Carnatic* music from Southern India, this class addresses how to understand the format and harmonic system of music.
description_web: An overview of *Carnatic* music from Southern India, this class addresses how to understand the format and harmonic system of music. Based on time available, we will learn part or all of a *Carnatic* piece. As *Carnatic* music is substantially different from European music, knowledge of Western Music theory is not necessary, though a basic understanding is helpful. The ability to read European music is not required.

name: Sexy, Silly, Scheming Saints
description_book: Think saints' lives are boring? Think again! We'll explore saint stories from *The Golden Legend* that would fit right in on prime time TV.
description_web: Slept through Sunday school? Think saints' lives are boring? Think again! In this class, we'll explore saint stories from the medieval bestseller, *The Golden Legend*, that would fit right in on prime time TV. (Some themes not appropriate for children.)

name: Beaded Flowers
description_book: Make a miniature tea rose in the style of the beaded flowers of 15th-century Venice.

name: *Murrine* and Canes...
description_book: Join us as we learn how to make various types of period *murrine* or "cane"  This is an advanced lampworking class.
description_web: We will learn how to make many different kinds of "cane" which can be cut up to make *murrine*. This will then be applied to beads. We will be using period methods to create our cane. This is a hands-on class and all materials and equipment will be provided for use during this class. Required: hair pulled back; closed-toe shoes; clothing appropriate for working with a flame, i.e., no hanging sleeves or bodice parts.

name: Feasts Are More Than Cooking
description_book: A discussion of the many things needed for a successful feast that have nothing to do with the cooking.

name: Introduction to Spoon Carving
description_book: Hands-on introduction to carving spoons and other treenware from green wood with hand tools.
description_web: A hands-on introduction to techniques for carving spoons and other treenware from green wood. Participants are encouraged to bring their own knives. We will be carving green wood blanks to make simple spoons by using hand axes and knives.

name: History and Symbolism of the Unicorn Tapestries
description_book: An examination of "The Hunt for the Unicorn", 15th-century Flemish tapestries widely regarded as the best example of tapestries of the age.
description_web: Join us for an examination of "The Hunt for the Unicorn", 15th-century Flemish tapestries widely regarded as the best example of tapestries of the age. Why does the unicorn lack ears in one tapestry? What happened to the pieces of the fifth tapestry? Where are they now? All these and more will be answered. This class has been updated with new information.
fee_itemization: Full color, line drawing and plant key copies of all the tapestries with corresponding plants highlighted.

name: Telling Stories as Your Persona
description_book: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.
description_web: How to tell stories in a way that creates the illusion of a period story being told to a period audience, along with a discussion of sources.

name: Nail the Hey
description_book: The Hey in English Country Dance can be confusing. Come learn how to nail it every time. Examples and one dance (Grimstock) included.
description_web: One of the more confusing steps in English Country Dance, especially for new dancers, is the Hey. Come learn how to nail it every time. We'll walk through 3-person heys, 4-person heys, and heys in the round, with and without hands. Then we will learn Grimstock, which has 3 different types of heys.

name: Sharpening Everything for Woodworking
description_book: How to sharpen all of your stuff that needs sharpening!
description_web: How to sharpen everything! This class is an extension of my woodworking class. Thus I will focus on sharpening woodworking tools, but the principles are the same for all cutting implements. We will cover several concepts and methods but the focus (like mine) will be on how I do it... without expensive jigs and other do-hickies. We will review, then sharpen, anything you bring - and all of my tools.

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: Basic Middle Eastern Percussion.
description_book: Learn the basics of Middle Eastern rhythms and counting. This class covers the basic foundation rhythms of North Africa and Central Asia.
description_web: Come learn the basics of Middle Eastern rhythms and counting. This class will cover the basic foundation rhythms of North Africa and Central Asia, as well as how to interweave these with the common Western and South African rhythms commonly heard at most SCA drum circles. Basic frame drum and *riq*.

name: Recorder Jam!
description_book: Do you play the recorder? Want to learn? Come read through Renaissance literature. Soprano recorders available for purchase $4.
description_web: Do you play the recorder? Come play with others in a group setting and read through Renaissance literature. In a 90-minute session, we will start with beginner/easy music and move toward harder music. Youth players should come near the beginning, advanced can arrive later. Bring your instrument or use a loaner. New soprano recorders will be available for $4.

name: The Poleax Techniques of Paulus Hector Mair
description_book: Period poleax techniques that stress using the width of the ax in both defensive and offensive fashion applicable to SCA heavy list use.
description_web: Period poleax techniques that stress using the width of the ax in both defensive and offensive fashion applicable to SCA heavy list use.

name: Are You Wearing a Tablecloth? Greek Clothing!
description_book: Learn how to create Greek garb easily, accurately, and with style! Meet Greek style, form, and ideals for the easiest garb ever!
description_web: We all deal with hot weather in the summer. Learn how to do so easily, accurately, and with style! We will cover basic Greek style, form, and ideals, then go into fabrics, colors, trims, and accessories to create a great classical and cool look.

name: Being Your Persona
description_book: How to maintain the illusion, at an event, that you are a period person interacting with other period people.
description_web: How to maintain the illusion, at an event, that you are a period person interacting with other period people.

name: First Aid or CPR Challenges
description_book: Individuals can challenge to recertify by taking the written and physical tests. These will be ASHI challenges. Cost is $20 for card only.
description_web: Individuals can challenge to recertify by taking the written and physical tests. If the challenge is unsuccessful, the recommendation is for the full class. These will be ASHI challenges, unless other instructors can be found. Individual challenges take approximately 1 hour. Cost is $20 for card only.
fee_itemization: Fee per card achieved. Cost is $20 for card only.

location: Denys the Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs. AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: Making Your Own Soapstone Glass Molds
description_book: Join us to learn to make and use soapstone molds for your glass working. Advanced glass-working methods required.
description_web: In period, people could not order cool glass molds or tools from the local Internet website. Instead, they made their own. Come and learn how to make and use your own soapstone glass molds! This class is recommended for those already comfortable with basic beadmaking.

name: Open Torch
description_book: During any unused class times, torches, tools and glass will be made available to experienced lampworkers for open torch time!
description_web: During any unused class time, torches, tools and glass will be made available to experienced lampworkers for open torch time.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: The Evil Eye
description_book: Explore many cultures, from Rome to modern era, and the tradition that a witch (or others) could cause misfortune by "overlooking" or "the Evil Eye".
description_web: We'll be exploring many cultures, from Rome to modern times, and the tradition that a witch (among others) could cause misfortune by glance, "overlooking", or "the Evil Eye". Intentional or not, there were charms and talismans to protect against this hexing, or cursing, and the mechanisms by which it works. Hear how to counter it.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.
description_web: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Workout at War
description_book: A workout class to keep your edge during war! Shake off your hangover / greet the day strong. For **all** fitness levels, by a NSAM certified trainer.
description_web: A workout fitness class to keep your edge during war! Shake off your hangover and/or greet the day strong. For **all** fitness levels, taught by a NSAM-certified trainer. The class will focus on bodyweight exercises (no weights); core and conditioning. Bring water. Wear comfortable shoes and clothes that function well for movement. They need not be period, though it is encouraged just to stay in the spirit of things. We will be working out on bare ground, so bring a mat of any kind if you wish.

name: A Droll Challenge: Itty Bitty People
description_book: For the moderately experienced scribe who finds creating drolleries a challenge. Please bring your own materials.
description_web: When creating your scrolls, do you find yourself choosing the style without pictures of people or other creatures because you just can't get them to look right? Or, perhaps, you haven't even tried because you never got past stick figure drawing. Allow me to share my tricks of the trade and maybe, just maybe, help you take that next step into the art form that we love. (Please bring your own paper, pencils, and gouache.)
fee_itemization:
Donations for handouts would be most appreciated!
Material fee-if used; purchased:paper, pencils, and gouache

name: A Hand A Day: Uncial and Artificial Uncial
description_book: Learn the basics of these two early-period hands that were used extensively in manuscripts across England and Ireland.

name: Photographing Court: How to Be a Photo Ninja
description_book: Discuss the laws, etiquette, technology, and technique involved in getting those great shots of court while being unobtrusive, if not invisible.
description_web:
Court is one of the most SCAdian things we do. As photographers, we want to capture the pageantry and the moments that only happen there. How do we do this without distracting from the medieval atmosphere?
We will discuss the laws (mundane and Society), etiquette, technology (how to turn off lights/beeps, etc.), and techniques for getting that great shot while being unobtrusive.

name: Camp Cooking Using Insulated Containers
description_book: Insulated containers were used to cook with limited fuel and/or limited attention. Examples of hay boxes, cooler cooking and *sous vide* in camp.
description_web: Cooking slow and low is not new but lends itself to feast preparation with limited burners or large amounts of items that simply need to be held at a specific temperature. Hay boxes are insulated boxes used to cook with limited fuel and/or limited attention. This is a show-and-tell class. There will be examples of hay boxes, beer cooler meat finishing and rice preparation in a cooler. We will discuss temperatures, times and food safety.

name: A Taste of Bobbin Lace
description_book: Sample basic bobbin lace techniques while making a bracelet! Ages 10+ welcome. Tools and thread provided during class; no investment needed!
description_web: Sample basic bobbin lace techniques while making a bracelet! Ages 10+ are welcome. Tools, pattern, and thread will be provided. This course is intended as a quick, no-investment introduction to the techniques of bobbin lace.

name: Knitting with Two or More Colors
description_book: Learn how to knit with more than one color. This is an intermediate level class. Feel free to bring own yarn and needles.

name: Embroidery: How Do I Do That!?!
description_book: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Come out and learn a few easy stitches!
description_web: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Do you want to decorate your garb or projects but aren't sure where to start? Come learn a few easy stitches. See some examples of basic embroidery projects. Sample fabric, needle and thread provided.  Please bring scissors and a small embroidery hoop if you have them.
fee_itemization:
Embroidery floss
Needles
Hoops
Sample fabric

name: Thorsberg Trousers: Pants That Last!
description_book: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial!
description_web: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial! Learn what you’ll need to make them yourself: fabrics, seams, pattern, and construction.

name: Graph Paper is Your Friend
description_book: How to use graph paper to perfect your pattern layout, save yourself time, fabric and heartache! Beginner-level pattern layout.
description_web: How to use graph paper to perfect your pattern layout, save yourself time, fabric and heartache! Beginner-level pattern layout. Class starts with a quick breakdown of how, then we dive right in and practice the theory hands on. *Please bring a pencil and eraser if possible*.

name: ASHI CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer
description_book: ASHI's CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer. Cost is $20 for card only, $30 including book.
description_web: CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer program is designed for individuals in the healthcare or professional rescuer field who are required to have a professional-level basic life support training. Students learn how to recognize a life-threatening emergency, how to provide basic life support and what to do in case of an airway obstruction or choking. ASHI's CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer has been approved for training for Emergency Medical Services personnel and is accepted by the National Registry of Emergency Medical Technicians (NREMT). Class length: 7 hours. Cost is $20 for card only, $30 including book.
fee_itemization: Separate fee for certification card or course materials.

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make three basic projects. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from the *Nüw Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

name: Intro to Woodworking, Part B
description_book: Introduction to woodworking with only hand tools. Includes modern SOPs and safe practices for the purposes of building medieval-style furniture.
description_web: Two half days Tuesday and Wednesday; an overview of hand wood work, with an opportunity to try things out. We will start on Tuesday morning with a chunk of a log and by noon we should have some boards or other furniture parts using wedges, axes, froes, drawknives, spokeshaves and wood planes. On Wednesday we will look at making joints, boring, and maybe a bit of carving. Covers saws, chisels, and planes. Extensive instructions on the selection, use and maintenance of all these tools will be covered. The class will be taught both first week and again second week. Students who cannot attend the whole class are encouraged to drop in or out at their convenience.

location: Kingdom of Calontir (Kingdom of Calontir court yard)
name: Stained Glass Tools
description_book: A look at the medieval glazier's studio and the tools used. You will have an opportunity to try the tools.
description_web: A look at the medieval glazier's studio and the tools used. This class will give you the opportunity to try the dividing iron and grozer. Class will be around a hot forge. Short sleeves or the ability to roll them up will be required. Toe-covering shoes are required.

name: Beginning Illumination: Loving the Dot
description_book: Let me show you that illumination doesn't have to be as daunting as it seems. Learn about layout, design elements and, yes, dots, Dots, *DOTS*!
description_web: So you've seen those beautiful manuscripts and thought you'd love to learn how to create one on your own, but surely they are too daunting! Well, I'd like to show you how to visually break down complicated scroll designs into more manageable and doable elements. You'll even try your hand at a few of them! Materials available for the fee, or bring your own.
fee_itemization: I will providing brushes, paint, and paper for those who do not have materials. A few dollars donation for the hand out and whatever materials you use, would be helpful.

name: Calligraphy 101
description_book: Learn the basics of calligraphy; practice techniques of beginning alphabets using Speedball dip pens and India ink. For beginners.

name: Fool's School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/10, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Glass Day
description_book: Working with glass to make handmade beads. Torches will be set up for demonstration and use; a display will showcase the various styles created.

name: SCA Documentation: It's Not as Scary as You Think!
description_book: View and discuss different types of documentation and reasons for documenting. Bring your questions and any current documentation for feedback.
description_web: Interested in entering a regional fair for the first time? Looking to improve your research and documentation? Just want to try a bean count competition? Wondering what info to add to your class handouts? In this class we will look at (and discuss) different types of documentation and reasons for documenting. Bring your questions and any current documentation for tips and feedback.

name: Mozzarella, 30-Minute Process
description_book: Mozzarella is a fresh cheese requiring a few tools and ingredients. This cheese can be made in camp. I'll show you how.
description_web: Mozzarella is a fresh cheese requiring a few tools and ingredients. This cheese can be made in camp. I'll show you how.

name: The Social: A Recurring Non-Activity
description_book: How can a small, weekly canton social activity turn into something pulling 40-50+ members from four states on a regular basis, and what's next?
description_web:
Modeled after something seen in the Canton of Whyt Whey some years ago, the Canton of Black Icorndall started a weekly "Canton Social" which has proven to be very successful in terms of general socializing, encouraging niche or not-quite-SCA (even non-SCA) activities as well as serving as a staging ground to relaunch a regional fighter practice, rekindle dance practice and more. It also serves as a good venue for newcomers with so much going on. Join us for a discussion of the model, our successes, some things to watch out for and more! 
Learn what we've learned since starting to offer this class, and bring more ideas to the table!

name: Lucet: Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-strand cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-strand cords. Please bring your lucet. We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off, and put it back on after class.
fee_itemization: (4) colors of floss on cards, and handout

name: Natural Hair Dye: Henna and Beyond
description_book: Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever.
description_web: Learn how to use period dye techniques and materials to make your hair red, black, brown, or just shinier, healthier, and longer than ever. We'll focus on henna but explore other herbs to color and protect hair naturally without dangerous chemicals. Some supplies will be available at the class.

name: The 12th-Century Bliaut: Our Journey
description_book: Sharing lessons we learned in the construction of the High Medieval court gown (bliaut). We'll look at patterns, tutorials and results.
description_web:
The bliaut is a gown from the high Middle Ages, generally associated with the French court. Because of its early period, there is a lot of debate on the actual design and construction resulting with many different approaches in how to make one for yourself.
In this class we aim not to give the final word on the construction of a period bliaut, but to share what we have learned from our own attempts. We'll review some of the patterns available online and show you the dresses we made from them. This is beginner level; we are not professional seamstresses. We encourage you to bring your own 12th-century gown and your favorite pattern source to add to the discussion.

name: Homeless Monks: The Mendicant Revolution
description_book: In the early 13th century two men challenged a church council edict and radically changed the face of western monasticism for centuries to come.
description_web: In the early 13th century two men challenged a church council edict and radically changed the face of western monasticism for centuries to come. The influence of Francis and Dominic is still evident today.

name: Paper Making
description_book: Students will make paper using traditional techniques and materials.
description_web: We will discuss the history of paper making, from its start in China to its spread into Europe, as well as become familiar with processing raw materials. Students will make sheets of hand-made paper in class.
fee_itemization:
Handout is a printed pamplet.
Materials include paper pulp sizing, and pigments.

name: The Game of Tarot
description_book: A simple trick-taking card game played with a tarot deck.
description_web: A simple trick-taking card game played with a tarot deck.

location: Good Friends Camp (N-01, usually on St. Lawrence)
name: Coptic Sketch Book
description_book: Students will learn to build a small Coptic sketch book with wood covers and exposed spine.
description_web: New just last year, students will build a small Coptic sketch book with wood covers and exposed spine using techniques used in Egypt in the 4th to 8th centuries. The beauty of this book is that it can lie flat for sketching or note-taking.
fee_itemization: Fee includes wood boards, paper, linen thread, and a handout.

name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.  Student Performance, Thursday, 8/1,1 6-7 pm at the Amphitheater. Bring a blanket or chair to enjoy the performance on the green.

name: Music from Spain and Portugal
description_book: Bring instruments or voices. Sight-singing skills useful but not required. Music from the Iberian Peninsula from the 13th to 16th centuries.
description_web: Bring instruments or voices. Sight-singing skills useful but not required. Music from the Iberian Peninsula from the 13th to 16th centuries.

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn to throw axes, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn to throw axes, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Juggling Practice
description_book: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.
description_web: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.

name: Throw Away Your Wristwatch: Basic and Advanced
description_book: Period methods of timekeeping. First 10 minutes teaches several ways to tell time. Last 40 minutes teaches you how to tell time anywhere, anytime.
description_web: Learn period methods of timekeeping to tell time day and night at Pennsic. Basic course (first 10 minutes) teaches several ways to tell time. Advanced course delves into the science and teaches more ways to tell time so you can tell time anywhere, anytime.

name: Cheese from a Gallon of Milk: Feta Cheese
description_book: From a gallon of milk a variety of cheeses can be made. When adding rennet and some bacterial cultures, you get feta.
description_web: From a gallon of milk a variety of cheeses can be made. When adding rennet and some bacterial cultures you select varieties such as cottage cheese, muenster, feta, or cream cheese. This project is to share how simple a fresh cheese is to make and how many variations can be made from a few kitchen items and a little extra kitchen equipment.

name: Mythbusting Period Piracy
description_book: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined.
description_web: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined. Common myths and mistakes about piracy in the SCA period will be highlighted.

name: Backstrap Weaving
description_book: Narrow weaving without a loom. How to do fully-functional narrow weaving using two sticks and a tree.
description_web: Card- and inkle-weaving are readily done without use of an inkle loom; all you need are two sticks and something solid to tie your work to. Learn how to warp and card-weave, as well as some handy tips for setups. Prior knowledge of narrow weaving helpful but not essential. Bring a small shuttle if you can or have one you prefer. Optional fee, only if you wish to purchase equipment.
fee_itemization: Dowels, backstrap, small warped cardweaving set, shuttle.

name: Gilding Food
description_book: We'll cover gilding (and some painting) of period food, like marchpanes. Hands-on for first 12 students. Supplies included.
description_web: We'll cover gilding (and some painting) of period food, like marchpanes. Hands-on for first 12 students. Supplies included.
fee_itemization: Molded marzipan, agate burnisher, brush, sugar paste, gold leaf.

name: Gearing Up for Youth Combat
description_book: Covers the basics for preparing for Youth Combat: rules, armor, and weapons. Hands-on weapons building.
description_web: This class will cover the basics for preparing for Youth Combat. We will cover the newest set of Society rules, as  well as answer Kingdom-specific questions.  Armor requirements will be discussed, as well as handouts with lists of places to find gear either at Pennsic merchants or in the Slippery Rock area. Weapons requirements will be discussed, and we will go over, step by step, how to build a proper weapon for Youth Combat. Materials will be provided to build **one** weapon, and building will be done step-by-step as a class. First come, first served for materials. This class is geared towards the parents or adult guardians of youth interested in fighting, but minors are also welcome to come.
fee_itemization:
Apollo 1-in x 5-ft 160 PEX Pipe- $4.98
Tundra 3/4in Wall x 6 Ft Pipe Insulation- $6.49
Frost King 0.375-in x 17-ft Gray Foam Door Weatherstrip- $1.97
Duck 1.88-in x 30-ft Multiple Colors/Finishes Duct Tape-$3.48
LASCO 1-in Dia Cap CPVC Fitting- $1.18
Scotch Extreme Shipping Strapping Tape with Dispenser, 1.96" x 21.8 yds, Clear, 1/Pack  - $6.89

name: Canary, with Training Wheels
description_book: The Canary is a 16th-century dance with swagger and foot-stamping. I will teach a simplified pattern that will let you start having fun with it.

name: Silk Road Dance 101: Intro to Belly Dance
description_book: Learn some basic movements to begin confidently belly dancing around the campfire or under the shade trees. All ages and levels of ability welcome.
description_web: Christy Fricks of Sulukule introduces you to the cultural historical background of belly dance. She will teach you some basic movements to begin confidently belly dancing around the campfire or under the shade trees. All ages and levels of ability welcome.

name: Ottoman Singing
description_book: Learning to sing the 15th-century Ottoman classical composition, "*Kâr-ı Muhteşem,*" (The Magnificence) as composed by Abdülkadir Meragi.
description_web: We will be teaching the Ottoman classical composition from the 15th century, "*Kâr-ı Muhteşem*," (The Magnificence) that was/is commonly performed in the *Mevlevi* Whirling Dervish *sema*. This piece of music is typically performed with singing. As such, we will be teaching a singing class to learn this song in the original Ottoman Turkish language. What will you learn and experience: a 15th-c. Seljuk/Ottoman song "*Kâr-ı Muhteşem*" and its history; the musical modality *Makam Rast*; pronunciation of Ottoman Turkish along with a brief history and etymology. The 4 classes will be progressive; however, students may join in when they wish, although attendance at all the classes is strongly encouraged. Students may join the class's Facebook page in advance to orient themselves to the song and class: https://www.facebook.com/groups/398762226986519/

name: How to Draw Manuscript Flora
description_book: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-century French scroll.
description_web: If you passed kindergarten art class, you can draw a 14th-century French scroll. This class will break down the elements and have you leaving confident and ready to illuminate.

name: Period Stained Glass Basics
description_book: Discussion of materials, techniques, and primary sources used in period stained glass work. This will not be hands-on, but many visual aids!
description_web: Discussion of materials, techniques, and primary sources used in period stained glass work, including vitreous paints, silver stain, design considerations, lead came technique, etc. Discussion will also include an overview of primary sources and other resources for research. Practical hands-on will not be available, but many examples will be available for viewing. This class intended for someone doing modern copper foil work who wants to try more period techniques.

name: Enameling 101
description_book: Basic intro to enamel. Create a pendant; learn about wet inlay and layering of transparent glass through the sifting enamel technique.
description_web: Very basic intro to enameling. We'll address the techniques of wet inlay using heraldic colors and layering of transparent glass through the use of sifting enamels. Students will leave with a self-created pendant. Ages 12 and up preferred due to materials used in the class.
fee_itemization: Enamel 10 colors, 20 copper blanks, sifters, paper towels, water, eye droppers, spoons,

name: Building Yurts on a Budget
description_book: Learn all you need to know to build and decorate a quality yurt on a tight budget.  Class handouts will include detailed plans and cost analysis.
description_web: Learn all you need to know in order to build and decorate a quality yurt on a budget. We will discuss building materials, design options, and cost-saving methods so that almost anyone can own their own custom-built yurt. Class handout will include a full and comprehensive shopping list as well as detailed instructions and plans to get you started.

name: Bestiaries: Natural Science in the Middle Ages
description_book: Explore the medieval bestiary or “Book of Beasts” and learn about their popularity plus how they were much more than just a book of natural history.
description_web: Know the best way to catch an elephant? Why, look for bent over trees in the forest, of course! Come enjoy a look at the medieval bestiary or “Book of Beasts” and learn about their popularity and how they were much more than just a book of natural history.

name: Give Us Your Hand... SMACK
description_book: The hand-kissing class: the history, anatomy, plus how to kiss a hand and how not. Some other good things to know about in these current Middle Ages.
description_web: An examination of the fine art of hand-kissing, its history and anatomy, instruction on how to kiss a hand and how to get your hand kissed or not, and a few other good things to know about it. Just to help you have fun in these current Middle Ages.

name: Butter Make-and-Take
description_book: Churn your own butter and take it back to your camp to enjoy! Appropriate for all ages.
description_web: Come learn how to churn or shake butter from simple cream. Participants will use a mini-churn or shake jar to create their own batch of butter to take back to their camp, plus also get the opportunity to help churn a larger batch in a wooden churn that everyone can sample. Prepare to get a wee bit messy. Material fee covers mini-churn and cream to make the butter.
fee_itemization:
Jar - $1, Lid - .50, Dasher - $1,
Cream - .50.  No fee for handout.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country
description_book: Simple English Country Dances are a great introduction to period dance. All steps and patterns for several dances will be taught; no partner required.

name: Tinsmithing
description_book: A basic but complete course in the fundamentals of tinsmithing. Students will make a glass-globed hurricane lamp with hand tools.
description_web: A basic but complete course in the fundamentals of tinsmithing. Students will make a glass-globed hurricane lamp with hand tools.
fee_itemization: Includes materials for project and handouts.

name: Recorder Consort: 15th- and 16th-Century Music
description_book: Come play Dufay and other favorites! For recorder players (intermediate and above) who are comfortable with their instruments and with sight-reading.
description_web: Come play Dufay and other favorites in good company! This group playing session is geared for recorder players (intermediate and above) who are comfortable with their instruments and with sight-reading. Sheet music will be provided; feel free to bring your own favorites (in multiple copies, please).

name: Beginning to Drum Solo: *Maqsum and Ayoub*
description_book: An intro to the beginnings of solo techniques for *Maqsum* and *Ayoub* rhythms. An intermediate class, but all levels welcome.

name: Open Scribal Time/Scribal Play Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Runes: the Younger *Futhark*
description_book: Scandinavia condensed the rune row from the earlier 24-rune EF to 16-characters . Dotted, short twig, codes, and other variants will be presented.
description_web:
﻿In the late Vendel or early Viking period, the rune row was condensed to a 16-character array from the earlier 24-rune Elder *Futhark*. We will look at not only rune names/meanings, but also dotted runes, “short-twig" runes, “Norse
code”, magic, and mundane usage.

name: It's a Fine Line, or The Devil's in the Details
description_book: Learn how to better recognize and execute 1300-1600 period details, including paint and brush control. Hands-on.
description_web: Want to know how to amp up your illumination and take those extra steps that make people stare? This class will teach how to better recognize and execute 1300-1600 period details, including paint and brush control. Hands-on. Bring pictures/books of illuminations you love, paper or pergamenata, a 000 or finer round brush, a sharp pencil, and your paints. **Please bring your own supplies**

name: A History of Silver Stain and Stained Glass
description_book: The history and use of silver stain and paints, period formulas, and a display. A few samples may be available.

name: Dog-Eared! Finding Your Place in Medieval Tomes
description_book: Marking a place in a medieval book just was as ad hoc, effective and damaging as it is today. Join in a review of extant examples and reproductions.

name: How to Have a Successful Fundraising Lunch
description_book: Let me help you increase your profits holding a fundraising lunch. I have 10 years of experience in product and event fundraising.
description_web: Let me help you increase your profits holding a fundraising lunch. We will talk about how to serve large filling lunches, cut food costs, labor needs, where to look for donations, serving ideas and pricing. Bring your questions. I have 10 years of experience in product and event fundraising.

name: You Are What You Eat: Humoral Doctrine
description_book: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition through food.
description_web: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition through food.

name: Coaching and the Art of Constructive Criticism
description_book: Discover proven NPS coaching techniques to cultivate critique that aids and inspires rather than crushing talent before it can bloom. Coach the dream!
description_web: We all hear the cries of the populace - or at least the artists-to-be and the volunteers-to-be - that they tried and were rendered low by sharp criticism. Here you can discover proven coaching techniques from a National Park Service Registered Coach. Learn to shape artistic performance and presentation or volunteer service into something that serves the dream rather than drives people away!

name: Help Me, Tempus, You’re My Only Hope!
description_book: Two hours with Tempus, anything sewing. Trouble-shooting, problem-solving, garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Maybe learn to sew...
description_web:
(Garb Troubleshooting/Q&A Workshop)
This is a trouble-shooting and problem-solving class; garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Bring to the class garb that went “wrong” or garb that didn’t “work” for you. We'll talk; it can be fixed. If you don’t have the garb here, bring your questions; we’ll do our best to solve your garb troubles. We’ll talk about gussets and how to use your seam ripper, too. This class can go on longer if needed. Also, this class will be offered next year.

name: 16th-Century Western Erotica
description_book: An exploration of the *I Modi* and other erotic works of the 16th century.
description_web: *I Modi* (*The Ways*), also known as *The Sixteen Pleasures*,  a famous erotic book of the Italian Renaissance in which a series of sexual positions were explicitly depicted in engravings. We will examine images from this work and others that explore sexual art for its own sake. There are handouts available. Because of the nature of the class, no one under the age of 18 is allowed to attend.

name: Intoduction to Labyrinths
description_book: Labyrinths wend through all of period. Learn the basic types and how to draw them. Explore their change over time. ”The Chalk Labyrinth Guy”, teacher.
description_web: It matters not if you are Tudor or Turk, Norseman or Nepalese, Breton or Borgia, labyrinths are a part of your world. Topics covered are "What *is* a labyrinth?"; categories and types; how to draw one; and a whirlwind tour of labyrinths in period. From storytelling devices to dancing floors, from monster trap to heavenly road, the labyrinth has meant many things to many peoples. Brought to you by "That Chalk Labyrinth Guy."

name: Norse Wire Weaving: An Introduction
description_book: With only fine wire and some simple tools, create beautiful chains in the "Norse wire weaving" or "trichinopoly" style. If possible, bring pliers.
description_web: With only a few simple tools - a bit of wire, a mandrel, some pliers and a draw plate - you can learn how to make beautiful chains in the "Norse wire weaving" or "trichinopoly" style. We will discuss the history of this craft and learn the basics of single, double, and triple "stitch". Students are encouraged to bring pliers/wire cutters if possible.
fee_itemization: Handout, dowel for mandrel, copper wire enough for a complete project.

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-Century Italian
description_book: Never danced before, or afraid to try Italian steps? All steps and patterns for several simple and popular dances will be taught; no partner required.

name: Alquerque
description_book: A intro to one of the most prevalent board games in period. Similar in complexity to modern checkers.
description_web: A intro to one of the most prevalent board games in period. Similar in complexity to modern checkers.

name: Fundamentals of Voice Production
description_book: Learn the basics of vocal technique. This is an active, participatory class for those who have never had a voice lesson. Note start time.
description_web: **Please note**: Class lasts 90 minutes to allow plenty of practical time, **starts** on the half-hour. Learn the basics of vocal technique. This is an active, participatory class for those who have never had a voice lesson. Those who can stand comfortably will be asked to do so for much of the class, but all the activities can be adapted to a seated position.

name: Facial Tattoos
description_book: The Bedouin women of Iraq have facial tattoos for beauty. I'll explore some of the symbols and other cultures with facial tattooing.
description_web: The Bedouin women of Iraq have facial tattoos for beauty. I'll explore some of the symbols and other cultures with facial tattooing.

name: Designing and Building a Pavilion
description_book: An overview of pavilion styles, followed by detailed discussions of design considerations for several different styles.
description_web: An overview of medieval and Renaissance tent and pavilion styles, based on what we see in period portraits and in a few surviving examples. The presenters will discuss their experience in building a variety of pavilions. After the class, students are welcome to visit several pavilions on-site to continue discussion of design details and challenges.

name: Who Was Eleanor of Aquitaine?
description_book: If you have heard of the famous wife and queen of Henry II, but wanted to know more about her life, then join us for a brief history and discussion.
description_web: If you have heard of the famous wife and queen of Henry II, but wanted to know more about her life and times, then join us for a brief history and discussion. Did she really invent chivalry? Was she responsible for the birth of Arthurian literature? Could she have been the richest woman in the world (for her time)?

name: Japanese Language and Etiquette
description_book: A guide to Japanese pronunciation, useful phrases, bowing, sumptuary customs, and forms of address for various ranks used in the SCA.

name: The History of Prostitution
description_book: History of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 AD. Topics include brothels, daily life, garb, and courtesan culture.
description_web: A survey of the history of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 AD. We will be covering such topics as the formation of red light districts, brothel management, contraception, municipal laws, church law, and the garb and identification of a prostitute within this time period.

name: Beginning Gresley Dances
description_book: These are from 1500 England but are different from the English Country dances you have seen. Fun and easy to learn. No experience necessary.

name: Court as Theatre
description_book: Learn how to make court a more theatrical, immersive, and enjoyable experience for all. This class is for everyone, **not just heralds**!
description_web: The experience of court is a true team effort. From the populace in the seats to the entourage of a baronial presentation, from the guards at the back of court to the herald and Royalty on the dais, come learn how to make court a more theatrical, immersive, and enjoyable experience for all. The class will consist of a presentation, followed by discussion and (time permitting) hands-on scenarios.

name: Long-Armed Cross Stitch: Attractive, Authentic
description_book: More than just a background stitch in Assisi work, it goes faster, and is prettier, than common cross stitch. Versatile and widely used late period!
description_web: More than just a background stitch (as in Assisi work), it is a versatile stitch that was used in colorful embroideries. It goes faster, and is prettier, than common cross stitch. In late period, it was used on a broad variety of household objects, often to beautiful effect. We will look at photos of a wide variety of extant examples. Then, those new to the stitch will learn to do the stitch.

name: The *Yezidi*, People of the Peacock
description_book: The *Yezidi* (in Bible as the *Ezid*) are a reclusive, Zoroastrian minority of pre-Sumerian origin that still exist in Iraq, Kuwait, and abroad.
description_web: The *Yezidi*, biblically known as the *Ezid*, are a reclusive, Zoroastrian minority of pre-Sumerian origin that still exist in Iraq, Kuwait, and abroad. Learn about these interesting people, their customs, and why they are believed to be "Devil-Worshipers."

name: Beyond Baklava: Sweets of the Islamic World
description_book: Explore the rich and luscious history of sweets, and taste lost delicacies developed in and spread throughout the medieval Muslim nations.

name: *Banchetti* Ravioli
description_book: Rich ravioli, another rich ravioli, and a oblong Lombardy-style ravioli from the 1549 Italian cookbook *Banchetti*.
description_web: A ravioli made of beef fat, eggs, cheese, raisins, and spices for covering all kinds of fowl or by itself. A ravioli made from capon breast, hard cheese, fatty cheese, pork belly, eggs, herbs in oil, and spices. A ravioli made with Swiss chard, hard cheese, eggs, sugar, and spices.

name: Four-Couple English Country Dance
description_book: My favorite ECDs are for four couples and feature beautiful floor patterns rather than complicated steps. *Hyde Park, Faine I Would, Dull Sir John*.
description_web: My favorite ECDs are for four couples in a square, and feature beautiful floor patterns rather than complicated steps. We'll cover *Hyde Park, Faine I Would If I Could*, and *Dull Sir John*. No experience required, but it helps.

name: Board Games
description_book: This class will review board games already taught, or teach new ones. If you have a game you want to learn - come and ask!
description_web: This class will review board games already taught, or teach new ones. If you have a game you want to learn - come and ask!

name: Basic Middle Eastern Percussion.
description_book: Learn the basics of Middle Eastern rhythms and counting. This class covers the basic foundation rhythms of North Africa and Central Asia.
description_web: Come learn the basics of Middle Eastern rhythms and counting. This class will cover the basic foundation rhythms of North Africa and Central Asia, as well as how to interweave these with the common Western and South African rhythms commonly heard at most SCA drum circles. Basic frame drum and *riq*.

name: Bardic Coaching
description_book: Participants perform a piece of their choosing, 3 to 5 minutes long. They receive personal feedback and attention to enhance performance skills.
description_web: Participants perform a piece of their choosing, 3 to 5 minutes long. They receive personal feedback and attention to enhance performance skills. Any style of performance is acceptable.

name: Lefty Fencing 101
description_book: Learn the secrets of lefty fencing, and how a fight changes. For all skill levels and hand preferences.

name: The Poleax Techniques of Paulus Hector Mair
description_book: Period poleax techniques that stress using the width of the ax in both defensive and offensive fashion applicable to SCA heavy list use.
description_web: Period poleax techniques that stress using the width of the ax in both defensive and offensive fashion applicable to SCA heavy list use.

name: Nalbinding for Lefties
description_book: Nalbinding isn't difficult, but can be confusing if you are left-handed. Learn the Oslo stitch specifically for lefties. Bring needle if you have one.
description_web: Nalbinding isn't difficult, but directions can be confusing if you are left-handed. In this class I will teach the Oslo stitch specifically from the left-handed perspective. Bring a nalbinding or darning needle if you have one.

name: Historical Uses of Poisons
description_book: A rundown of the weaponization of poisons in history garnered from various resources.
description_web: A review of the weaponization of poisonous plants (and two rocks) as recorded in history. A summary garnered from various resources, the compilation paints a unique picture of warfare and weaponization techniques from several cultures.

name: Planning a Feast
description_book: How to design a menu, figure out how much to cook, plan logistics, and everything else you need to consider to ensure a successful feast.

name: Basic Hand Sewing
