description_book: Learn period methods of seaming and hemming, fabric traits, and how to reduce thread wear and tangling. Fabric, thread, needles supplied.
description_web: Learn period methods of seaming and hemming, fabric traits, and how to reduce thread wear and tangling. Fabric, thread, and needles will be supplied. Please bring scissors if you have them. This course is appropriate for adults and for children the parents consider old enough to handle the needles safely. For children under 10, it would be helpful to have the parent present.
fee_itemization:
5 pages @ .10 page
materials include fabric, needles, and thread

name: Courts of Love, Law, and Equity
description_book: Do Eleanor's Courts of Love in view of Henry's innovation of Courts of Equity reveal the birth of modern law in an epic 12th-century marital spat?
description_web: Do Eleanor's Courts of Love in view of Henry's innovation of Courts of Equity reveal the birth of modern law in an epic 12th-century marital spat?

name: Relief Carving Techniques for Teens
description_book: Participants will use basic relief carving techniques to create a clay tile. Class is geared toward teens 12-18. All youth guidelines apply.
description_web: Participants will use basic relief carving techniques to create a clay tile. This class is geared toward teens 12-18. All Pennsic University guidelines for youth classes apply.

name: Embroidery: How Do I Do That!?!
description_book: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Come out and learn a few easy stitches!
description_web: Embroidery for the absolute beginner. Do you want to decorate your garb or projects but aren't sure where to start? Come learn a few easy stitches. See some examples of basic embroidery projects. Sample fabric, needle and thread provided.  Please bring scissors and a small embroidery hoop if you have them.
fee_itemization:
Embroidery floss
Needles
Hoops
Sample fabric

name: *Chiara Stella*
description_book: Come learn *Chiara Stella*, a lovely *cascarda* from *Il Ballarino*! Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.

location: Denys the Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs. AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: *Niello*: The Making and Applying
description_book: *Niello* is an ancient enamel-like material, applied to silver and gold work as metal decoration.
description_web: *Niello* is an ancient enamel-like material, applied to silver and gold work as metal decoration. It is used for background and highlighting engraving work.

name: Basics of Running a Gate
description_book: Running the Gate at an event isn't complicated *with* some advance planning. How to prep, staffing, setup, and paperwork.
description_web: Running the Gate at an event isn't complicated *with* some advance planning. How to prep beforehand, staffing, what materials are needed at the event and how to set up, and sorting out the paperwork afterwards.

name: Early Medieval Nubia
description_book: Survey of the culture of pre-1000 Nubian kingdoms of East Africa. They had strong ties to the Byzantines and were a major trade route for spices.
description_web: This survey class covers many aspects of Nubian culture before the year 1000 C.E. The artifacts of this fascinating culture were largely lost with the building of the Aswan dam. However, between 400-1000 the Nubian Kingdoms were a major trade route and had treaties with the Byzantines and the Muslim countries to their north. They were not finally conquered until the middle of the 15th century.

name: Interrogating Your Museum
description_book: It's time to get more out of your museum. Find out what to ask, who to ask, and what to do with the answers once you have them.

name: Basic *Ka-Kha-Ga-Gha*
description_book: Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *Devanagari* script used by Hindi, Sanskrit and other Indic languages.
description_web:
Written forms, pronunciations, and usage of *Devanagari* script used by Hindi and other North Indian languages. While the focus of this class is on Hindi usage, the characters and pronunciation are nearly identical for others. There will be examples in Hindi.
1st hour: Basic characters and pronunciation.
2nd hour: Vowels and half-letters; more if time and student interest allow.

name: Beginning to Drum Solo: *Maqsum and Ayoub*
description_book: An intro to the beginnings of solo techniques for *Maqsum* and *Ayoub* rhythms. An intermediate class, but all levels welcome.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period runes were rarely used for divination, but many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system for using runes this way.
description_web: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to create magickal tools, effect change at distance, work weather, awaken inanimate objects, world walk, heal/ relieve pain (even migraines), and more. An optional booklet, with additional information, will be available for $5. [Note: This class is not medical training. I am not a doctor and don't even play one in the SCA.]

name: Stories in the Bog
description_book: 6 pm - 6:45: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.
description_web: 8 pm -8:45 pm: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.
description_web: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.

name: Glass Cutting (and Basic Design) STS1
description_book: Learn to cut glass or improve your technique in glass design basics. This is **required** for the "Sheet to Shiny" track. Wear closed-toed shoes!
description_web: You can't design a stained glass piece until you know how glass "thinks". So whether or not you have glass-cutting experience, you can further your skills by taking this class!  Wear closed-toed shoes, please. This is a rolling-style class, meaning it **will not** take every person 1.5 hours, but, as there are only 2 of us, and we have limited cutters and tools, each person will get about 10 minutes of one-on-one time to learn how to cut glass. This class is **required** for the Stained Glass Track ("Sheet to Shiny") being offered this year.
fee_itemization: Offsets the glass cut up during class.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Workout at War
description_book: A workout class to keep your edge during war! Shake off your hangover / greet the day strong. For **all** fitness levels, by a NSAM certified trainer.
description_web: A workout fitness class to keep your edge during war! Shake off your hangover and/or greet the day strong. For **all** fitness levels, taught by a NSAM-certified trainer. The class will focus on bodyweight exercises (no weights); core and conditioning. Bring water. Wear comfortable shoes and clothes that function well for movement. They need not be period, though it is encouraged just to stay in the spirit of things. We will be working out on bare ground, so bring a mat of any kind if you wish.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Lists open for melee activities.
description_web: Lists open for melee activities.

name: A Hand A Day: Carolingian Lettering
description_book: Students will learn a standardized script that was developed and used during the time of Charlemagne's reign in the late eighth century.

name: HS Summer Math Help and Challenge Problems
description_book: Teenagers (and others)! Do you have summer math work? Algebra through AP calculus. Get some help, help one another, or try the challenge problems.
description_web: Teenagers (and others)! Do you have summer math work? Algebra through AP calculus. Get some help, help one another, or try the challenge problems. Don't make your parents have to remind you to open the book you carried to Pennsic. ;-)

name: Inlaid Patchwork
description_book: We'll investigate the wall-hanging technique of *intarsia* or inlaid patchwork. A small sample project will be worked in wool.
description_web: We'll investigate the wall-hanging technique of *intarsia* or inlaid patchwork. A small sample project will be worked in wool. The project will be a pin cushion. This class is an intermediate stitching/embroidery class. Please bring small, wickedly-sharp fabric scissors and paper scissors.
fee_itemization: Wool fabric, handout and thread. Please bring small, wickedly-sharp fabric scissors and paper scissors.

instructor: THL Cellach Dhonn inghean Mhic an
name: *Boutis* (Class Taught in French)
description_book: Come and learn the techniques of provencal quilting. *Boutis* is a French padded work of strung textile with some embroidery,
description_web:
Come and learn the techniques of provencal quilting. *Boutis* is a French padded work of strung textile with some embroidery. Class will be taught in French. Handout available in French and in English. It is a hands-on class. 
Venez découvrir les techniques du Boutis Provencal. Le boutis est un travail sur textile piqué et parfois rebrodé. Cours en français. Document disponible en français et anglais. Cours pratique.

name: Roman Sprang: It's in the Bag
description_book: Colorful sprang bags from the Roman site of Karanis (Egypt) provide insights into a rarely preserved fiber art. Make a replica sprang bag.
description_web: Discuss sprang examples excavated from the Roman site of Karanis in Egypt (http://users.stlcc.edu/mfuller/KaranisTextiles.html) and try to duplicate one of the patterns to create a bag. Bring your own frame or purchase one of my 5 frames. I will provide some wool, but please bring your own if possible. Beginners are welcome; can sit-in, listen and watch.
fee_itemization: Only if you want to purchase one of my basic sprang frames.

name: Beginning Bobbin Lace
description_book: Three-day class for a total of 9 hours. Learn the basic movements and make three basic projects. Start a period pattern.
description_web: This is a three-day class for a total of 9 hours of bobbin lace! First Day: Students will learn the basic movements of bobbin lace and begin a project. Second Day: Students will finish the project and learn some simple grounds. Third Day: Students will begin a period pattern from the *Nüw Modelbuch*.
fee_itemization: $30 – One-time fee for all three days. Includes pillow with cover, bobbin holder, 10 pair of bobbins, pins, handout, patterns

name: The Wild Hunt
description_book: The Wild Hunt is a folk myth with many variations involving interaction between humans and a group of supernatural, other-world riders.
description_web: The Wild Hunt is a folk myth with many variations involving interaction between humans and a group of supernatural riders. Sometimes *fae*, sometimes dead, sometimes associated with leaders from Odin to Mother Holle. We'll explore many aspects of this phenomenon.

name: Beginner Dance for Children/Families
description_book: Some simple steps and dances will be taught to introduce children of all ages and their families to period European dancing. No experience needed.

name: Thumb Ring Archery
description_book: Learn how to shoot like a Mongol. Requires a horse bow and arrows at least 4" longer than your finger draw. Some rings will be available for sale.
description_web: Learn to shoot the way Mongols and other steppes and horse archers did. Lord Naran Numuchi, Bow Khan of the Great Dark Horde, Companion of the Order of the Yew Bow (Atlantia), Ponte Alto Baronial Marshal, and many times Archery Champion, has been shooting thumb ring since 1998, and has focused on the use and history of static-eared recurve bows the whole time.

name: Woodworking: Older Work-Holding Devices
description_book: A discussion of older or primitive work-holding devices and methods for working with wood.
description_web: A discussion of older or primitive work-holding devices and methods for working with wood. Holding the wood still while pounding a mortise chisel into it is only the start. Modern vices are nice, but what did they use in period? Will cover an array of setups to cover most needs.

name: Medieval Pottery Kiln Building
description_book: Build a medieval English-style kiln from scratch using local clay & straw, with discussion of principles and precedents. Partial attendance OK. Muddy!
description_web:
We will build a medieval English-style kiln from scratch using local clay and straw, with discussion of principles and precedents. Partial attendance OK. Potters, ask to use my wheel (Okewode Hall, #160 Battle Rd) or hand-build pots to fire when dry.
Kiln site: Long Way, between North Gate & Shadowclans Cathedral.

name: Christmas (Music) in July: Part 1
description_book: Music-reading session on period music for 12th Night or Wassail. Singers and instrumentalists welcome. Public domain music, handout, no charge.
description_web: Bring your singing voice or instrument to a music-reading session featuring SCA-period Christmas/Yule music for 12th Night or Wassail. Public domain music, handout provided, no charge. This class is a repeat from Pennsic 42, 43 and 44.

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: Fool's School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/10, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Wireworking/Cold Metalworking Day
description_book: Wire weaving, bead wrapping and more.
description_web: Wire weaving, bead wrapping and more.

name: Period Sauces and Mustards
description_book: Creation of period sauces and mustards.

name: Leatherwork Day
description_book: A chance for leather workers of all skill levels to meet, share knowledge and work on projects as well as for novices to learn and ask questions.
description_web: Leatherwork Day is a place for leather workers of all skill levels to meet and share knowledge and work on projects, as well as a great learning opportunity for novices. Stop by any time to look around, ask questions, or just hang out and work on your own projects. We plan on being there from 9 to 5.

name: Law in the Lands of Peace
description_book: A class on *Fiqh*, Muslim law, taught in persona from the point of view of the Maliki school.
description_web: A class on *Fiqh*, Muslim law, taught in persona from the point of view of the Maliki school.

name: Fun with Body Parts I: Relics
description_book: Miscellaneous body parts more precious than jewels? An irreverent look at the cult of the saints.
description_web: Miscellaneous body parts more precious than jewels? An irreverent look at the cult of the saints, a phenomenon which led to an international business in bones, daring thefts and major con jobs.

name: Glass Cutting "Sheet to Shiny" STS2
description_book: This class is **required** for (and only open to) the "Sheet to Shiny" folks. We'll be cutting out your projects! Wear closed-toed shoes.
description_web: This class is **required** for (and only open to) the "Sheet to Shiny" folks. We'll be cutting out your projects. Observers are welcome.

name: Duh! What's a Mead?
description_book: A basic, get-you-going mead class with hints and ideas on how to get you up and brewing once you get home.

name: How to Run "It Takes My Child to Raze a Village"
description_book: The basics of running a parent-child focused event to help further the future generation's involvement in the SCA.
fee_itemization:
$5 - How to Run ITMC booklet
$15 - Book of 50+ Youth Activities

name: Open Knit
description_book: Stuck on a project, need help understanding a pattern or just want to knit and chat with others? Come and join a knitter's circle.

name: Henna History and Application
description_book: Learn how and why henna was used in period, and how you can use it yourself. We will mix some henna in class; everyone gets some to try.
description_web: Learn how and why henna was used in period, including traditions, materials, and techniques, and how you can use it yourself today. We will mix some henna in class, which for me (becoming a professional artist) was the hardest part to learn; everyone gets some to use and take.
fee_itemization: One cone of fresh henna paste. You may also take the class without this, or bring your own.

name: Roman Lamps
description_book: Hands-on making a clay lamp with a mold, and some history of the Roman lamp.
description_web: Roman lamps were used throughout Europe as a practical lighting source as well as a decorative element. Students will have a chance to create their own lamp using a plaster mold and embellishing it with their own imagery.

name: Gift-Giving to Royalty
description_book: A discussion of what is good and not so good to give to seated royalty.

name: Beginner Atlatl Throwing
description_book: How to throw atlatl darts effectively. **Atlatl Range**

name: Whorl and Distaff Boggy Workshop
description_book: Spindle sticks, removable whorls and various styles of distaffs for wool spinning. Come enjoy Bog Univ. during the 'safe' daylight hours by the Lake.
description_web: Hands-on: spindle sticks, removable whorls and various styles of distaffs (distaves) for wool spinning. This 4-hour workshop offers students a relaxed and inspiring atmosphere to study, handle and spin on many re-created types of Viking, medieval, and early modern examples of recreated archaeological spindles as well as hand, waist and free-standing distaffs/distaves. Students are encouraged to bring wool to spin, to eke out wool provided by teacher. Students can use loaners as well as purchase spindle, whorl and distaff examples in class. Examples range from $15-$70. Bring your spindle and distaff for show-and-tell if you wish. Come see the Bog in daylight next to the Lake. It is helpful if students study my Youtube videos before class here:  https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjUCUOUGq_WC-sv2N_qfIhpJDi8LbR-9U or search Youtube for missingspindle

name: Morris Games
description_book: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic tac toe).
description_web: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic tac toe).

name: 16th-Century Limp Binding (Long-Stitch)
description_book: An all-day class making a limp vellum binding with long-stitched exposed spine. No prior experience needed.
description_web: An all-day class where students will learn to make a 16th-century limp vellum-covered book with decorative long-stitched exposed spine. Students may bring two matching beads if they like (must be no more than 10mm in diameter). No prior knowledge of bookbinding required, but it won't hinder.
fee_itemization: Fee includes a 5-page handout, vellum, leather for spine, paper for blank book, beads for the ties, and linen thread.

name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Woodwork Shop Time
description_book: Bring your wood and your tools! I'll be around to help and to talk and to pass out advice.
description_web: When learning, we all need some time to try doing things while someone who has been there before is watching. This class makes some time at Pennsic for just that! Whether or not you have taken my classes, you are welcome to come in and use my bench(es) and ask for advice. This will overlap with a discussion on early work holding methods. All day both Thursdays!

name: Beginning Middle Eastern Dance
description_book: Come and dance! Suitable for all levels, whether just beginning or brushing up. A few basic steps and styles, and of course the (available) history.
description_web: Come and dance! Suitable for all levels, whether just beginning or brushing up. A few basic steps and styles, and of course the (available) history. Focus will be active. Warm-up, learn basic moves, learn how to walk and step, and learn a few of the dance styles that come from this region. Welcome to both sessions if you really want to practice.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.  Student Performance, Thursday, 8/1,1 6-7 pm at the Amphitheater. Bring a blanket or chair to enjoy the performance on the green.

name: Pennsic Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! Singing in the Choir is an intense and rewarding experience with a concert Thursday War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! This year's concert theme is "Of Love and Whimsy." The repertoire includes pieces by Morley, Marenzio, Scandello, Gesualdo, Dowland, and the ever-popular Anonymous. Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on Thursday evening of War Week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is helpful, but not required if you learn the music in advance. Sheet music and audio tracks are available online now at https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsicxliiichoirs

name: Early Bird Tournament
description_book: Pick fights, take names and get acquainted.
description_web: Pick fights, take names and get acquainted. The purpose of this tourney isn't to win the most bouts, but to find the most interesting facts about your opponents. **"More talk! Less fighting!"** Who will the MIC give the bird to this year?

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: *Squilina*
description_book: *Squilina* is an unusual, fun, and energetic dance for three by Fabritio Caroso. Knowledge of 16th-century footwork highly recommended.

name: Figure-Drawing Salon
description_book: Draw from live models in medieval poses. Practice your sketching, get feedback, or just relax and work on your drawing. Bring drawing supplies.
description_web: Draw from live models in medieval poses. Practice your sketching, get feedback, or just relax and work on your drawing. Bring pencils, pastels, charcoal and paper of your choice. Some limited supplies will be available.﻿

name: Juggling Practice
description_book: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.
description_web: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.

name: Concerning Mohammed and the Well-Guided Caliphs
description_book: A history of the early years of Islam, taught in persona from the standpoint of a later Muslim.
description_web: Concerning Our Lord the Prophet Mohammed (Blessings upon Him, his Kindred and his Companion Train) and the Well-Guided Caliphs. A history of the early years of Islam, taught in persona from the standpoint of a later Muslim.

name: Beginning Heraldic Blazon
description_book: Learn the basics of how heralds describe armory.
description_web: Learn the basics of how heralds describe armory. Level may vary based on who shows up, but aimed at beginners in heraldry.

name: History of Painted Cloth and Printed Textiles
description_book: A discussion with extant examples of the making and use of painted cloth and printed textiles in the Middle Ages.
description_web: A discussion with extant examples of the making and use of painted cloth and printed textiles in the Middle Ages. Documenting the spread of textile painting and printing from the Far East into Europe: the methods, the materials, the extant examples and the confusion. Please join Facebook group: Printed Textile Classes for Pennsic 45.

name: Oh! So That Is a Mead! Then What Is This?
description_book: Part 2 of the basic mead class "Duh! What's a Mead?"  This class goes a bit further into mead-making.
description_web: This class goes into the different types of meads plus what roles different types of yeast play on meads. We touch a little on temperature-based issues and try to answer questions people may have.

name: Make your Embroidery Pop: Using Padded Work
description_book: Learn how padded work can be added to your embroidery to add that little something extra. Hands-on practice and historic references provided.
description_web: Learn how padded work can be added to your embroidery to add that little something extra. No experience necessary. A hands-on class to try various techniques. Handouts with historic references provided. Will have 15 kits available or bring your own hoop, embroidery needle and thread.

name: Tips and Tricks for Making Garb Easier and Better
description_book: Not period, but helpful tricks for making the job of sewing your own garb easier, and the result better.
description_web: Not all methods are period, but this class aims to help the novice to intermediate sewer overcome some of the hurdles encountered when making simple garb.

name: Open Poetry, Storytelling, Spoken Word Circle
description_book: Bring lunch and your poetry, prose, and tales for this spoken word bardic circle!  *Bardic Safe Space*
description_web: Bring lunch and your poetry, prose, and tales for this spoken word bardic circle!  *Bardic Safe Space*

name: Making an SCA Documentary
description_book: Explore the practical and legal realities of creating an SCA documentary.
description_web: Have you ever thought about making a documentary about the SCA? Do you enjoy bringing a video camera to SCA events and want to do something with all that footage? This class will explore the practical and legal realities of making a documentary of the SCA. From shooting to editing to proper procedure of working with the SCA, we will discuss what works and what doesn't to make your project go smoothly and come up with great results.

name: Largess
description_book: A discussion of largess that is greeted with smiles and those that get quizzical looks.

name: A Short History of the Roman Catholic Rosary
description_book: We'll look at the development of the prayers and practices surrounding the rosary in the late Middle Ages and Renaissance.
description_web: We'll look at the development of the prayers and practices surrounding the rosary in the late Middle Ages and Renaissance.

name: Shifty *Chiftetelli* Dancing
description_book: Explore slow rounded dance movements suitable for dancing to the sensuous Turkish *Ciftetelli* rhythm. Some belly dancing experience is helpful.
description_web: Explore slow rounded dance movements suitable for dancing to the sensuous Turkish *Ciftetelli* rhythm. Some belly dancing experience is helpful. Bring your zills or drums if you want to practice the rhythm.

name: Ottoman Singing
description_book: Learning to sing the 15th-century Ottoman classical composition, "*Kâr-ı Muhteşem,*" (The Magnificence) as composed by Abdülkadir Meragi.
description_web: We will be teaching the Ottoman classical composition from the 15th century, "*Kâr-ı Muhteşem*," (The Magnificence) that was/is commonly performed in the *Mevlevi* Whirling Dervish *sema*. This piece of music is typically performed with singing. As such, we will be teaching a singing class to learn this song in the original Ottoman Turkish language. What will you learn and experience: a 15th-c. Seljuk/Ottoman song "*Kâr-ı Muhteşem*" and its history; the musical modality *Makam Rast*; pronunciation of Ottoman Turkish along with a brief history and etymology. The 4 classes will be progressive; however, students may join in when they wish, although attendance at all the classes is strongly encouraged. Students may join the class's Facebook page in advance to orient themselves to the song and class: https://www.facebook.com/groups/398762226986519/

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. No fee. String provided.

name: Viking Dairy Processing
description_book: A hands-on class to learn about milk processing and cheese making in the Viking age.
description_web: Milk and milk products were essential to surviving Scandinavian winters and long sea voyages during the Viking era. Join us for a hands-on class which will focus on dairying and cheese products from the Norse world. Starting with milk, which would go bad rather quickly, and using culture and equipment, we will turn it into four (or more) products that not only last well on their own, but can be used to preserve other food. Our *mjólk* (milk) will turn into *skyr* (cheese), *mysa* (whey), *smjör* (butter), and *aft* (buttermilk). This will be done using period tools.

name: Introduction to Spinning *Poi*
description_book: Decorate your own *poi* and learn to spin it in this beginners' class. Focus on proper spinning techniques and foot placement along spinning planes.
description_web: In this one-hour workshop, you will learn some of the basic *poi* movements and terminology necessary to get you started. *Poi* spinning is a great low-impact workout that will help you to improve your coordination and give your fitness routine some "flair"! Fee includes your choice of Home of *Poi* - Sock *Poi* and a storage pouch. Handout with class review and contacts. Refreshments are also served. This year we will be decorating our *poi* to give them our own personal twist...We hope to see you there!
fee_itemization: Material fee includes your own poi to decorate with fabric pens provided, handout with brief history & class outline & refreshments served.

name: Introduction to Scribal Materials
description_book: Introduction to the materials used to make scrolls.
description_web: Interested in the scribal arts, but not sure what all the materials are? This class will give you the opportunity to see and feel many of the commonly used materials in the SCA scribal arts as well as discuss how to build your art kit without breaking the bank.

name: *Skomorokh*: Comedic Minstrel Theatre of Russia
description_book: An unbroken lineage spanning 600 years, *the skomorokhi* were the oft-persecuted minstrels, buffoons, harlequins, puppeteers of medieval Russia.
description_web: With an unbroken lineage spanning more than six centuries, learn of the *skomorokhi*, the oft-persecuted minstrels, buffoons, harlequins, musicians, and puppeteers of medieval and Renaissance Russia!

name: *De Lapidibus*
description_book: A class on gemstones, taught in (Muslim) persona, based on period sources.
description_web: A class on gemstones, taught in (Muslim) persona, based on period sources.
fee_itemization: no materials, probably a one page handout. No fee for handout.

name: Coronation Ceremonies from Period Sources
description_book: Creating "authentic-as-possible" SCA coronations from period services. Methods of converting period liturgies to secular forms. Sources and examples.
description_web: Creating "authentic-as-possible" SCA coronation ceremonies from period *ordines*. Methods and philosophies of secularizing period liturgies. Examples and sources. The presenter has designed several successful "verbatim as possible" ceremonies in several kingdoms for Anglo-Saxon, Holy Roman Empire, English, Danish, and other personas.

name: Keeping Bees in the Knowne World
description_book: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.
description_web: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.

name: Putting it Together STS3
description_book: Assemble your cut pieces into a shiny! This class is **required** for the "Sheet to Shiny" track. Bring something to work on - tools are limited.
description_web: Assemble your cut piece into a shiny! This class is **required** for the "Sheet to Shiny" track. Bring something to work on - tools are limited, and there will be wait time in between steps for some people. **Also** - if you took this class last year, we had **overwhelming response**, so you will not be allowed to take it again if we have more attendees than anticipated.

name: Ships in the SCA Period: A Chronological Overview
description_book: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.
description_web: A comprehensive overview of the development of ships in western Europe between 600 and 1600.

name: Building a Household: An Oldcastle Model
description_book: There are many kinds of households in the Society. We will discuss several of them, focusing primarily on Clan Oldcastle, the one I know best.

name: Your Persona in an Hour
description_book: What should you ask to create and develop your persona? Where can you find the answers? Come and find out! For research newbies and library vets.
description_web: What questions should you ask to create and develop your persona? Where can you find the answers? Come and find out! Research newbies and library veterans are both welcome!

name: Hammer of the Witches: Witch Hunts and Trials
description_book: Examines the various texts, tactics, and histories of witch-hunters, along with information on the enemies they believed they fought.

name: Beginning Sprang
description_book: An intro to sprang, a method of creating rectangular pieces of stretchy fabric. You will make a piece perfect for turning into a small pouch.
description_web: An introduction to sprang, a method of creating rectangular pieces of stretchy fabric by plaiting threads on a frame. Although primarily found in several early period cultures, there are extant pieces from late period (as well as colonial America). I will be focusing on the basic method of sprang but will mention some of the variant techniques that can be used to embellish your work. You will make a piece perfect for turning into a small pouch.
fee_itemization: a pvc frame, yarn, and accessories.

name: Hounds Abound!
description_book: Interested in how hounds were kept? What were the different types of hounds? What is coursing? Come learn about all things canine!
description_web: Come learn about hounds in the Middle Ages! We'll be looking at different types of hounds, how they were cared for, how they were hunted and how they fit into everyday life.

name: Judging and Preparing Raw Fleeces
description_book: Learn how to look at a raw fleece for personal projects, plus how to prepare a fleece for washing, carding/spinning preparation, and more.
description_web:
We will be looking at a multitude of sheep, goat and camelid breeds for their fleeces and how to judge them in raw state. How to look at a fleece for quality, use, color ranges, as well as beginning breeds and fleeces for the hand spinner, comparing fleeces of the same breeds, washing and carding, spinning "in the grease" and the advantages/disadvantages of leaving a fleece with lanolin.

**This will be a HANDS-ON CLASS! Come in your old clothing and be prepared to get dirty & wet.**
We will be providing gloves for those who might have sensitivities to lanolin/raw fleeces. Feel free to bring your spindles/wheels, your personal carders, to try spinning in the grease as well.

name: Beginner Dance: 15th-Century Italian
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class starts with basic steps and patterns, then teaches fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class starts with basic steps and patterns, then teaches fun, simple dances from 15th-century Italy. No partners required.

name: Nine Days Wonder: Day 1
description_book: Dancing tour of the Highlands (B-block). Start location: Corner of Tours and Agincourt (B07). End location: Same.
description_web:
We are re-enacting William Kempe's famous "Nine Days Wonder"! Kempe was an actor who worked with Shakespeare and who danced 100 km from London to Norwich as a publicity stunt in 1602. Dance 5 out of 9 days and receive a souvenir token! Check the book/web for start locations. We dance at noon each day.
Today: Dancing tour of the Highlands (B-block). Start location: Corner of Tours and Agincourt (B07). End location: Same.

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater: Open Youth Rehearsal
description_book: Known World Players, Youth Readers' Theatre, will give the youth (ages 10-17) an opportunity to experience a low-stress theatre production.
description_web: Known World Players, Youth Readers' Theatre, will give the youth (ages 10-17) an opportunity to experience a low-stress theatre experience by creating a staged reading of Shakespeare's *A Midsummer Night's Dream* (an edited version for children and time). A staged reading means that the actors will be performing the play with the script in hand. No audition necessary; attend both rehearsals. To be performed Friday, 8/5, in the Performing Arts Tent at 6:00 pm.

name: Improv Theater Games for Improving Your Character
description_book: Theater games for learning improvisation. Good for *commedia*, theater, and living in persona.
description_web: Come learn and play theater games focused on the art of improvisation. Skills learned here can be used to improve any kind of performance including the portrayal of your persona in the SCA.

name: Beginning Tatting, Part 1
description_book: Tatting is a type of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziploc bag, can be done in the car, or at court!
description_web: Tatting is a type of lacemaking. Supplies can be found at most craft stores. Learn a craft that fits in a Ziploc bag, and can be done in the car or at court! Focus is on learning how to make both parts of the double stitch flip every time, forming the double stitch and making a ring of double stitches.
fee_itemization: I provide prewound shuttles and a handout with directions and projects.

name: Reversible Embroidery
description_book: Blackwork and cross stitch: how to do them; how to recognize which patterns work, which don't.
description_web: Blackwork and cross stitch: how to do them; how to recognize which patterns work, which don't. While reversible stitching was rare in the SCA period, it is an interesting challenge for the experienced needleworker.

name: Henna in the SCA Period
description_book: Where, when, and how henna was used from 600-1600. Historical descriptions, paintings, designs, and recipes.

name: Twelve Plants through the Ages
description_book: Follow twelve plants through time from Galen to the modern day. How plants were used for medicine in period, and how that is supported today.
description_web: Follow twelve plants through time from Galen to the modern day. What plants were used medicinally in period, and which of these uses have been proven by contemporary science. I am covering 12 plants this year, and plan additional material in following years.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! Start with basic steps and patterns, and then learn simple English Country Dances.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach simple English Country Dances.

name: Card Games
description_book: We'll review card games and let you practice playing them. If you have a game you want to learn, come and ask.
description_web: We'll review card games and let you practice playing them. If you have a game you want to learn, come and ask.

name: Russian Folk Singing
description_book: Learn to sing the 16th-17th-century Russian folk song, *ой да не вечер* ("Oy da ne vecher").
description_web: This class will focus on learning to sing one of the most popular traditional Russian folk songs, *ой да не вечер* ("Oy da ne vecher") ("Oh, what an evening"). Traditionally a folk song from 16th-17th-century Cossack culture, it sings of a Cossack's nightmare which is eventually translated by his captain. Students will learn the song's story as well as the simple melody, plus lyrics in traditional Russian. Students may join the Facebook group to orient and familiarize themselves with this beautiful song. https://www.facebook.com/groups/1726614767561222/?ref=bookmarks

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Food for Traveling Afoot
description_book: Viking hikers eat well! Learn about tasty packable foods that we can prepare using ingredients from the Norse archaeological record.
description_web: Viking hikers eat well! Learn about tasty packable foods that we can prepare using ingredients from the Norse archaeological record. In this two-our class we will discuss foods of the archaeological record of the Norse People in the Viking age. We will have a few samples of foods that we used while Viking hiking and camping in a period way. We will make a sample food during class for everyone to taste. Food options which will be made during class will be weather dependent. However, options include, but are not limited to, stew, butter, oatcake, loaf bread, and flat bread.

name: *Zil* Patterns for the Beginner I
description_book: Basic patterns for playing *zils* (finger cymbals) based on 3s. Please bring your own set of *zils*.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Open Scribal Time/Scribal Play Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Closing Your Clothes
description_book: Survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for.
description_web: Survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for. Includes information on where to purchase these items. I will pass around actual closures and demonstrate their use.

name: Morning Cry: Service and Performance
description_book: The task of a cry herald is to get important information about the event to its attendees as quickly and effectively as possible. Come learn how!
description_web: The task of a cry herald is to get important information about the event to its attendees as quickly and effectively as possible. Come learn how to successfully prepare and deliver an effective and memorable morning cry.

name: Where's Lord Waldo?
description_book: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.
description_web: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.

name: The Great Plague of 1347
description_book: We'll examine how the plague changed everything and made the modern world we know today.
description_web: The plague of 1347 was a cause of great upheaval in Europe, affecting the daily life of all strata of society and changing the world. This class will examine how the plague changed everything and made the modern world we know today.

name: Science of Food Preservation
description_book: Not a "how-to" but a "how-come?" class. We will look at medieval preservation with modern knowledge, and see what worked and why.
description_web: Not a "how-to" but a "how-come?" class. We will look at medieval preservation techniques with modern knowledge, see what worked and why, and where the risks were. We will also try to shed light on some modern ideas of food preservation as they relate to re-creating medieval preserved foods.

name: Warping a Warp-Weighted Loom
description_book: Warp-weighted looms can be imposingly large and strange. Let's learn how to warp one on a smaller and more human scale.
description_web: A full-size warp-weighted loom, as built in period, can be imposingly large and strange. We're going to learn how to warp one on a smaller and more human scale. We'll be working in pairs, with space for up to 12 people working hands-on. We'll have a follow-up class with hands-on practice weaving on the warp we've created.

name: Beginning to Drum Solo: *Malfuf, Syrto, Chifti*
description_book: An intro to the beginnings of solo techniques for *Malfuf, Syrto*, and *Chiftitelli* rhythms. An intermediate class, but all levels welcome.

name: Period-Like Printing with Computers
description_book: We will discuss the availability of typefaces for computers which approximate (or recreate) period-looking type.
description_web:
We will discuss the availability of modern typefaces for computers which approximate (or recreate) period-looking type. 
Printing in the SCA is one of the few aspects of our endeavor where we neglect period-ness, and in this class we will explore ways, using typefaces, art, and layout techniques, to make our publications look more period. (Please leave your Times New Roman and Helvetica at the gate!)
Bring a thumb drive to class, so you can download any of the free fonts we discuss!
fee_itemization: 24-page, hand-sewn chapbook containing the materials covered in this class.

name: Intermediate Gresley Dances
description_book: These are from 1500 England and different from the English Country dances. A bit more challenging than the beginner ones with a few unique steps.

name: Woodwork Shop Time
description_book: Bring your wood and your tools! I'll be around to help and to talk and to pass out advice.
description_web: When learning, we all need some time to try doing things while someone who has been there before is watching. This class makes some time at Pennsic for just that! Whether or not you have taken my classes, you are welcome to come in and use my bench(es) and ask for advice. This will overlap with a discussion on early work holding methods. All day both Thursdays!

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater: Open Adult Rehearsal
description_book: Join a low-stress theatre experience by KWP Readers' Theatre, creating a staged reading of *Life Is A Dream* by Pedro Calderon de la Barca.
description_web: Known World Players Readers' Theatre provides a low-stress opportunity and theatre experience creating a staged reading of Pedro Calderon de la Barca's *Life Is A Dream*. A staged reading means that the actors will be performing the play with the script in hand. No audition necessary; attend both rehearsals. To be performed Friday, 8/5, in the Performing Arts Tent at 7:00 pm.

name: *Shibori*: Japanese Shaped-Resist Dyeing
description_book: An overview of *shibori* techniques from the simple rings of the Nara period to the elaborate *tsujigahana* of Momoyama.
fee_itemization: $1 for handkerchief to use as a stitch and knot sampler.

name: Heraldic Commentary
description_book: This is vital to our submission process but so few participate. We'll discuss who should do it (all book heralds) and how to do it well.
description_web: OSCAR is one of the best educational tools available for SCA heraldry. It has sped up the submission process and made it accessible to everyone. Laurel and the deputy sovereigns rely heavily on the commentary members of the Colleges provide there but few actually comment. We'll talk about who should be commenting, how to get started, what not to say and much more. People of all levels of experience and interest in our heraldic process are welcomed.

name: Bridging the SCA Generation Gap
description_book: Newcomers and veterans can learn from each other to make our Society better. Learn how one Barony became more welcoming and grew by leaps and bounds.

name: The Way of Saint James: Pilgrims to Santiago
description_book: We examine the legends, history, battles, miracles, and lore of Spain's *Camino de Santiago*, in period and today, taught by former pilgrims.
description_web: We will examine the legends, history, and lore of the *Camino de Santiago*, with special emphasis on the nature of medieval pilgrimage, sites of special historic, religious, and cultural importance along the route, plus advice for planning and completing the pilgrimage today. Taught by former pilgrims. *¡Buen camino!*

name: DaVinci Code, Templars, and Archaeology
description_book: Find out the perspective of a field archaeologist (with an interest in the Crusades) on the bestselling murder mystery.
description_web: The ruined castles of the Knights Templar are scattered across the Middle East and Europe. Templar castles and churches provide insights into this order of Crusading knights. Master Michael has visited several of these archaeological sites and examined the ruins. Find out the perspective of a field archaeologist (with an interest in the Crusades) on the bestselling murder mystery.

name: Ribbon Moravian Stars
description_book: Learn a little about the medieval roots of the Moravian Church, their beautiful stars, and make a ribbon star to take home.
description_web: While the Moravian Church has its roots in period, the beautiful stars associated with their artwork is post-period. We will have a brief overview of the period history of the church and learn to make a ribbon Moravian Star. These are very easy and make great largesse to hand out at events. Please bring small sharp scissors, such as embroidery scissors.
fee_itemization:
.50 for ribbon for the project.
0.50 copy fees for handouts.

name: Easy ECD for All Experience Levels
description_book: Not only a beginner class, this is for anyone who would like to learn more in depth. Includes *Gathering Peascods, Half Hannikin, Sellenger's Round.*
description_web: Not only a beginner class, this is for anyone who would like to learn English Country Dance as reconstructed directly from Playford, and not necessarily as done in current tradition. Includes *Gathering Peascods, Half Hannikin, Sellenger's Round.*

name: Introduction to *Go*
description_book: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.
description_web: A basic introduction to the Japanese game of *Go*.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work started in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work started in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Basic Middle Eastern Percussion.
description_book: Learn the basics of Middle Eastern rhythms and counting. This class covers the basic foundation rhythms of North Africa and Central Asia.
description_web: Come learn the basics of Middle Eastern rhythms and counting. This class will cover the basic foundation rhythms of North Africa and Central Asia, as well as how to interweave these with the common Western and South African rhythms commonly heard at most SCA drum circles. Basic frame drum and *riq*.

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: The Poleax Techniques of Paulus Hector Mair
description_book: Period poleax techniques that stress using the width of the ax in both defensive and offensive fashion applicable to SCA heavy list use.
description_web: Period poleax techniques that stress using the width of the ax in both defensive and offensive fashion applicable to SCA heavy list use.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Lists open for melee activities.
description_web: Lists open for melee activities.

name: Advanced Labyrinths
description_book: A more in-depth look into the symbolism and use of the labyrinth in specific cultures (to be determined by participants).
description_web: A more in-depth look at the symbolism and use of the labyrinth in certain cultures. Participants will help guide the discussion with their questions.

name: Learning to Knot
description_book: Students will learn several types of knots, then use the knot techniques to create a knotted belt.
description_web:
The experts all agree that the tying of knots is an ancient accomplishment for humankind. Knotwork is the tying of knots to create decorative pieces or items of utilitarian use. It is the precursor to all forms of woven arts. As we progressed into more leisure time, we developed different and faster techniques to create textiles. Currently, the best examples of non-woven textile work is preserved in carpets and chair coverings from the Elizabethan era. During that time, it was sometimes referred to as “turkey-work”. 

Students will learn to use knots to create a knotwork belt that they may take with them. Class limit 18 students.

name: Pottery Techniques for Kids
description_book: Participants will use basic hand-building techniques to create a small clay vessel.  Class is geared toward children 6-12. Youth guidelines apply.
description_web: Participants will use basic hand-building techniques to create a small clay vessel.  This class is geared toward children 6-12. All Pennsic University guidelines for youth classes will be adhered to.

name: Enhance Your Camp
description_book: Learn how to make personal camp improvements that enhance its appearance and your quality of life with a variety of wood and craft projects.
description_web: Join us at our camp to learn about how to make personal camp improvements that can enhance both its appearance as well as your own quality of life. Most projects are made from wood with basic tools and do not require special knowledge, skills, or equipment. Handouts will be available for each camp project ($1/handout), including our camp cart, kitchen worktable, sink with foot pump, trestle table, benches, chairs, clothes rack, armor stand, canvas organizer, and more.

name: Joy and Jealousy
description_book: We'll run through two Italian pieces, *Bizzaria D'Amore* and *Contrapasso En Due*.
description_web: We'll run through two Italian pieces, *Bizzaria D'Amore* and *Contrapasso En Due*.

location: Denys the Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs. AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: Mass Project
description_book: Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. Each day we'll study and rehearse a different movement.
description_web:
Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. Each day we'll study and rehearse a different movement, starting with early period *Kyrie* and ending with a mid-15th-century *Agnus Dei*. Five-part class. We are going to do a mini-performance at the European Music Expo and a movement or two at the **Known World Choirs Performance**. Sponsored by the Known World Choir. 
Rehearsal Tent unless noted:  8/4, 4-5 pm; 8/5, 12-1 pm; 8/7, 12-1 pm; 8/9, AMPI, 3-4 pm (bring a chair); 8/10, 12-1 pm.

name: Henna Body Art for Beginners
description_book: From mixing paste from the best ingredients, to safety instruction and building your first designs, we will focus on the basics for great henna.
fee_itemization: $5 per henna cone provided to students. This is my usual rate.

name: All About *Branles*
description_book: For those who have some orientation to Arbeau's *branles*, we'll be going over as much information about as many *branles* as possible in one class.
description_web: For those who have some orientation to Arbeau's *branles*, we'll be going over as much information about as many *branles* as we can get to in one class.

name: Anglo-Saxon Saints
description_book: The saints of Anglo-Saxon England were not well-behaved. Come hear stories of miracles and mayhem: Dunstan, Walpurga, Caedmon and Caedwalla.
description_web: The saints of Anglo-Saxon England provide some of the funniest and most exciting stories available. The smith Dunstan was once said to have grabbed the devil by the nose with his pincers. Hermits and archbishops, warriors and abbesses, serial killers and herders of mice, martyrs, miracles and mayhem.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Medieval Oil Lamps
description_book: Oils were used to light lamps by all cultures throughout the Middle Ages. Learn how easy, inexpensive and, best of all, *safe* oil lamps are!
description_web: Oils were used to light lamps by all cultures throughout the Middle Ages. Learn how easy, inexpensive, compact and, best of all, *safe* oil lamps still are! Learn how to light your camp with just one bottle of cooking oil. New this year: a brief mention of 'fat' lamps will be included.
fee_itemization: copying cost for handout and wick kit materials.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.
description_web: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.

name: 4th Annual Unofficial Pennsic Half-Marathon
description_book: HRM Thora Heri of Atlantia will lead a run of roughly 13.1 miles around the Pennsic campground. All are welcome to join for all or part of the course.
description_web: The estimated 13-mile course (it is medievally inexact!) will consist of three loops around the entire Pennsic campground, plus one smaller loop around the Serengeti. Runners will meet in front of Chirurgeons' Point at 8 a.m. Water is available from the chirurgeons, but runners are encouraged to supply their own water/sports drink/snack needs. We will pass the Chirurgeons' Point three times, at roughly 4.5-mile intervals. Note: this is a group run, not a race. No times will be kept, though there will be some participant awards. The goal is fitness as part of the SCAdian lifestyle. All are welcome. Wearing medieval-style tunics instead of modern running clothing is encouraged.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Workout at War
description_book: A workout class to keep your edge during war! Shake off your hangover / greet the day strong. For **all** fitness levels, by a NSAM certified trainer.
description_web: A workout fitness class to keep your edge during war! Shake off your hangover and/or greet the day strong. For **all** fitness levels, taught by a NSAM-certified trainer. The class will focus on bodyweight exercises (no weights); core and conditioning. Bring water. Wear comfortable shoes and clothes that function well for movement. They need not be period, though it is encouraged just to stay in the spirit of things. We will be working out on bare ground, so bring a mat of any kind if you wish.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Lists open for melee activities.
description_web: Lists open for melee activities.

name: A Hand A Day: Early Gothic Calligraphy
description_book: Beginning calligraphers will use a marker to learn the techniques needed to write this 11th-12th century script successfully. All materials provided.
description_web: Early Gothic calligraphy was a popular hand used during the eleventh and twelfth centuries. In this hands-on class for beginners, students will use a calligraphy marker to learn the techniques needed to write this hand successfully. All materials provided.
fee_itemization: Interested students may purchase the marker used in class for $2

name: Medieval Gardening: An Introduction
description_book: An overview and introduction to medieval gardening, its topics, sources and values to our Society. Includes medieval gardening practices.

name: Enameling 101
description_book: Basic intro to enamel. Create a pendant; learn about wet inlay and layering of transparent glass through the sifting enamel technique.
description_web: Very basic intro to enameling. We'll address the techniques of wet inlay using heraldic colors and layering of transparent glass through the use of sifting enamels. Students will leave with a self-created pendant. Ages 12 and up preferred due to materials used in the class.
fee_itemization: Enamel 10 colors, 20 copper blanks, sifters, paper towels, water, eye droppers, spoons,

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period runes were rarely used for divination, but many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system for using runes this way.
description_web: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to create magickal tools, effect change at distance, work weather, awaken inanimate objects, world walk, heal/ relieve pain (even migraines), and more. An optional booklet, with additional information, will be available for $5. [Note: This class is not medical training. I am not a doctor and don't even play one in the SCA.]

name: Anglo-Saxon Ring Pouch
description_book: Create the only pouch an Anglo-Saxon woman would ever want or need, using period supplies and sewing techniques.
fee_itemization: All of the supplies and materials needed to make a ring pouch.

name: Organizing Your A&S Display
description_book: How to organize and lay out your research, show your process, display your creation, and present your work.
description_web: This class will demonstrate how to plan your Arts and Science display. Research, work-in-progress photos, failed attempts, process, and what you learned should be carefully laid out and presented. My background is in architecture, portfolio design, and verbal presentations.
fee_itemization: Recommended reading and visual examples of layouts.

name: Researching on the Internet
description_book: How to use the Internet to find reliable, accurate information. If there is time we will try to solve individual research issues for the students.
description_web: How to use the Internet to find reliable, accurate information. If there is time, we will try to solve individual research issues for the students. Hints about how to use this info for documentation. Includes a handout of recommended URLs and techniques for locating more.

name: Armoring: Gauntlets, Joints and Metal Forming
description_book: Joints and hands: Learn how to properly design armor so that it follows the body instead of impeding your motion. Tricks of the trade.
description_web: We'lll cover how to properly design joints, gauntlets and other critical body pieces so that they follow the motion of the body instead of impeding it. Historical and reproduction examples will be used. Also expect a discussion of tricks of the trade that make the armorer's life easier.

name: Cooking from Period Sources
description_book: How to start with a recipe that was written in period and end up with a dish that is consistent with that recipe and tastes good.
description_web: How to start with a recipe that was written in period and end up with a dish that is consistent with that recipe and tastes good. Also, a discussion of available sources for recipes.

name: Children's Dance: Branles and More!
description_book: It's never too early to learn to dance! Expect branles; other dances as time allows! (Youth under 12 require a responsible adult as per Pennsic rules)
description_web: It's never too early to learn to dance! Come learn dances fun for all ages. This class will have a focus on branles, both miming and tangle, but will include other dances as time allows! Parents are welcome and, indeed, encouraged to attend. For children under 12, Pennsic rules require a responsible adult to accompany them.

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. No fee. String provided.

name: Open Scribal Time/Scribal Play Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Fool's School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/10, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Lacemakers' Day
description_book: Come share your lace projects, from bobbin lace, *teneriffe, reticello*, etc. Learn about different grounds and try out this interesting craft.

name: Spin Like a Roman
description_book: A Roman hand distaff is light to use with delicate whorled Roman spindles. Great for fine warp yarns. Hands-on. Re-creations of archaeological finds.
description_web:
The Roman hand distaff is delightfully different in use and form for spinning well-prepared wool. Both light and very portable, its use continued in isolated areas of Europe (especially Italy) until modern times. When used with copies of archaeological finds, these removable whorl spindles produce a very delicate ‘laceweight’ yarn, suitable for warp. Demo, lecture and hands-on. Students can purchase examples in class. These examples range from $15-$50. It is helpful if students view my teaching videos online before class, but not necessary.
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjUCUOUGq_WC-sv2N_qfIhpJDi8LbR-9U
or search Youtube for missingspindle

name: Fun with Body Parts II: Pilgrimage
description_book: Need the personal intervention of a saint? Pay him or her a visit! An irreverent look at the hundreds of thousands who left home on pilgrimage.
description_web: Need the personal intervention of a saint? Pay him or her a visit! An irreverent look at the hundreds of thousands who left home on pilgrimage: who went, why, and where. Taught by someone who has been to the Big Three: Compostela, Rome, Jerusalem.

name: Seeþing Sope -or- How to Boil Medieval Soap
description_book: Turning drip lye and oils into period soap using period techniques. I will go over leaching lye and boiling soap using 16th-century manuscripts.
description_web: Turning drip lye and fats into period soap using period techniques. This class will go over leaching lye, rendering fats and boiling soap as directed by 12th- and 13th-century guild recipes and their updated 16th-century counterparts.

name: A Hat for Every Head
description_book: You're never fully dressed without a hat! This class is an overview of hats across the SCA period. Proper headwear instantly improves your garb.

name: Period Islamic Cooking
description_book: A description of a wide range of recipes from period Islamic cookbooks, along with a discussion of the available sources.
description_web: A description of a wide range of recipes from period Islamic cookbooks, along with a discussion of the available sources.

name: Introduction to Leatherwork
description_book: Introduction to the tools, materials, and techniques used in period leatherwork, including types of leather, basic construction, and decoration.
description_web: This class will focus on establishing a foundation for researching and creating period-style leatherwork, with a focus on alternatives to modern tools and techniques.
fee_itemization: Material fee covers tools and practice material students keep following the class.

name: The English Dancing Master
description_book: Have fun mastering dances from John Playford's dance manual of 1651.
description_web: John Playford's "The English Dancing Master" describes a plethora of fun dances generally identified as English Country Dances. Intended for two or more couples, they are easy to learn and fun to dance.

name: Game of the Goose
description_book: Period game in the style of "Chutes and Ladders". We will review the rules and then play through a game, dice willing.
description_web: Period game in the style of "Chutes and Ladders". We will review the rules and then play through a game, dice willing.

name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.  Student Performance, Thursday, 8/1,1 6-7 pm at the Amphitheater. Bring a blanket or chair to enjoy the performance on the green.

name: Pennsic Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! Singing in the Choir is an intense and rewarding experience with a concert Thursday War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! This year's concert theme is "Of Love and Whimsy." The repertoire includes pieces by Morley, Marenzio, Scandello, Gesualdo, Dowland, and the ever-popular Anonymous. Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on Thursday evening of War Week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is helpful, but not required if you learn the music in advance. Sheet music and audio tracks are available online now at https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsicxliiichoirs

name: KWP Pennsic Readers' Theater: Open Adult Rehearsal
description_book: Join a low-stress theatre experience by KWP Readers' Theatre, creating a staged reading of *Life Is A Dream* by Pedro Calderon de la Barca.
description_web: Known World Players Readers' Theatre provides a low-stress opportunity and theatre experience creating a staged reading of Pedro Calderon de la Barca's *Life Is A Dream*. A staged reading means that the actors will be performing the play with the script in hand. No audition necessary; attend both rehearsals. To be performed Friday, 8/5, in the Performing Arts Tent at 7:00 pm.

name: Bouquet List
description_book: Fencing list, double elimination. Entrants must be fighting for a consort.
description_web:
Entrants must be fighting for a consort (either present or not....preferred to be on the field). On entry you are given a single flower; after your second defeat you surrender it to the victor. At the end, the winner has a bouquet to present to his or her consort.
NOW is your chance to extol the virtues of your consort loudly!

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn to throw axes, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn to throw axes, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Engineering for a Mobile Theater Troupe
description_book: Methods for putting up a mobile stage, including a temporary backdrop curtain, footlights, signboards, and scenario boards.
description_web: So you have a troupe that goes to events and wants to present plays but you need to be able to have a stage setup that is transportable and relatively quick to set up and take down. This class is a presentation of how the *Commedia* troupe *I Firenzi* handles those things, including an adjustable backdrop curtain, footlights (for playing in the dark), announcement signboards, etc.

name: Spin Like You’re Scottish
description_book: The Scottish whorl-less spindle: a simple design wonderful for wool spinning and plying. Very portable for tucking in an *Arasaid*. Hands-on revival!
description_web:
The whorl-less Gaelic spindle (the *Dealgan*) is found in the Outer Hebrides and Inverness, Scotland, as well as the Eastern Maritime provinces of Canada. This unusual Gaelic spindle has survived since at least the 1700s. It is likely that it is an ancient form for spinning wool singles and wool yarn plying. Revive this ancient tradition! Demo, lecture and hands-on. Students can purchase examples in class. Examples range from $15-$50. 
It is helpful if students view my YouTube teaching videos ahead of class.
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjUCUOUGq_WC-sv2N_qfIhpJDi8LbR-9U
or search Youtube for missingspindle

name: Recreating Historic Beads as a Beginner
description_book: Creating historically accurate glass beads is not as hard as you might think. You can make period beads at any skill level! (Lecture/Discussion)
description_web:
Creating historically accurate glass beads is not as hard as you might think. You can make period beads at any skill level!
