If possible, bring a wooden dowel the length of your navel to the floor (3/4 inch round for ladies, 1 inch round for men). A limited number will be available for purchase. If you want to perform, please have a kaftan-style garment (full length t-tunic) and a hip sash.
fee_itemization: Fee is for a dancing stick (dowel) if students have not brought their own.

name: Balkan Hand Drumming
description_book: Have fun with Balkan rhythm on your hand drums! Bring your frame drum, *dumbek/darbuka, riq*, or whatever!
description_web: Have fun with Balkan rhythm on your hand drums! Bring your frame drum, *dumbek/darbuka, riq*, or whatever! We will explore several rhythms including some odd-metered ones. Open to all levels.

name: Warming Up to Vocal Performances
description_book: Learn various physical and vocal exercises to warm up your voice before any performance, and to cool down afterwards.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): *i Verdi Confusi*
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Drumming: 7/8 and 10/8
description_book: Add to your drumming repertoire: Learn rhythms played in 7/8 and 10/8. *Samai, Curcuna, Laz*, and variations are covered. Beginners welcome.

instructor: Master Piero di Paxiti da Vincenza
name: Scribal Flourishes
description_book: Practice adding flourish to your scribal work using only ink. A variety of periods and styles will be covered.
description_web: Practice adding flourish to your scribal work using only ink. A variety of periods and styles will be covered.

name: Juggling 101: Beginner
description_book: Learn to juggle three balls in the simplest pattern. Equipment available for use or purchase.
description_web: The most basic 3-ball cascade juggling. Juggling balls will be made available for use by the class and may be bought afterward from the instructor.

name: Some Simple Period Sauces
description_book: There will be a tasting of various sauces, and a hands-on demonstration on how to make a simple sauce.
description_web: A brief class on the theory and practice of making and using medieval sauces, with particular emphasis on the vinegar- and breadcrumb-based sauces. There will be a tasting of various sauces, and a hands-on demonstration on how to make a simple sauce.

name: The Submission Process
description_book: This class explains the basics of documenting and submitting for registration a name, device or badge, and what happens to it afterwards.
description_web: So, you've worked with a herald to register your name and/or armory. What happens now? This class intends to explain the basics of documenting and submitting a name, device or badge, and what happens to it afterwards.This class is not limited to heralds. Everybody can learn how things happen.

name: Deeper Look at Textiles & Trim of Viking Age Dress
description_book: By investigating extant textiles, this class will aid in making informed choices for selecting fabrics and adding details to Viking Age women’s garb.
description_web: By looking deeper at both the textiles and the details from extant items, this class aims to help individuals make informed choices for crafting their garments. Textile examples will clarify the weaves and weight of period fabrics and there will also be discussion of possible modern substitutions. Additionally, practical details for finishing or embellishing garments will also be explored and their history investigated. The goal of this class is to help the individual understand how daily life during the Viking Age could affect how textiles were crafted and worn.

instructor: Lord Anton LaFlamme de Saint Aubin
name: Let's Make a Thumb-Bell! Period Thimble-Making
description_book: Learn how to make a thimble used in needle crafts during the 12th-14th centuries;  walk away with a usable thimble.
description_web: Stop pricking the tip -- skep it instead!  Do you partake in fiber arts? Learn how to make a thimble (thumb-bell/finger skep) using period techniques and a period device. Transport yourself back to the 12th-14th centuries, and walk away with a functional, metal thimble. Thimbles will be made of either copper, bronze or brass. Includes all materials and tools required to complete a functional thimble. Class size is limited to 15 students.

name: London Plague of 1603
description_book: The 1603 plague outbreak in London killed over 35,000 people. Come learn about the history, medicine, and plague doctors of the time.
description_web: The 1603 plague outbreak in London killed over 35,000 people. Recreated medicine of the time will be shown and explained. New documentation on the suit worn by plague doctors will be presented.

name: Renaissance Shirt Anatomy
description_book: Learn a great way to make Renaissance shirts with a minimum of fuss and waste.
description_web: This is a class on how to make shirts in the Renaissance style; how it was originally done as well as a few minor changes to make it easier, faster and fit you better. Renaissance shirts for men women and children, with a minimum of fuss and waste.

name: An 11th-Century Byzantine Noblewoman's Closet
description_book: We'll explore the material culture in the bequests of the Last Will and Testament of Kale Pakouriane, an 11th-century Byzantine aristocrat.
description_web: Think a noblewoman only had 2 or 3 dresses? Think again. This class will explore the Last Will and Testament of Kale Pakouriane, a Byzantine *patrikia* (noblewoman) and her impressive inventory of clothing, jewelry, and household goods, with the diaspora of bequests, ranging from household slaves, to her mother.

name: In-Persona Historical Storytelling
description_book: A voyage into how to tell "No Sh*t - There I Was..." stories that recount historical events accurately in persona.
description_web: This is a talk on how to create an in-persona tale (or performance) based on historical events. We'll talk about how to understand and extend the known facts and how to gather additional information to create a true understanding of the story. The talk will cover mechanisms and approaches that can be used to adapt the performance so that your persona can "be part of the story". The goal is to build strength into performer's understanding so that the first-person presentation brings immediacy and intimacy to the audience.

name: Largesse Workshop
description_book: This is a hands-on making of largesse to be delivered to the Queens of the Kingdoms the person chooses.
description_web: This is a hands-on making of largesse to be delivered to the Queens of the Kingdoms that the individuals making the largesse choose. (Delivery by Alaina.)  Largesse is the gifts that our royalty gives to individuals to recognize good work or participation. There will be a brief introduction before you participate in the "class".  If you have something you need help getting completed, bring it, too. Or if you just need a place to drop off donations and are too shy to give it to HRM directly, bring it here. Come when you want to during the two hours, but be prepared to help make awesome things! Monetary donations toward supplies will not be turned down. (It means we get to make more stuff!)

name: Leather Corners for Wooden Book Covers
description_book: Learn how to make the four most common corners using leather on wooden book covers; make samples.
description_web: Students will learn how to make the four most common corners using leather on wooden book covers. Each student will make four sample corners. All tools will be loaned by instructor. This is a hands-on class.
fee_itemization: Fee covers both a handout and the wood, leather, thread to make the samples.

name: Eight Essential Knots for the SCA Camper
description_book: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.
description_web: Hands-on class on how to tie eight basic and important knots that can make your camping life easier and safer.

name: Newcomers' Class for Families
description_book: This class is to support SCA newcomers with families throughout the Known World.

name: 15th-Century Italian Dance for Beginners
description_book: These choreographies are perfect for smaller and odd numbers at practice. Expect these to be fun, quirky dances that you can pick up and remember.
description_web: This class focuses on 15th-century Italian dances, specifically those suited for beginning dancers. These choreographies are also perfect for smaller and odd numbers at practice. All are welcome, especially beginners, but a familiarity with 15th-century Italian dance steps (or really any kind of dance) and choreography will make the class easier. We will learn as many dances as time permits but we may not get through all in the handout. Expect these to be fun, quirky dances that you can pick up and remember.

name: Kamikaze Battle
description_book: Three-hour unlimited resurrection battle. No War points, no prizes, just fighting.
description_web: Three-hour unlimited resurrection battle. No War points, no prizes, just fighting.

name: Period Card Games: *Tarot*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game which uses a 78-card deck.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game which uses a 78-card tarot deck

name: Gluten-Free Baking at Pennsic?!
description_book: Yes, it can be done! Discuss recipes and how to adapt them. Show off and share at a dessert party! Class begins online.
description_web: Yes, it can be done! We'll discuss how to recreate desserts - some of which were already gluten-free, and how to adapt/modify recipes that aren't. And you'll get to show off what you've made at at a Pennsic dessert party as well as take some home to impress your camp mates! The class discussion will start before Pennsic in an online forum. Email dcicuto@gmail.com by 7/1 for more info.

name: Sources for Islamic Persona: A Discussion
description_book: Anyone who has suggestions for sources for developing such a persona is welcome to join in.
description_web: Anyone with such a persona, interested in developing one, or with suggestions of how to develop one, is welcome to join in.

name: Pennsic Children's Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: Children's Choir is open to children up to age 13 who love to sing. Experience the world of singing medieval and Renaissance music. All are welcome!
description_web:
Pennsic Children's Choir is open to all children up to age 13 who love to sing. Experience the world of Renaissance and medieval vocal music with Director Emeritus Erlan Nordenskald of the Known World Choir. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/11, in the PAT; further details TBA during regular rehearsals.) Parents must attend rehearsals with children under 12.
Music and more information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-children-s-choir

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: Known World Rapier Practice
description_book: Everyone, come out to the rapier field and get in some practice with your fellow practitioners from around the Known World.
description_web: Welcome home! Everyone, come out to the rapier field and get in some practice with your fellow practitioners from around the Known World. Spar with people you only see once a year. Get re-acquainted with other kingdoms' calibration levels. Seek out those scholars you follow on Facebook. Get in some friendly sparring before the competitiveness of the tourneys and the craziness of the War Point starts.

name: Open Scribal Time/Scribal Play Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Conflict Checking with the Complex Search
description_book: For heralds who already know the basics of conflict checking, this class will use the Complex Search to more quickly find potential conflicts.

name: Bidding the Bedes: Introduction to Paternosters
description_book: The history and development of western European Christian prayer beads as well as information on making your own replica.
description_web: In the 13th-16th centuries in western Europe, prayer beads were a ubiquitous accessory. This class discusses the history and development of the paternoster, as well as information on making your own replica. Kits will be available to make a glass paternoster.
fee_itemization: Beads, silk thread, needle, terminal pendant, bead tip

name: From Queen Teuta of Illyria to Grainne Ni Mhaille
description_book: This class will explore the rich history of women in piracy.  Why they took to the sea and how they shaped their own stories.

name: Introduction to Beginning Period Cookery
description_book: Want to cook "in period" but don’t know where to start? For beginners who want a quick intro to some basics of modern period cookery.
description_web: Want to cook "in period", but don’t know where to start? Your apartment doesn't have a handy open fireplace? No idea what an *eyroun* is or where to buy one?  No problem! This class is designed for those beginners who have never cooked a period recipe before but want a quick introduction into some of the basics of modern period cookery.

name: Medieval Drama
description_book: A brief introduction to formal medieval drama, including mystery, morality, and miracle plays. Focus is on English and European plays.
description_web: A brief introduction to formal medieval drama, including mystery, morality, and miracle plays. Focus is on English and European plays.

name: Very Old Rounds and Drinking Songs
description_book: People have been singing rounds, singing about drinking, and singing **while** drinking for centuries. A collection of simple, fun (and PG-13) songs!
description_web: Pre-1600 rounds and drinking songs in English, some in Latin. A packet of sheet music and lyrics will be available to keep.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country Dance
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns and then teach simple English Country Dances.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns and then teach simple English Country Dances. Dances include *Heart's Ease, Rufty Tufty* and *Black Nag*.

name: Belly Dance Basics with Hadia!
description_book: Learn belly dance movements, techniques, muscle isolations, and combinations. Classes are for beginners to masters. Men and women are welcome!
description_web: Learn Middle Eastern belly dance movements, techniques, muscle isolations, and combinations while gaining strength, balance, flexibility, stamina, coordination, body awareness and basic movements. We will organize dance patterns, learn to improvise, and use mini-combos for any form of belly dance. Loose clothing encouraged. Hip scarves, shimmy belts, full skirts, etc., are all optional and very helpful for movement awareness. Class is open to beginners through the seasoned dancers who desire a review of basic belly dance movements and technique.

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 19 to learn period vocal music and perform as part of the Known World Choirs Concert.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 19 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella*. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/7, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.)  More information can be found here:  https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: PA Afternoon Series: European Music Exhibition
description_book: Come experience the history of composers and variety of music from the 11th-16th centuries. Bring your voices, instruments, and play along!
description_web: Come and enjoy an afternoon of European music from the 11th-16th centuries. Experience the history of composers and a variety of instruments and vocal music. Bring your voices, instruments, and play along!

name: Responsible Performing in the SCA
description_book: Serve your own dreams of performing to adoring crowds in balance with serving the event.
description_web: Learn the balance between being a spotlight hog and waiting to be invited to perform. Learn to work with event staff, Royalty, and Baronage to schedule when and where your performance will enhance the event. You may be brilliant, but don’t risk grandstanding even by mistake.

name: Slavery in Viking Culture
description_book: Discussion of slavery and how it was treated in Viking culture. Co-taught by Grimhild Gunnvoldsdottir.
description_web: A class discussing slavery in Viking cultures. It includes how it was started in myth as well as the laws and devices used in the slave trade. Recreation of items from the time may be available for use as examples.

name: Introduction to Research
description_book: Learn about types of sources, styles of citations, what "peer reviewed" means, how to find good sources, and more! Also, applying it to A&S entries.
description_web: This class will cover a quick introduction to research, including types of sources, styles of citations, what "peer reviewed" means, how/where to find good sources for your topic, and more. We will also look at how to apply your research to A&S entries. Taught by a university faculty member, this class is open to researchers of any level, but targeted towards beginning researchers.

name: Teaching in the SCA
description_book: Want to share what you know and feel good about it afterwards? Covers planning, preparation, presentation, problems, publicity, and "post-mortem”.
description_web: Nervous about teaching? Want to share what you know and feel good about it afterwards? Covers planning, preparation, presentation, problems, publicity, and "post-mortem". For those who would like to improve their classes, as well as those who have never taught but want to. Instructor has 25+ years of classroom experience.

name: Men's Clothing in Anglo-Saxon England
description_book: A brief introduction to men's clothing in Anglo-Saxon England including period-appropriate fabrics and colors.
description_web: A brief introduction to men's clothing in Anglo-Saxon England including period-appropriate fabrics and colors.

name: Simply Plaited: 14th-Century Women's Hair
description_book: Theorized period methods of achieving 4 simple 14th-C hairstyles popular in England and France with archaeological & artistic examples. Instructional.
description_web: Theorized period methods of achieving four **simple** 14th-century hairstyles popular in England and France. Period archaeological and artistic examples will be shown/demonstrated. Discussion of the use of modern materials also included. There should be time to try out the hairstyles on hair in class if wanted.

name: Garbing a Gentlewoman: 16th-C Florentine Fashion
description_book: Introduction to 16th-C fashion in Florence, Italy. A review of the garments that make up a well-dressed lady's wardrobe, with pointers to get started.
description_web: An introduction to 16th-century upper class fashion in Florence, Italy. We will review the garments that make up a well-dressed lady's wardrobe, as well as discuss sources of information for patterning and sewing your own. Handouts will include images of extant garments, paintings, and reproductions.

name: The Melting Pot of the *Skomorokh*
description_book: Throughout their sordid history, the *skomorokhi* entertainers of Russia melded performance elements from as far as China, Greece, Italy, and Germany.
description_web: Throughout their sordid history, the *skomorokhi* entertainers of Russia melded performance elements from as far as China, Greece, Italy, and Germany. Come learn about the history of these Russian entertainers.

name: Children's Garb Roundtable
description_book: How to make inexpensive garb that can be modified as your child grows, including teen years. Share your tips, ideas and questions.
description_web: Join a discussion on how to make inexpensive garb for your child as they grow, that will grow with them. Share your tips, ideas and questions. Bring samples of your favorite go-to garb for your child. The handout will include ideas, websites, pictures that have been gleaned over the years. I will be including a Teen Edition as mine have gotten to that point.

name: Agriculture Roundtable
description_book: Agriculture and agribusiness touched every life; was vital to all. Inter-kingdom panel will lead discussion about farm reality in period.
description_web: Everyone from the king to the meanest peasant lived according to the rhythm of the agricultural seasons. Topics will range from tobacco production and its impact on Europe, the involvement a samurai would have in food procurement, the influence of the Hanseatic League, the availability and variety of various foods across Europe and much more. All are invited to join the conversation. Those with studies in this area are invited to join the table.

name: Viking Hiking
description_book: We will discuss how we are working toward the development of skills and equipment that may have been used for overland travel in the Viking Age.
description_web: The purpose of this class is to discuss the way we are working toward the development of skills and equipment that may have been used for overland travel during the Norse age (roughly 800 to 1100 AD). Such skills might include hiking or backpacking, fire making, cooking and food preservation, bedding, clothing, footwear, shelter use, etc.  We will unpack and repack each of our packs to show the tools and equipment that we have found to be useful on our adventures. We will discuss packing well and safely. We will take a look at trip planning from packing to eating to walking safely in period shoes. If you have a pack or haversack, bring it along and stay for our next class for a hike around Pennsic to practice in our gear.

name: Early Period Whistle Workshop
description_book: Learn to craft an early period whistle out of bone using a few simple hand tools. Based on 10th-century finds in England and Sweden.

name: Reconstruction Techniques for European Dance
description_book: The reconstruction process broken down into its most basic steps to help even novice dancers gain experience researching dance.
description_web: Beyond learning dances by rote, you can learn how dance steps and choreographies are derived. This will improve your sense of style and technique as a dancer and your methods of instruction as a teacher. The reconstruction techniques discussed are designed to reduce the reconstruction process into its most basic steps to help even novice dancers gain experience in reconstructing.

name: Board Games
description_book: This class will review board games already taught, or teach new ones. If you have a game you want to learn - come and ask!
description_web: This class will review board games already taught, or teach new ones. If you have a game you want to learn - come and ask!

name: Pennsic Party University
description_book: Here several seasoned instructors wish to make sure you have the best bog and swamp party etiquette around. We want you safe, happy and respectful!
description_web: This class is to attempt to show newcomers (to Pennsic, or the bog/swamp) how to deal with nightlife in the louder parts of Pennsic. We call this a primer for the lake after dark. We'll cover various topics, including Open Bar Etiquette; Visiting Other Camps; Tipping; Romance, Courting, and Your Significant Other; Chaperoning; Party Safety; **Hydrate!**; Love Your Feet; and How to Play the Game.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Siege Inspections
description_book: Inspection time for siege weapons to be used during battles.

name: Turkish Split-Finger Drum Workshop
description_book: Intro to Turkish split-finger technique for *doumbek*. This series is aimed at those who already know *doumbek* basics and want to open a new horizon!
description_web: Turkish split-finger technique for those who already have experience with *doumbek/darbuka*. Day 1: Left hand splits and new ways of producing familiar rhythms. Day 2: Right hand splits and interlace rolls. Day 3: Opening the possibilities and a fun Turkish rhythm -- *Kerfes*.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Lists open for melee activities.
description_web: Lists open for melee activities.

name: Beginning Heraldic Blazon
description_book: Learn the basics of how heralds describe armory.
description_web: Learn the basics of how heralds describe armory. Level may vary based on who shows up, but aimed at beginners in heraldry.

name: Intro to 16th-Century Italian: The Sequence!
description_book: "The Sequence" is a term we've developed to facilitate calling dances, as it is a common set of several key Italian steps. Come train your feet!
description_web: "The Sequence" is a term we've developed to facilitate calling dances, as it is a common set of several key Italian steps. *La Castellana* practices many important steps, and really drills them in. This class will focus on training our feet to do many steps we need for these dances.

location: Denys the Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs. AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: Egg Tempera Panel Painting: Part 1
description_book: Hands-on; explore period medium of egg tempera panel painting from Egyptian to medieval, in-depth, prep to finish. Materials included.
description_web: Egg tempera is an ancient medium dating to the Egyptians and used throughout history. Virtually all panel paintings executed before mid-1400s used solely the yolk of the egg as the base. This 2-part workshop will give hands-on time to explore this essential period medium in depth, from prep to finish. All materials included, beginner to advanced.
fee_itemization: fee is for traditional gesso panel, gesso, tools etc.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWC *Chorulus Pennsicus*
description_book: Closed rehearsals, by audition only.
description_web:
Closed rehearsals by audition only. 
*Chorulus Pennsicus* information available here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/chorulus-pennsicus

name: Marshals' Opening Meeting
description_book: Meeting for all Thrown Weapons Marshals.
description_web: Meeting for all Thrown Weapons Marshals.

name: Tarl's Little Pole Arm Tourney
description_book: The tourney is open to all inspected heavy fighters. Weapons must conform to Pennsic standards. Format is two 45-minute bear-pit sessions.
description_web: Welcome to the 11th annual Pole Arm tourney. The tourney is open to all inspected heavy fighters. Weapons must conform to Pennsic standards. The format is two 45-minute bear-pit sessions, with a half-time show in between. Fighters of all skill levels are encouraged to attend. Enjoy a great time fighting the "One True Weapon's Form".

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: I Feel Pretty and Period
description_book: A discussion of (generally later) period beauty practices, both from the perspective of "What they did" as well as "What can we safely do."
description_web: A discussion of period skin care and hair care practices, both from the perspective of "What they did" as well as "What we can safely do." It is no secret that period skin care and hair care recipes often involved mercury, lead and arsenic, but there are also some great recipes and tools that Scadians can use to further their immersion into their persona.

name: Sulfites and Homebrew
description_book: What are they, why do we use them, and what are the alternatives?
description_web: You're at an SCA event. An eager young brewer approaches you with a bottle and a smile on his/her face. “Madoc! I just bottled my first mead. Please, tell me what you think.” You smile and take the bottle from their hand. You hold it up to the light, observing that it appears clear of any cloudiness and that there is just a hint of dust on the bottom of the bottle – they obviously made a good effort to rack for clarity. You sniff gently, noting the floral qualities of the honey used as well as the hints of adjunct ingredients. With the expectation of a halfway decent first attempt, you take a swig – only to gag on the overwhelming wash of sulfur dioxide or metabisulfite that floods your taste buds. Fighting the urge to spit the offending beverage, you smile encouragingly and offer up a “Not too bad – you may want to cut back a bit on the sulfites for your next batch.” The novice replies, “But the recipe called for it...”

name: Luis de Carvajal, 16th-Century Mexican Crypto-Jew
description_book: The life and death of a secret Jew in the 16th-century Spanish Empire, exploring the life, history and customs of Mexico City in period.

name: Introduction to Combat Archery
description_book: Learn the basics of combat archery. Covers the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules and basic tactics.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to be a part of the action on the battlefield, but didn't want to swing a sword? Have you ever wanted to shoot back at that pesky archer who keeps killing you? Give combat archery a try. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.

name: Viking Hiking: The Hike
description_book: Follow up to Viking Hiking. Wear period gear, fill your vessel with drinking water and pack your pack or haversack for a training hike around Pennsic.
description_web: Please come to our Viking Hiking class first. Wear your period gear from head to toe.  Pack your pack or haversack, bring plenty of drinking water and a snack for a training hike around the edges of Pennsic. You will learn how your pack rides and how your shoes rub.

name: Impressive Dances for People Who Can Count to 4
description_book: Know how to walk and count to 4? Learn 3 impressive-looking dances with simple beginner moves (*John Tallow's, Rufty Tufty, Heralds in Love*).
description_web: Know how to walk and count to four? That's all you need to learn three impressive-looking dances with simple, beginner-friendly moves. We will learn *John Tallow's Canon, Rufty Tufty*, and *Heralds in Love*.

name: Pennsic Archery Champions Practice/Tryouts
description_book: All archers wishing to make the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices.
description_web: All archers wishing to be on the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices. See either the East Kingdom Captain General or the Midrealm Lt General for more details.

name: Learning *Uska Dara*
description_book: Learn the history and musical parts of the Middle Eastern song, *Uska Dara.* Singers, dancers, drummers, instrumentalists all welcome!
description_web: Calling all Middle Eastern performers! Learn about, perform, and dance to the Middle Eastern song, *Uska Dara.* The first part will be history; then we'll move into the lyrics, drum rhythm, melody, and dancing. Handouts, including sheet music, will be available for a fee. You can get the sheet music in advance from http://www.bellydancesheetmusic.com/.

name: Navigating by the Stars
description_book: Learn a critical medieval skill - how to navigate by the stars and moon! All skill levels covered, from "I can't find Orion" to "I built a telescope."
description_web: Learn a critical medieval skill - how to navigate by the stars, moon, and sun! All skill levels covered, from "I can't find Orion" to "I have built my own telescope." I will explain simple and advanced navigational tricks so that anyone can orient themselves at any time.
fee_itemization:
$1 for handout covering what is discussed and citations
$1 for magnetized cork and needle "water compass."

name: Valkyrie's *Vinyasa* Yoga
description_book: Flow sequence of very athletic poses. Some prior yoga experience is a plus but not necessary. Bring mat, towel, and water. You will sweat!
description_web: Flow sequence of very athletic poses. Begins with a breathing exercise followed by yoga poses. Some prior yoga experience is a plus but not necessary. Bring a mat, towel, and water. Extra mats available but very limited. Be prepared to move and sweat!

name: Opening Ceremonies
description_book: Opening ceremonies for the War.

name: Anglo-Saxon Otherworld
description_book: The Anglo-Saxon world included the dead, elves, dwarves, *etins, idisi* and later on saints and devils. We explore how this played out in daily life.
description_web: The Anglo-Saxon world included the dead, elves, dwarves, *etins, idisi*, and later on saints and devils. We'll explore how this played out in daily life with protection charms, pagan carry-overs, and their understanding of the world around them.

name: A Quick Overview of Bookbinding
description_book: A quick overview of bookbinding from the 4th to 16th centuries. Slide presentation and book petting session. Handout also available.
description_web: This is a quick overview of the styles of bookbinding from the 4th to the 16th centuries using a slide presentation. A handout will be available for a donation. Several styles will be on hand for a book petting session at the end of the presentation.
fee_itemization: Handout is in color to help attendees to remember the talk.

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: The Friends Hafla at the Middle Eastern Tent
description_book: If you play it, **bring it**! All melodic instrumentalists and all drummers are welcome to play hafla standards together for all dancers!
description_web: Dust off your *doumbek*, de-rust your *riq*, tune up your instrument and put on your finest Middle Eastern garb, it is time for the Friends Hafla! If you play it, **bring it**! All melodic instrumentalists and all drummers are welcome to play hafla standards together for all dancers! Sheet music will be available to borrow or purchase. Let's play standards like *Uskudara, Lamma Bada, Shisheler, Istemem Babacim, Yeshilem, Hadouni, Misirlou, Mevlana, Bir Demet, Erev Shel Shoshanim*...and many more. All dancers and observers welcome. Everyone is welcome to participate. Bring a chair, bring a light (no flame) and bring yourself!
fee_itemization: $2 per sheet music, for people who want to purchase

instructor: Mistress Jenna MacPherson of Lions Towe
name: Youth Combat Open Field
description_book: Youth combatants are welcome to come enjoy pick-up bouts, instruction and just fun fights in the evening session on the youth combat lists.

name: *Psallite*: Medieval Music for Everyone
description_book: *Psallite* performs troubadour songs, *cantigas*, motets, and other medieval music. All songs in English, with vibrant translations by Mistress Kasha.
description_web:
*Psallite* performs troubadour songs, *cantigas*, motets, and other medieval music. All songs are sung in English, with vibrant translations written by Mistress Kasha.
Featuring Mistress Kasha Alekseeva, Mistress Jadwiga Krzyzanowska, and Master Aaron Drummond.

name: Stories in the Bog
description_book: 6 pm - 6:45: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.
description_web: 8 pm -8:45 pm: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.

name: Night Tournament
description_book: Try to cut glow sticks with axes. Age 18 and over only.
description_web: Try to cut glow sticks with axes. Age 18 and over only.

name: War Ball
description_book: We totally do not expect anyone to declare war this year... but if they do, we'll be ready!
description_web: The principals and their allies are all invited to defend their side, on the floor of battle! Come test your mettle in the biggest dance-off in the Known World! In addition to favorite dances to show off your prowess, there will be galliard and tassel-kicking competitions. The dancers go to war!

name: *i Verdi Confusi*
description_book: Players' Patchwork returns with hilarious antics of *Commedia all'Improvviso*! Of Course! It All Makes Sense Now!
description_web: Players' Patchwork returns with hilarious antics of *Commedia all'Improvviso*! Of Course! It All Makes Sense Now! *Show contains adult-themed content*.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.
description_web: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Workout at War
description_book: A workout class to keep your edge during war! Shake off your hangover / greet the day strong. For **all** fitness levels, by a NSAM certified trainer.
description_web: A workout fitness class to keep your edge during war! Shake off your hangover and/or greet the day strong. For **all** fitness levels, taught by a NSAM-certified trainer. The class will focus on bodyweight exercises (no weights); core and conditioning. Bring water. Wear comfortable shoes and clothes that function well for movement. They need not be period, though it is encouraged just to stay in the spirit of things. We will be working out on bare ground, so bring a mat of any kind if you wish.

location: Thunder Bird Atlatl  (Thunder Bird Atlatl Booth #80)
name: How to Make an Atlatl Dart
description_book: How to make an atlatl dart from start to cast. Limit of four students participating in each class.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Lists open for melee activities.
description_web: Lists open for melee activities.

instructor: Master Piero di Paxiti da Vincenza
name: A Hand A Day: Secretary/Chancery
description_book: Aside from carefully written books, writing was often practical and personal. Learn a style of writing appropriate for letters, drafts, and charters.
description_web: Aside from carefully written books, writing was often practical and personal. Learn a style of writing appropriate for letters, drafts, and charters.

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia*, before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.

name: Bling Out Your Veils
description_book: Basic veil beading. You will leave class with a working knowledge of how to do simple veil beading. All supplies and veil will be supplied.
description_web: Basic veil beading. You will leave class with a working knowledge of how to do simple veil beading. All supplies and veil will be supplied. Other students may watch the class; there will be extra handouts. If you would like to attend, you can bring your own veil and beads, and take the class.
fee_itemization:
linen for veil
beads
beading needle
thread

name: **Small** Blown Glass Vessels
description_book: This is an advanced glass class! This is a hands-on class for making small blown vessels, and includes building a base and adding handles.
description_web: This is an advanced glass class! This is a hands-on class for making small blown vessels, and includes building a base and adding handles. Requirements include the ability to build large discs, maintain critical heat in a larger structure and a solid knowledge of heat control while working in glass.

name: Drawn Work Handkerchief Make-and-Take
description_book: A hands-on, instructional class on drawn work, specifically the hemstitch, seen in German, Italian, and English Renaissance clothing and accessories.
description_web: A hands-on, instructional class on drawn work, specifically the hemstitch, seen in German, Italian, and English Renaissance clothing and accessories. Participants will create their own handkerchief with a drawn work hem, and learn how to make more elaborate drawn work designs on their own. Materials available for 10 people, or bring your own medium-weight, white linen (12" x 12").

name: My Favorite Pennsic Market Basket
description_book: Students will be able to take home a sturdy, useful handmade basket. This is the basket I use for all my Pennsic (or any event) shopping.

name: Gilding Food
description_book: We'll cover gilding (and some painting) of period food, like marchpanes. Hands-on for first 12 students. Supplies included.
description_web: We'll cover gilding (and some painting) of period food, like marchpanes. Hands-on for first 12 students. Supplies included.
fee_itemization: Molded marzipan, agate burnisher, brush, sugar paste, gold leaf.

name: Anglo-Saxon Otherworld
description_book: The Anglo-Saxon world included the dead, elves, dwarves, *etins, idisi*, and later on saints and devils. We explore how this played out in daily life.
description_web: The Anglo-Saxon world included the dead, elves, dwarves, *etins, idisi*, and later on saints and devils. We'll explore how this played out in daily life with protection charms, pagan carry-overs, and their understanding of the world around them.

name: Bouncy Dance Games for Squirrelly Children
description_book: Let's be squirrels! Or trolls! Or fairies! We'll play dance games and learn new moves! (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)
description_web: Let's be squirrels! Or trolls! Or fairies!  Bring your little ones for lively dance games designed to teach new moves while we have lots of fun. Silly parents are welcome as well! (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)

name: Soap-Making from Scratch
description_book: Making soap with fat and lye. All-day process.
description_web: This class will be making soap by traditional methods, using lye from wood ash and animal fats. This will be a long class, probably hot, tiring and boring, but hopefully educational. Lye will be collected from wood ash, animal fats melted and saponified by adding lye to the liquified fat and stirred over heat, for as long as it takes to get the fat to saponify. Participants are welcome to come in and out through the course of the day (it will be a long, boring process) and those coming early are encouraged to bring any bacon grease or other leftover fats they may have to add to the cauldron.

name: Beginning Middle Eastern Dance
description_book: Come and dance! Suitable for all levels, whether just beginning or brushing up. A few basic steps and styles, and of course the (available) history.
description_web: Come and dance! Suitable for all levels, whether just beginning or brushing up. A few basic steps and styles, and of course the (available) history. Focus will be active. Warm-up, learn basic moves, learn how to walk and step, and learn a few of the dance styles that come from this region. Welcome to both sessions if you really want to practice.

name: Family Stick Weaving
description_book: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian.
description_web: Family-oriented stick weaving. Youth welcome with parent or guardian. Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Fee covers sticks and string; take your work home with you.

name: Thrown Weapon Marshal Training: Part 1
description_book: Learn the SCA rules and guidelines to be a thrown weapons marshal. Parts 1 and 2 are required with on-the-range training and a written test on Friday.
description_web: Learn the SCA rules and guidelines to be a thrown weapons marshal. Parts 1 and 2 are required with on-the-range training and a written test on Friday.

name: *Zil* Patterns Beginner II
description_book: Build on *zil* patterns from "Zil Patterns for Beginners". Incorporate footwork and dance movement with your zilling.

name: Gathering of the Louds
description_book: Shawms, sackbuts and curtals - oh my! The traditional gathering of loud instruments for group ensemble playing continues. Not for beginners.
description_web: Shawms, sackbuts and curtals - oh my! The traditional gathering of loud instruments for group ensemble playing continues. Not for beginners. Bring music if you have any ensemble pieces you might like to try. Bring a chair.

name: Open Scribal Time/Scribal Play Time
description_book: Take advantage of our clean, well-lit space to work on existing projects or to try your hand at calligraphy and/or illumination.

name: Fool's School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/10, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Metalsmith Day
description_book: Small metals, jewelry, wire work, hard soldering, gemstone setting and more. Bring your tools, some metal and have some fun in the company of others.
description_web: This is the place for small metals and jewelry work, wire work, fabrication with nonferrous metals, hard soldering, gemstone setting and more. Bring your tools, some metal and have some fun in the company of others working with similar materials.

name: Myths and Legends of The SCA
description_book: We've all heard stories about the SCA of long long ago. Come and hear some new ones, or share your own.
description_web: We've all heard stories about the SCA of long long ago. Come and hear some new ones, or share your own. Stories like "The SCA vs. The Motorcycle Gang", "Why You Should Never Try to Mug a Knight", "The Russian Spies Learn about The SCA", and others.

name: A Guide to 16th-Century Spanish Sewing Terms
description_book: What's what in late-period Spanish clothing, created for the non-Spanish speaker. Terms are described in depth and, when possible, are illustrated.
description_web: This class is a guide to what's what in late-period Spanish clothing, created for the non-Spanish speaker. Terms are (whenever possible) illustrated with images or clearly described. No knowledge of Spanish clothing or Spanish language needed!

name: Stitching *Temari*: *Kiku* Pattern
description_book: Learn to mark and stitch the classic *kiku*, or chrysanthemum pattern. Kit is three colors of floss, ball base, and marking thread, or bring your own.
description_web: Learn to mark and stitch the classic *kiku*, or chrysanthemum pattern on a Japanese temari ball. We will start the ball in the class, and you'll learn the basics of the stitch, and finish it outside class. Kit is three colors of floss, ball base, and marking thread, or bring your own.
fee_itemization: materials to stitch one ball, plus enough to begin several more, and a copy of the handout

location: Bus Stop (Roman Rd/Great Eastern Hwy bus stop/Southern Loop. )
name: Pennsic Heraldic Walk - The Bog
description_book: We'll walk the Bog discussing heraldic display, what the heraldry means; we'll reward the camps we feel are outstanding. Wear comfortable foot wear.
description_web: Heraldry is gorgeous and can be found in silk, stone, wood, and glass. It sets us apart, one from the other and tells part of our story to the world. We'll find camps with beautiful display, discuss what it means, how it's used, and we'll leave tokens for the camps that impress us best. We will meet in the Bog. Wear comfortable foot wear, sun screen or bring an umbrella if needful. All well-behaved ages welcome!

name: English Country Dance for Beginners
description_book: Scared to learn dance? This is the class for you! Learn simple steps that get put together to learn popular English dances.
description_web: Have you always wanted to learn to dance, but it all seemed so confusing? Come learn the basic steps of English Country Dance, and a few simple - but fun - dances! Come laugh, and learn and dance!

name: Period Card Games: *Losing Loadem*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period, trick-avoidance card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game based on a reconstruction from Francis Willughby’s *A Volume of Plaies* (~1665).

location: Good Friends Camp (usually N-01 on St. Lawrence Way)
name: 16th-Century Limp Book Binding (Chain Stitch)
description_book: All-day class making a 16th-century limp vellum-covered book with decorative chain stitching on exposed spine. Some embroidery skills required.
description_web: An all-day class on how to make a 16th-century limp vellum-covered book with decorative chain-stitched exposed spine. Some embroidery skills are required to do this decorative spine, but no prior bookbinding knowledge is required. All tools are loaned by the instructor, but students can bring at least three matching beads (no larger than 10mm) for the ties.
fee_itemization: Fee covers vellum for the cover, a handout, paper for the blank book, leather for the spine, beads for the ties, and linen thread.

name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

name: Allied Champions
description_book: Rules to be determined by the Allied Crowns or representatives. Allied teams will supply any banners necessary for the battle.
description_web: Rules to be determined by the Allied Crowns or representatives. Allied teams will supply any banners necessary for the battle.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.  Student Performance, Thursday, 8/1,1 6-7 pm at the Amphitheater. Bring a blanket or chair to enjoy the performance on the green.

name: Pennsic Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! Singing in the Choir is an intense and rewarding experience with a concert Thursday War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! This year's concert theme is "Of Love and Whimsy." The repertoire includes pieces by Morley, Marenzio, Scandello, Gesualdo, Dowland, and the ever-popular Anonymous. Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on Thursday evening of War Week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is helpful, but not required if you learn the music in advance. Sheet music and audio tracks are available online now at https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsicxliiichoirs

name: Æthelmearc's Ladies' Rapier Tourney
description_book: Ladies' Rapier Tourney, sponsored by the Kingdom of Æthelmearc.
description_web: Ladies' Rapier Tourney, sponsored by the Kingdom of Æthelmearc.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Unbelted Champions
description_book: Thirty unbelted fighters from each side will compete in a single open field melee. All holds are general and should be avoided if possible.
description_web: Thirty unbelted fighters from each side will compete in a single open field melee. All holds are general and should be avoided if possible. The Kings of the East and Middle will not fight in this battle.

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: Basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class; different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Archery Populace War Point
description_book: Three challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the one War Point for each shoot.
description_web: All archers young and old are encouraged to come and lend their support to their kingdom's efforts, and to display their skill at archery. There will be three challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the one War Point for each shoot.

name: Thy Name Is Woman: Men on Women under Elizabeth I
description_book: We explore, via period songs and poetry, the complex and conflicted attitudes the English held around women and their role under Queen Elizabeth I.
description_web: An exploration, through songs and poetry of the period, of the complex and conflicted attitudes English culture held around women and their role during the reign of Queen Elizabeth I.

name: Beginner Arabic for Practical Use
description_book: Discover the basics of Arabic script; learn how to use Arabic in SCA life for clothing, armor, banners, scrolls, and in daily conversation.
description_web: You will learn to identify Arabic letters, construct simple words, and spot key words and phrases in period sources. We will discuss how to incorporate Arabic script into clothing, armor, camping gear, scrolls, banners, etc. Students will leave with period-appropriate Arabic words and phrases (with English translations) for that purpose. You will learn and practice SCA-friendly phrases that can be used at events and with friends. Students will also be given resources for faux-Arabic scripts, online Arabic keyboards, and websites for project ideas that incorporate Arabic script and motifs.
fee_itemization: Fee covers printing costs for handouts

name: Lampwork Basics
description_book: Explore making lampwork beads. Class is hands-on. Wear natural fibers with hair back, closed-toe shoes, and loose fabric tied up.
fee_itemization: Fee covers gas and glass. Limited to the first 8 students

name: Basic 14th-Century Tablet-Woven Edge
description_book: How to work a basic tablet-woven braid directly onto a garment or accessory edge (gown center-front, buttoned sleeve, purse sides, etc.).
description_web: One method of finishing edges, particularly load-bearing ones, in the 14th century was to tablet-weave a cord and sew it onto the piece as you worked. This sounds far more intimidating than it really is, even if you haven't picked up a set of tablets heretofore.

name: Taking Your Research From Reenactment to Academia
description_book: Have you ever considered taking your SCA research and bringing it to the modern academic community? The path is not for the faint of heart.
description_web: Have you ever considered taking your SCA research and bringing it to the modern academic community? The path is not for the faint of heart, but this class will at least give you a map. Critical thinking skills to apply to your research will also be discussed.

name: Diet and Nutrition in Early British Populations
description_book: A survey of foods and nutritional issues for the Anglo-Saxons, Anglo-Scandinavian Vikings, and Celts using artifact and skeletal evidence.
description_web: An archaeology-based survey of foods consumed by the Anglo-Saxons, Anglo-Scandinavian Vikings, and Celts, showing what can be learned about diet and nutrition in these populations from both artifacts recovered in excavation and the study of the skeletal remains of the people of Britain. Handout contains charts on plants and animals known from excavation and illustrations of diet-based skeletal conditions.

name: Bardic Circles 101
description_book: Entertainment for the people, by the people! Find out what a bardic circle is, etiquette, where to find material, and how to participate.
description_web: Entertainment for the people, by the people! Find out what a bardic circle is, etiquette, where to find material, and how to participate. We won't actually be performing, but we will play a game to give you an idea of how they work.  Conveniently, there's the Least Intimidating Bardic Circle at 2 pm at the Runestone, so you can put your new knowledge and skills to use!

name: Magic as a Performing Art
description_book: Magic in theory and practice. Three period tricks taught by professional magician. Real methods. Class sworn to secrecy.
description_web: Theory and practice of magic as a performance art, taught by a professional magician. We will cover three period tricks from Scot’s *Discoverie of Witchcraft*, 1584, for close-up, parlor, and stage. The class will be sworn to secrecy and real working methods will be taught.

name: Tiny Stocking
description_book: We will knit a small version of a period stocking. For experienced knitters. Double-pointed needles, increase and decrease, and pick-up stitches.
description_web: We will knit a small version of a period stocking. For experienced knitters; must know how to use double-pointed needles, increase and decrease, and pick-up stitches.

name: Scandalously Practical: Italian Drawers
description_book: A delicate conversation about an indelicate subject: underwear. We'll discuss the origins of the garment, references in period and construction.
description_web: A delicate conversation about an indelicate subject: underwear. Several pairs of Renaissance Italian "trousers" are found in museums around the world. We'll discuss the origins of the garment, plus references in period and construction techniques using both period and modern patterning.

name: SCA 101: Newcomers' Q&A
description_book: New to the SCA? First event? Don't know what to do? Stop here and get your questions answered!
description_web: So, you're new to the SCA? What do you do? Where do you go? Stop in here at the Newcomer's Q&A. We have answers and are here to help! Come meet with newcomer guides from around the Knowne World and learn about the endless possibilities.

name: *Les Bouffons*
description_book: Sword fighting + dance = awesome. We will learn 2-3 verses of Arbeau's mock sword dance, *Les Bouffons*, in Session 1 and the rest in Session 2.
description_web: Sword fighting + dance = awesome. We will learn verses 2, 4, and 6 of Arbeau's mock sword dance, *Les Bouffons*, in Session 1 and verses 1, 3, and 5 in Session 2. New students should plan to attend Session 1 as a prerequisite for Session 2. Students who want to attend Session 2 without having taken Session 1 should be familiar with the dance already, as we will not have time then to reteach.
fee_itemization: $5 for 4 wooden dowel rods at $1.25 each. This fee is optional.

name: Belted Champions
description_book: This battle will consist of 3 melees with teams of 7 belted fighters from each kingdom (East and Midrealm). Date of elevation is a factor.
description_web:
This battle will consist of three melees with teams of seven belted fighters from each kingdom (East and Midrealm). The teams will be composed of fighters depending on how long ago they were elevated to the Chivalry.
Team 1: 0 - 6 years
Team 2: 6 - 12 years.
Team 3: 12+ years
The kings of the East and Midrealm will not fight in this battle. All holds are general and should be avoided if possible. The victor is the winner of two of the three melees.

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. No fee. String provided.

name: What Makes a Good TW Competition: Roundtable
description_book: Open discussion of ideas on how to design and run a good Thrown Weapons competition.
description_web: Open discussion of ideas on how to design and run a good Thrown Weapons competition.

name: Crumhorn Consort
description_book: Intermediate group music session for players of the "soft" double-reeds: crumhorns, *cornamusen, dolzaines*, etc. Sheet music provided. Bring a chair.
description_web: Bring out your "buzzy" instruments and play through a set of 15th- and 16th-century pieces. Attendees will take home a packet of sheet music good for crumhorns and similar instruments; feel free to bring appropriate songs to share (in multiple copies, please). This intermediate-level session is geared towards players who are comfortable with sightreading on their instruments.

name: Pennsic Arts & Science Display
description_book: Pennsic 45 Arts & Science Display
description_web: Come and be part of the wondrous display of craftsmanship from the Known World! Pennsic 45 brings the 18th annual display of the talents and knowledge of the Known World's Artisans and Craftspeople. The variety and scope of work always create a most excellent spectacle of artistic talents and scientific skills. The display is not a competition. Bring your completed items, works-in-progress, research, and discussion material, so that you may share, inspire, and enrich our Society. See what others in your field are working on, discover a new passion, make new contacts and, most importantly, have fun!

name: Heroic Champions of Arms
description_book:
Ten singles bouts. Each team must include at least four unbelted fighters. Each
team may include a maximum of three Allied fighters.
description_web: This battle will be 10 singles bouts. Each team must include at least four unbelted fighters. Each team may include a maximum of three Allied fighters. The winner of two of the three previous champions' battles (Allied, Unbelted, and Belted) will be the first to choose a combatant. The other side will then choose a combatant. These choices shall alternate per bout for all 10 bouts. Unbelted fighters will be matched with another unbelted fighter unless agreed upon by TRM East and Middle.  Double kills will be re-fought. Victory will be the winner of a majority of bouts.

name: Un-Squashed Bugs
description_book: A hands-on class based on late period books of hours with realistic insects painted in the margins. Scadians often call the style "squashed bug."
description_web: The "squashed bug" style of book illumination is a late-period fashion designed to fool the eye into thinking that insects have landed on the page. In this hands-on class, we will look at some medieval examples from Books of Hours, then try to paint an equally convincing bug.

name: Beginner Beadweaving
description_book: Learn to make a beautiful piece of beaded jewelry using a needle, thread, and easy beadweaving techniques. Kit provided.
description_web: Love jewelry? Now you can make it yourself! Learn to make a beautiful piece of beaded jewelry using a needle, thread, and easy beadweaving techniques. Kit provided.
fee_itemization: Beading needle, thread, beading mat, glass pearls (2 sizes), seed beads, (2 sizes), magnetic clasp.

name: Book Heraldry 100
description_book: An introductory class for book heralds, covering topics such as becoming a herald, the organization of the SCA heralds, and the submission process.
description_web: An introductory class for book heralds, covering administrative matters and general principles, including becoming a herald, the organization of the SCA College of Arms, the submission process, and related topics.

name: Gearing Up for Youth Combat
description_book: Covers the basics for preparing for Youth Combat: rules, armor, and weapons. Hands-on weapons building.
description_web: This class will cover the basics for preparing for Youth Combat. We will cover the newest set of Society rules, as  well as answer Kingdom-specific questions.  Armor requirements will be discussed, as well as handouts with lists of places to find gear either at Pennsic merchants or in the Slippery Rock area. Weapons requirements will be discussed, and we will go over, step by step, how to build a proper weapon for Youth Combat. Materials will be provided to build **one** weapon, and building will be done step-by-step as a class. First come, first served for materials. This class is geared towards the parents or adult guardians of youth interested in fighting, but minors are also welcome to come.
fee_itemization:
Apollo 1-in x 5-ft 160 PEX Pipe- $4.98
Tundra 3/4in Wall x 6 Ft Pipe Insulation- $6.49
Frost King 0.375-in x 17-ft Gray Foam Door Weatherstrip- $1.97
Duck 1.88-in x 30-ft Multiple Colors/Finishes Duct Tape-$3.48
LASCO 1-in Dia Cap CPVC Fitting- $1.18
Scotch Extreme Shipping Strapping Tape with Dispenser, 1.96" x 21.8 yds, Clear, 1/Pack  - $6.89

name: Viking Age Clothing: Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age clothing, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make accurate reproductions.
description_web: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age clothing, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make reasonably accurate reproductions. We will cover Birka, Damendorf, Eura, Hedeby, Mammen, Thorsbjerg, Viborg, and other finds.

name: Irish Woman's Dilemma: What Do I Wear?
description_book: An intro to clothing that an Irish woman would wear. Spans from about 500 to 1600.
description_web: Many want to have an Irish persona because Ireland has a rich and interesting history, beautiful music and stories, and complex and interesting art. Yet, when I went to try and make my persona more historically accurate in dress, I found a dearth of concrete evidence and little research of the subject. I decided to find as many sources as I could, compile what I found, and try to present a reasonable approximation of what the Irish would have worn throughout our period. This class will give an overview from early to late period on what I believe a typical Irish woman would have worn, as well as provide a list of resources for you to explore on your own.
fee_itemization: Cost to offset printing cost of handout, will likely be 10+pages

name: Multi-Coloured/Multi-Strand Naalbinding
description_book: This class is meant for experienced naalbinders. Discussion & practice of techniques based on *Eura Luistari* and *Kaukolan Kekomäki* fragment.
description_web:
This class is meant for experienced naalbinders. We will be discussing and practicing the techniques for continuous mutli-coloured, striped naalbinding that can be found in the *Eura Luistari* Grave 56 textile fragment and the *Kaukolan Kekomäki* fragment.  
Students should bring 3 different colours of fingering weight yarn and their favourite naalbinding needle. Some yarn and spare needles will be available as well. Instructor is right-handed. Limit of 15 students.

name: So You Want to Be a Bard: Introduction to Bardic
description_book: Some advice on getting started as a bard, from basic information to performance tips, and how to find places and pieces to perform.

instructor: Lord Anton LaFlamme de Saint Aubin
name: It all Hinges on This - Let's Make Period Hinges!
description_book: How to construct small hinges as done in period. These hinges can be used for jewelry, small boxes and other items.
description_web: How to construct small hinges as done in period. These hinges can be used for jewelry or small boxes and other items. They will be constructed of flat sheets; students will learn how to draw tubing using wire drawing equipment. It helps if prospective students have basic soldering skills, but it is not a requirement. Class size limited to 15 students.

name: Beginning *Pysanky*
description_book: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, and have the opportunity to create one of their own.
description_web: Students will learn the history of the *pysanka*, as well as the techniques involved, and have the opportunity to create one of their own. The class is listed as 3 hours to allow plenty of time for writing the shells; it doesn't usually take that long.
fee_itemization: $5 overall, $2 if you just want the handout (but it IS a hands-on class ...)

name: Bizarre Religious Practices of the Middle Ages
description_book: Some medieval people flogged themselves, licked lepers, or got advice from bits of bone. Learn why these things made sense to the people we emulate.
description_web: Medieval Europeans had some religious practices that were downright weird. However, even the most outlandish behaviors were honest attempts to find spiritual connections or improve the world. Learn a bit about the context of some of the strangest religious practices of the medieval period. Due to time, we'll focus on western Christianity.

name: Courtesan Persona Roundtable
description_book: Are you a courtesan? Do you want to be? We'll discuss the joys and pitfalls of the vocation as relates to our SCA life, and share resources.
description_web: Are you a courtesan? Do you want to be? We'll discuss the joys and pitfalls of the vocation as relates to our SCA life, and share resources. If you've ever wished for a persona support group, here it is.

name: Baklava in Turkish Period Cuisine
description_book: Extant recipe (16th/17th C), resources and reconstruction. Samples may be available. Demonstration of how to roll *yufka*.
description_web: After years of working with Turkish historical cuisine I have obtained a recipe from the 16th/17th century for baklava that has not been published in English to this day. This is not proto-baklava but baklava as we know it today. Available will be the  recipe, some notes on its reconstruction, and an opportunity to learn how to roll *yufka*, the *phillo* dough of Turkey.  Enjoy samples as you learn.
fee_itemization: Cost of ingredients for dough, filling, tea and coffee. Turkish rolling pin - $7 ltd available-

name: Introduction to Old English
description_book: A brief introduction to Old English language.
description_web: A brief introduction to Old English language.

name: Beginning and Intermediate English Country Dance
description_book: No clue? No partner? No problem; this class is taught by the Saltatoris Dance Guild so everyone is guaranteed a partner.
description_web: Learn (or just practice) beginning (first hour) and intermediate (second hour) English Country dance. Don't have a clue? Don't have a partner? Not a problem; this class is taught by the Saltatoris Dance Guild so everyone is guaranteed a partner for personalized instruction.

name: Nine Days Wonder: Day 4
description_book: Dancing tour of Mack's Field (central Pennsic). Start location: Corner of Fosse Way and Chandler's Rd. (N20). Stop Location: (E09).
description_web:
We are re-enacting William Kempe's famous "Nine Days Wonder"! Kempe was an actor who worked with Shakespeare and who danced 100 km from London to Norwich as a publicity stunt in 1602. Dance 5 out of 9 days and receive a souvenir token! Check the book/web for start locations. We dance at noon each day.
Today: Dancing tour of Mack's Field (central Pennsic). Start location: Corner of Fosse Way & Chandler's Rd. (N20). Stop location: 3-way intersection of Chandler's Rd., Brewer's Rd., and High Rd. (E09)

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.

name: Rapier Melee Champions' Battle
description_book: Consists of two open field melees. First melee: 10 fighters from each, East/Midrealm only. Second melee: 10 each, East/Midrealm **Allies**.
description_web: This battle will consist of two open field melees. In the first melee 10 fighters from the East and 10 fighters from the Midrealm will compete. No allies are allowed in this first melee. In the second team, 10 fighters from the East’s allies and 10 fighters from the Midrealm’s allies will compete. Melees will be fought to the last man. If the score is tied after these first two melees, a third melee will be fought to break the tie. This melee will be 20 on 20. Combatants in this melee may have fought in either of the previous two melees. DFB is allowed in these melees.

name: *Saidi* Dance: From Start to Stage, Part 3 of 4
description_book: Four-part series of classes to learn the movements of Egyptian *Saidi* dance with sticks and prepare a performance for the ME Dance Expo on 8/9.
description_web: **Day Three**: In this four-part series of classes, you will learn the basic movements of *Saidi* dance, how to manage a *tahteeb* or stick, learn a short choreography, and, for the daring among you, perform it at the 20th Annual Middle Eastern and World Dance Exposition. If possible, bring a wooden dowel the length of your navel to the floor (3/4 inch round for ladies, 1 inch round for men). A limited number will be available for purchase. If you want to perform, please have a kaftan-style garment (full length t-tunic) and a hip sash.
fee_itemization: Fee is for a dancing stick (dowel) if students have not brought their own.

name: Known World Baronial Archer Champions' Tourney
description_book: Calling all baronial archer champions to join us for a friendly competition. Bring a small patch representing your barony (1.5-2" dia.).
description_web:
Calling all baronial archer champions to join us for our Third Annual Known World Baronial Archer Champions Shoot-Off. This is a friendly competition among all current baronial archer champions. Open to Shire, Canton, Riding, Marche champions, as well. Barons/Baronesses are requested to come join, as well.

No pre-registration is required. 

Participants, please bring a small patch representing your barony (1.5-2" diameter) to donate toward the prize.

Note: We will also be doing a tournament for all youth baronial champions at the same time, so please encourage your youth champions to come out. Same request: Please bring a small patch representing your barony to use toward the prize.

name: Balkan Hand Drumming
description_book: Have fun with Balkan rhythm on your hand drums! Bring your frame drum, *dumbek/darbuka, riq*, or whatever!
description_web: Have fun with Balkan rhythm on your hand drums! Bring your frame drum, *dumbek/darbuka, riq*, or whatever! We will explore several rhythms including some odd-metered ones. Open to all levels.

name: Mass Project
description_book: Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. Each day we'll study and rehearse a different movement.
description_web:
Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. Each day we'll study and rehearse a different movement, starting with early period *Kyrie* and ending with a mid-15th-century *Agnus Dei*. Five-part class. We are going to do a mini-performance at the European Music Expo and a movement or two at the **Known World Choirs Performance**. Sponsored by the Known World Choir. 
Rehearsal Tent unless noted:  8/4, 4-5 pm; 8/5, 12-1 pm; 8/7, 12-1 pm; 8/9, AMPI, 3-4 pm (bring a chair); 8/10, 12-1 pm.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): *i Sebastiani*
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: How to Teach Beginners to Throw
description_book: For thrown weapons marshals and MiTs, this course explains exactly how to teach a beginner to throw.
description_web: For thrown weapons marshals and MITs, this course will show how to teach thrown weapons to someone who wants to learn how to throw. It will cover both an informal class and a formal class technique. This is a recommended class for MITs, but not required.

name: Echoes of the Dumbek
description_book: Mark of Orluk Oasis will play a rhythm or phrase and the class repeats. Students may have a chance to "call" a phrase or rhythm if they wish.
description_web: Mark of Orluk Oasis will play a rhythm or phrase and the class repeats. Students may have a chance to "call" a phrase or rhythm if they wish.

name: Fiore dei Liberi Longsword 101
description_book: Introduction to Master Fiore's longsword.  We will cover his philosophy, foot work and posta.
description_web: Introduction to Master Fiore's longsword.  We will cover his philosophy, foot work and posta of his longsword sections from his *Flos Duellatorum*.

name: Rapier Heroic Champions' Battle
description_book: This battle will be 20 singles bouts. One side will put forth a combatant. The other side will then choose a combatant.
description_web:
This battle will be 20 singles bouts. One side will put forth a combatant. The other side will then choose a combatant. The side to put forth the first combatant will be determined by a coin flip.
