These choices shall then alternate per bout for all 20 bouts. All of these pairings will be made prior to the battle. Victor will be the winner of a majority of bouts. In the case of a tie, there will be one final bout to determine the victor. These combatants may be drawn from those who have
already fought in the battle. This pairing does not have to be made ahead of time.
Cut and Thrust may be selected as a weapons form if both combatants in a pairing agree. No seated royals may compete in this battle.

name: I Spy: Calligraphy
description_book: Want your calligraphy look more “medieval"? Letters don't look quite right? Learn how to analyze calligraphy and take your letters to the next level.
description_web: Searching for ways to make your calligraphy look more “medieval"? Not sure why your letters don't look quite right? This class will show you how to analyze calligraphy and take your letters to the next level. Some calligraphy experience is helpful.

name: At a Loss for Words
description_book: Creating period-sounding wording for award scrolls.
description_web: One of the biggest challenges for some kingdom scribes is coming up with wording for award scrolls. This class looks at ways of finding inspiration for scroll wording by using period documents and other sources.

name: Juggling Practice
description_book: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.
description_web: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.

name: Elizabethan Embroidered Slips
description_book: Popular from the mid-16th to the mid-17th century, slips were embroidered motifs on canvas which were cut out and applied to various backing fabrics.
description_web: Popular from the mid-16th to the mid-17th century, slips were embroidered motifs on canvas which were cut out and applied to various backing fabrics. Many of the surviving examples found today are of floral and plant motifs with many of the images having been copied or inspired by herbals, hence the use of the term 'slips.'
fee_itemization: Kits will include an embroidery hoop, needles, floss, 18-count even-weave fabric with a pre-drawn image, and full-colour handout.

name: Twisties and Stringers
description_book: Stringers are like fine-tip pencils, perfect to decorate your beads. Class will cover twisted cane. Wear natural fibers, closed-toe shoes, hair back.
fee_itemization: Fee covers gas and glass. Open to the first 8 students

name: Planning a Feast
description_book: How to design a menu, figure out how much to cook, plan logistics, and everything else you need to consider to ensure a successful feast.

name: Help Me, Tempus, You’re My Only Hope!
description_book: Two hours with Tempus, anything sewing. Trouble-shooting, problem-solving, garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Maybe learn to sew...
description_web:
(Garb Troubleshooting/Q&A Workshop)
This is a trouble-shooting and problem-solving class; garb problems diagnosed and solutions proffered. Bring to the class garb that went “wrong” or garb that didn’t “work” for you. We'll talk; it can be fixed. If you don’t have the garb here, bring your questions; we’ll do our best to solve your garb troubles. We’ll talk about gussets and how to use your seam ripper, too. This class can go on longer if needed. Also, this class will be offered next year.

name: Johannes Ockeghem: Pedant or Genius
description_book: We'll examine the life and Masses of 15th-century composer, Johannes Ockeghem.
description_web: In this class we’ll explore the life and work of Johannes Ockeghem. We will examine what the life of a typical 15th-century composer of polyphony was like, how Ockeghem was regarded during his lifetime and later, and look at his most important body of work, his Masses. In particular we’ll spend time on *Missa Prolationum*, and explain how the ingenious (or perhaps pedantic and unmusical) mensural canons work.

name: Royal Court: Fun From Both Sides
description_book: A discussion of the ways attendees, heralds, and other participants can make Court more enjoyable for everyone.
description_web: A discussion of the ways attendees, heralds, and other participants can make Court more enjoyable for everyone. Taught from a Midrealm perspective, but perspectives from other Kingdoms are encouraged - the instructor **loves** inter-kingdom anthropology!

name: Pelican and Protégé Meet Up
description_book: This is a time for Pelicans and protégés to meet others from across the Known World! A variety of topics will be discussed. Please join us!
description_web: This is a time for Pelicans and protégés to meet others from across the Known World! A variety of topics will be discussed. Please join us!

name: Newcomers' Social
description_book: New to the SCA? Come join us for some light refreshments and get to know our Chatelaines and other newcomers in this casual venue.
description_web: New to the SCA? Is this one of your first events? Come join us for some light refreshments and get to know our Chatelaines and other newcomers in this casual venue.

name: Judging and Preparing Raw Fleeces
description_book: Learn how to look at a raw fleece for personal projects, plus how to prepare a fleece for washing, carding/spinning preparation, and more.
description_web:
We will be looking at a multitude of sheep, goat and camelid breeds for their fleeces and how to judge them in raw state. How to look at a fleece for quality, use, color ranges, as well as beginning breeds and fleeces for the hand spinner, comparing fleeces of the same breeds, washing and carding, spinning "in the grease" and the advantages/disadvantages of leaving a fleece with lanolin.

**This will be a HANDS-ON CLASS! Come in your old clothing and be prepared to get dirty & wet.**
We will be providing gloves for those who might have sensitivities to lanolin/raw fleeces. Feel free to bring your spindles/wheels, your personal carders, to try spinning in the grease as well.

name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Drumming: 6/8 and 12
description_book: Add to your rhythm repertoire with those played in 6 and 12. Moroccan and Persian 6/8 and *Chaka* 12 are covered, with variations. Beginners welcome.

name: *Xiang-qi* (Chinese Chess) for Beginners
description_book: A class in how to play *Xiang-qi* (Chinese Chess). History, rules, and time left for students to play afterwards.
description_web: A class in how to play *Xiang-qi* (Chinese Chess). History, rules, and time left for students to play afterwards.

name: Battlefield Set-Up
description_book: **Volunteers** are **needed** to set up the Main Battlefield. Come out and be part of the magic; be a Hay Bale Hero!
description_web: Ever wonder how the Battlefield is magically set-up prior to each War Point? Be part of the action! Volunteers are needed to set-up the Main Battlefield. Come out and be part of the magic; be a Hay Bale Hero!

name: Arabic Hip Movements
description_book: A study of various shimmies, slides and circles from a Syrian Classic Oriental Dance perspective. A beginning knowledge of ME Dance is appreciated
description_web: A study of various shimmies, slides and circles from a Syrian Classic Oriental Dance perspective, taught by Baroness Simone. A beginning knowledge of Middle Eastern Dance is appreciated

name: Pennsic Children's Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: Children's Choir is open to children up to age 13 who love to sing. Experience the world of singing medieval and Renaissance music. All are welcome!
description_web:
Pennsic Children's Choir is open to all children up to age 13 who love to sing. Experience the world of Renaissance and medieval vocal music with Director Emeritus Erlan Nordenskald of the Known World Choir. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/11, in the PAT; further details TBA during regular rehearsals.) Parents must attend rehearsals with children under 12.
Music and more information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-children-s-choir

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Rapier Bear Pit Tourney
description_book: A no-frills classic bear pit. Three passes, winner stays, three fights maximum. Everyone welcome. Fight until you drop. Lots of prizes!
description_web: Nothing fancy here: a classic bear bit tourney. Three passes, winner stays, three fights maximum. Every skill level welcome. Bring your best, and fight until you can't fight any more. Prize for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place. If you've ever felt like you didn't get enough fencing in at Pennsic, here's your answer.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Thrown Weapons for the Physically Challenged
description_book: Most physical limitations are not a barrier to this martial art. Please join us and learn how to work with people with limitations.
description_web: Most physical limitations are not a barrier to this martial art. Please join us and learn how to work with people with limitations.

name: Developing a Flourished Hand by Bocskay
description_book: Recreate an ornate hand developed by Georg Bocskay based on folio 82 in the *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*. Students can create own examples.
description_web: Learn how to recreate a very ornate hand developed by Georg Bocskay based on folio 82 in the *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*. Students will have a chance to create their own examples.

name: Runestone Bardic Circle Practice - Alternate Site
description_book: (Amphitheater hold for "Runestone Bardic Circle Practice" in case of weather - see class for details.)

name: History of Korean Ceramics
description_book: Overview of history of ceramic ware produced on the Korean peninsula with focus on *celadon* and *buncheong* ware.
description_web: Overview of history of ceramic ware produced on the Korean peninsula with focus on *celadon* and *buncheong* ware.
fee_itemization: hand out with notes, bibliography and color pictures of key items - fee is for printing

name: Resources for In-Period (Documentable!) Names
description_book: Not yet chosen an SCA name? Don't know where to look for ideas? Online resources are available to help you research an in-period, documentable name.
description_web: Not yet chosen an SCA name? Don't know where to look for ideas? Online resources are available to help you research an in-period, documentable name.

name: Look Like You Stepped Out of a Manuscript
description_book: Learn how to construct an outfit by focusing on one primary source.
description_web: Learn how to construct an outfit by focusing on one primary source. This is a very good way to maintain a cohesive and complete look to your wardrobe, and the same principles can be applied to your whole kit.

name: Fun with Interkingdom Anthropology
description_book: How do you do things in your kingdom? Tell us, and we'll tell you how we do it in ours. Trust us, we will all learn a lot.
description_web:
How do you do things in your kingdom? Tell us, and we'll tell you how we do it in ours. Trust us, we will all learn a lot. 

If you have ever traveled in the SCA, you know things can be very different from kingdom to kingdom. Even though we have a lot in common, we have differences, too. Let's talk about them.

name: Spinning 101
description_book: Learn to spin yarn on a drop spindle. Class will include instruction on making and using a low-whorl drop spindle.
fee_itemization: Fee is for both drop spindle  and spinning supplies

name: Interrogating Your Museum
description_book: It's time to get more out of your museum. Find out what to ask, who to ask, and what to do with the answers once you have them.

name: Embellishing 16th-Century Music
description_book: A class on adding ornaments, or extra notes, especially good for dance music. Bring an instrument.
description_web: Getting bored playing for dancing? Then come learn how to jazz up your playing in a period style! This class is on adding ornaments, or extra notes, and is especially good for dance music, but applies to all 16th century. Helpful handout based on period treatises. Bring an instrument or your voice.

name: From Underwear to Gutenberg
description_book: The rise of moveable type printing.
description_web: Why did it take until the second half of the 15th century for moveable type printing to be developed? A number of technological, sociological, and fashion changes all converged to make moveable type printing not only possible, but necessary. This class will trace those changes and explain how underwear ultimately led to the printing revolution.

name: English Rosaries and Paternosters
description_book: Discusses prayer beads (paternosters) in England from the 11th to 16th centuries, especially the impact of the English Reformation.
description_web: This class focus on prayer beads (paternosters) in England from the 11th to 16th centuries, especially the impact of the English Reformation.

name: Medieval Instrument Petting Zoo
description_book: New to SCA music? Visit some of the medieval instruments we've captured! Learn how to recognize a crumhorn in the wild. Hear the call of the cornu.

name: Beginner Dance: 16th-Century Italian
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! We'll start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach simple late 16th-century Italian dances.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! We'll start with basic steps and patterns, and then teach simple late 16th-century Italian dances.

instructor: Viscountess Kamiilah al Sudanii um Zoom
name: Intermediate Middle Eastern Dance Combos
description_book: Kamiilah will be teaching some of her favorite combinations of movements, and her own style of lead-and-follow dance! If we have time, we will zill!
description_web: Kamiilah is the fearless leader of modern dance troupe RockaBelly, and is ready to share her sassy lead-and-follow combos with all of you! If we have time, we will also learn zill patterns specific to the movements.

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 19 to learn period vocal music and perform as part of the Known World Choirs Concert.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 19 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella*. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/7, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.)  More information can be found here:  https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: PA Afternoon Series: *Commedia* Experience
description_book: Come experience *Commedia dell'Arte*! Meet the characters and the actors behind them and learn to act in comic masked style.
description_web: Come experience *Commedia dell'Arte*! Meet the characters and the actors behind them and learn to act in comic masked style (movement, vocalization, express funny ideas). Experienced actors/directors from several well-known *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes will guide you if you're new, or give you free advice that's definitely worth the price to veteran performers!

name: Runestone Bardic Circle Practice - Runestone Park
description_book: Welcome, new, returning, bardic explorers: singers, songwriters, poets, storytellers, and guests! Enjoy gathering in the shade. Bardic Safe Zone!
description_web:
Bardic Safe Zone! (Formally known as "The Peerless Bardic Circle - the Tradition Continues") Welcome, first timers, rusty returners, nervous performers, and all seeking to enjoy an un-intimidating, low-key bardic circle as performer or audience! We invite all those new and exploring the bardic arts: singers, songwriters, poets, storytellers of all levels including apprentices, journeymen, and also anyone who may want to come listen and enjoy the gathering in the shade of the park near the Runestone. A few disguised Peers have been known to sneak in.
Alternate rain site at the Amphitheater. If you want to learn more about bardic circles and what they're all about, come to Lucia's "Bardic Circles 101" class in AS 9, Sunday, 8/7, at 11 am.

name: Building Scrolls Without a Book of Hours
description_book: What? No Book of Hours? Yes! Learn how to use period artwork to build scrolls and break into a new area of creativity.

name: Mommy (or Daddy) and Me Hair Braiding
description_book: Parents come with their little ones to learn to braid or French braid their child's hair. Children may wish to bring a doll to braid themselves.
description_web: This class is designed to be hands-on for parents to learn to braid their child's hair (French or standard braid). Children should have clean, brushed hair before the class and should bring their own hair tie. Parents may encourage children to bring a doll to braid themselves.

name: Practical Sheath Making
description_book: So you bought a knife at market place but it didn't come with a sheath? I can show you how to make several simple leather sheaths.
description_web: So you bought a knife at market place but it didn't come with a sheath? I can show you how to make several simple leather sheaths.

name: Animorphic Beads
description_book: This is an Intermediate Level Class-A brief overview of animal beads in history and a hands-on guide to making them.
description_web: This is an Intermediate Level Class-A brief overview of animal beads in history and a hands-on guide to making them.

name: History of Venetian *Carnivale* Masks
description_book: A look at the history and laws concerning the masks worn during Carnival time in Venice in period.
description_web: A look at the history and laws concerning the masks worn during Carnival time in Venice in period.

name: Baltic Wire Weaving
description_book: Beginner, hands-on introduction to "Viking" wire weaving techniques for making jewelry and trim. Brief discussion of history and artifacts included.
description_web: This will be a hands-on introduction to Baltic, or "Viking," wire weaving techniques for making jewelry and trim. There will be a discussion of the history of wire-woven chains as well as examples of different patterns and historical finds.
fee_itemization: Materials fee includes dowel and enough wire to finish your project

name: Book Lovers' Tea
description_book: Please bring your favorite book(s) to discuss. Books with medieval themes and topics are encouraged but not required. Be ready to take notes!
description_web: Please bring your favorite book(s) to discuss. Books with medieval themes and topics are encouraged but not required. Bring paper and pencil to jot down new authors to check out. Iced tea, water and treats will be provided.

name: Making your **Second** Garb
description_book: Moving up from the fold-over tunic, add just a few small, easy steps, and you can have something much, much nicer to wear. Beginners welcome!
description_web: OK, you've folded over the fabric and stitched up the sides. Now you're going to events regularly and you'd like to make something that fits a little better and looks a little nicer, but is still easy to make. Learn a method that will save fabric, use all straight seams and look great on any shape. Also appropriate for a first project.

name: Horn Carving
description_book: Horn carving with demo and some hands-on. Tools are limited; bring your own. De-scaling, layout, finish and treatment.
description_web: Horn carving demo with some hands-on. Limited tools, so please bring your own if you have a blade 2-4 inches long and very sharp. We will cover horn selection, layout, stop cuts with modern and period tools, working the horn, finishes and FDA food grade treatment. Age 18 and older as we will be working with very sharp tools...bring bandaids.

name: Interkingdom Brewers' Guild Competition
description_book: Brewers and vintners: Have your beverages evaluated by experts from across the Known World. Up to two entries per category. Over 21 only.
description_web: An opportunity for brewers and vintners to have their beverages evaluated by experts from across the Known World. Up to two entries per category (wine/mead, beer, cordials/others) per participant. IKBG masters are asked to help judge. Entrants are responsible for the temperature/condition of their beverage(s) as it may be some time before a particular beverage is judged. Documentation is encouraged. Over 21 only.

name: Interkingdom Brewers' Guild Roundtable
description_book: This roundtable is designed to serve as both a place to discuss period beverages as well as hang out for the IKBG. Over 21, please.
description_web: This roundtable is designed to serve as both a place to discuss period beverages as well as hang out until your beverage is called to be judged with the IKBG. It is being held in conjunction with the IKBG. All entrants are asked to wait in this area. Someone will come call you when your entry is ready to be judged. Please bring something to do/drink/discuss until your entry is called. Over 21 only.

name: A&S Competitions for Organizers, Part 1 of 3
description_book: How A&S competition organizers can help to create and encourage fun and educational activities. Part of a series.
description_web: We’ll be talking about how A&S competition organizers can create better experiences for judges and for entrants. Discussion will cover ideas on how to plan better activities as well as how to work with judges and entrants to help everyone have a fun time while also encouraging an educational atmosphere. This class ties in with "A&S Competitions for Judges" and "A&S Competitions for Entrants". You can attend any one or all three.

name: Known World Novice Championship
description_book: Fighters from all over the Known World, with two years or less experience since their primary authorization, test their skills against each other.

name: Beginner Dance: *Pavan* and *Galliard*
description_book: All beginner dancers welcome! Learn skills for improvised 16th-century dances. (Jumping optional!)
description_web: All beginner dancers welcome! Learn how to walk (and jump!) with style and rhythm, then use these skills for improvised dances of the 16th century.

name: Multiplayer Period Chess
description_book: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.
description_web: Chess games for four players. We will review rules and variations, then provide time to play.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work started in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work started in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Undulation Nation
description_book: Complex and layered undulation patterns and combinations for belly dancers. I guarantee you will learn something new and exciting.
description_web: Complex and layered undulation patterns for belly dancers. I guarantee you will learn something new and exciting. Please have mastered basic undulations. We will learn the class's choice of horizontal, diagonal, spiral, circular or other undulation patterns and fabulous new undulation combinations.

name: Sing We And Chant It: Madrigal and *A Capella* Jam
description_book: Meet-and-greet optional practice session for audience participation, "Sing We and Chant It" Madrigal and *A Capella* Jam.
description_web:
Meet-and-greet optional practice session for audience participation, "Sing We and Chant It VI", Madrigal, Part Song, and A Capella Jam, Monday, 8/8, at 6:00 pm in the Performing Arts Tent. All are welcome to come and make joyful music! Music will be available to share, or bring your own copy. (Optional: folder of music available for material fee.)
Hosts: Mistress Gianetta Andreini da Vicenza, THL Lorelei Skye, Professor Pieter van Doorn
2016 current song list available here. Please let us know if you have any suggestions to add to the mix!
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1o3qDzNt4mNvigshaX_2h6LsJlAgzUhxxjW09ejqONjA/edit?usp=sharing
fee_itemization: Photocopy fee for public domain music handouts.

name: Beyond Lucet Basics
description_book: Variations, loops, and monkey wrenches.
description_web: Starts with a basic refresher class for everyone. We then proceed to variations, loops, and monkey wrenches. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. String provided.

name: Siege Inspections
description_book: Inspection time for siege weapons to be used during battles.

name: Turkish Split-Finger Drum Workshop
description_book: Intro to Turkish split-finger technique for *doumbek*. This series is aimed at those who already know *doumbek* basics and want to open a new horizon!
description_web: Turkish split-finger technique for those who already have experience with *doumbek/darbuka*. Day 1: Left hand splits and new ways of producing familiar rhythms. Day 2: Right hand splits and interlace rolls. Day 3: Opening the possibilities and a fun Turkish rhythm -- *Kerfes*.

name: Empire of the Sun Battle
description_book: Japanese tournament and battle.
description_web: Japanese tournament and battle.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Lists open for melee activities.
description_web: Lists open for melee activities.

name: Bagpiping History
description_book: Historically associated with Scotland, they were played all over Europe and the Near East. Learn about the different types and their evolution.
description_web: The bagpipes are associated with Scotland, but historically, they were played all over Europe and the Near East. Learn about the different types of bagpipes played throughout history, and the evolution of various instruments, including various flutes, shawms, and several modern instruments. There will be a discussion of how to make simple reed flutes, if desired. There will not be a practicum portion of this class.

name: Illumination: It's Not That Scary
description_book: A class for the absolute beginner. We'll review a basic Celtic knot, basic vine work and where to find resources. Please bring a pencil.
description_web:
This class is for the absolute beginner or someone who has thought about doing illumination but thought it was too hard. I'll show the tricks I've learned to create Celtic knots, simple vine work and other resources I've found to get you started in illumination.

Please bring a mechanical pencil and an eraser.

name: Throw Away Your Wristwatch: Basic and Advanced
description_book: Period methods of timekeeping. First 10 minutes teaches several ways to tell time. Last 40 minutes teaches you how to tell time anywhere, anytime.
description_web: Learn period methods of timekeeping to tell time day and night at Pennsic. Basic course (first 10 minutes) teaches several ways to tell time. Advanced course delves into the science and teaches more ways to tell time so you can tell time anywhere, anytime.

name: Basic Name Documentation
description_book: Have you decided on name and don't know how to document it? We'll go over the basic methods of documenting names for the College of Heralds.
description_web: This class is for heralds and non heralds. The class will review the basic methods of documenting a name for submission. There will be tips and tricks to make it easy to document a name.

name: Developing Your Japanese Persona
description_book: Designed to take an individual through the process of building and fully developing any Japanese persona.
description_web: Designed to take an individual through the process of building and fully developing any Japanese persona. Focuses on thinking through back story to add realism to one's SCA identity. Good for newcomers and old hands alike.

name: Trans, Intersex, and Third Gender in the SCA
description_book: Define gender diversity, explore sex/gender minorities in both modern and historical perspectives; how minority inclusion helps with recruitment.
description_web: Trans, Intersex and Third Gender in the SCA will be a two-part class. The first part  defines gender diversity terms and explore sex and gender minorities in both modern and historical perspectives. Then we focus on how the inclusion of minority groups can help with recruitment and retention in the Society. The second part will be a roundtable discussion of the themes and ideas presented in the first section.

name: Dining With: Hands-On Culinary Anthropology
description_book: An in-depth discussion on how to form a cohesive group dedicated to producing a period-specific feast, including pitfalls and benefits.
description_web: An in-depth discussion on how to form a cohesive group dedicated to producing a period-specific feast, including pitfalls and benefits. Includes discussion of research methodology, cooking techniques, and the discovery process involved in creating food that people really want to eat.

name: Are You Wearing a Tablecloth? Greek Clothing!
description_book: Learn how to create Greek garb easily, accurately, and with style! Meet Greek style, form, and ideals for the easiest garb ever!
description_web: We all deal with hot weather in the summer. Learn how to do so easily, accurately, and with style! We will cover basic Greek style, form, and ideals, then go into fabrics, colors, trims, and accessories to create a great classical and cool look.

name: Making a Glastonbury "Lite" Chair
description_book: Learn the tips and techniques behind a folding chair with Glastonbury-style arms. Optional CD available for $5
description_web:
Tired of the look and limited life span of Coleman chairs? Learn the tips and techniques you need to make a wooden folding chair with Glastonbury-style arms. It folds to 6" thick, holds up to 300 lbs, (my wife and I tested it), and can be decorated.
Additional information on a CD will be available for $5.
fee_itemization:
$1.00 for optional handout
$5.00 for optional disc

instructor: Master Dani of the Seven Wells
name: European Table Manners
description_book: Table manners in a world of shared dishes and no forks. How to eat, where to sit, how to serve.
description_web: Table manners in a world of shared dishes and no forks. How to eat, where to sit, how to serve.

name: *Cascarde*: Brought to You by the Letter G
description_book: Two *Cascarde* from Caroso's *Il Ballarino*: *Giunto M'Ha Amore* and *Gloria d'Amore*. Familiarity with 16th-century Italian steps helpful.
description_web: Two *Cascarde*, fun and lively Italian dances, from Caroso's *Il Ballarino*: *Giunto M'Ha Amore* and *Gloria d'Amore*. If you already know and love *Gracca Amorosa*, you'll enjoy these too. If not, come see what you've been missing! Familiarity with 16th-century Italian is steps is helpful.

location: Denys the Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs. AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: Glass Gilding: *Verre Églomisé*
description_book: Create a small *verre églomisé* (glass gilding) item using period glass water gilding technique.
description_web: Glass gilding, or *verre églomisé*, used in Roman antiquity, reached great popularity in the 14th and 15th centuries. It was often incorporated into reliquaries, furniture, and *objects d'art*. Participants will create a small *verre églomisé* work using the *églomisé* water gilding technique.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWC *Chorulus Pennsicus*
description_book: Closed rehearsals, by audition only.
description_web:
Closed rehearsals by audition only. 
*Chorulus Pennsicus* information available here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/chorulus-pennsicus

name: An Introduction to Indian Rhythms
description_book: Learn about Indian rhythm instruments, their history, how they are played and how to play with them. Bring your instrument and learn some new rhythms.

name: Target Archery Marshals' Meeting
description_book: Meet in the Marshals' Tent on the Archery Range, Fri., Aug. 5, and Sun., Aug. 7, for those who missed Friday's meeting
description_web: There will a target archery marshals' meeting in the Marshals' Tent on the Archery Range on Friday, August 5th, at 5 pm. There will also be an archery marshals' meeting on Sunday, August 7th, at 5 pm, for all those marshals who did not or could not make the meeting on Friday.

name: The Renaissance Barber-Surgeon
description_book: The instructor will use reproduction medical tools and facsimile texts to explain medical and surgical techniques and the role of the Barber-Surgeon.

name: Healthy Projection and Professional Presentation
description_book: Discuss breathing, resonance, and acoustics for the active voice herald, story teller, or singer from an operatic perspective. Masterclass-style.
description_web: Discussion of breathing, resonance and acoustics for the active voice herald, landed baron(ess), story teller, or singer from an opera singer's perspective, with a lecture followed by a masterclass-style session with any willing participants.

name: Trans, Intersex, and Third Gender in History
description_book: An in-depth exploration of the evolution of sex and gender throughout history. Discussing viragos, eunuchs, "trans saint" motif, and more.
description_web: We will build upon the themes introduced in Trans, Intersex and Third Gender in the SCA. This class will explore in-depth sex/gender minority groups focusing on but not limited to viragos, eunuchs, and the "trans saint" motif.

name: Viking Age Furniture: Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of the major finds of Viking Age furniture, with help to interpret the finds to make accurate reproductions.
description_web: A brief survey of the major finds of Viking Age furniture, with an emphasis on interpreting the finds to make reasonably accurate reproductions. We will cover digs at Norse sites such as Oseberg, Gokstad, Birka, Dublin, Hedeby, etc.

name: Everyday Life in Shakespeare's England
description_book: A survey of how English subjects lived in the late 16th century.
description_web: Exactly what it says on the tin. London life will be the central focus, and the experience of a range of social classes will be addressed.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to Gypsy Persona
description_book: Don't know how/where to start with this persona? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

name: *Mercantia*
description_book: A neat dance for three lords and one lady. Merchants try to woo her while her lord is away. Intermediate+ level dance due to time signature changes.
description_web: A neat dance for three lords and one lady. Merchants try to win her hand / woo her while her lord is away. Intermediate. Expert level dance due to tempo and time signature changes. But if you are feeling brave and have danced 15th-century Italian, I welcome you to join us!

name: Pennsic Archery Champions Practice/Tryouts
description_book: All archers wishing to make the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices.
description_web: All archers wishing to be on the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices. See either the East Kingdom Captain General or the Midrealm Lt General for more details.

instructor: Viscountess Kamiilah al Sudanii um Zoom
name: Middle Eastern Line Dances
description_book: Come and learn Middle Eastern line dances!

name: Collegium Musicum
description_book: **Advanced** reading, playing for **Renaissance* instruments (wind, string, brass, etc.) and voices. 3 sessions for 1 performance. Bring music stand.
description_web: **Advanced** reading and playing session for **Renaissance** instruments, to include brass, strings, wind (soft, semi and loud) in a **consort**-style setting. Music will be available in June for download from the Known World Choir website. This is not a class for beginning players. Bring music stand.
fee_itemization: Onsite fee for music packets and folders.

name: Magyar Tales
description_book: Enter the Magyar (Hungarians) world with a telling of their tales. Zsof will tell of ghosts, vampires, battles, and strength of her people.
description_web: Join Zsof into the world of the Magyar (Hungarians) with a telling of their tales. She will tell of ghosts, vampires, battles, and the strength of her people.

name: A Little Knight Music
description_book: M. Rosalind Jehanne and M. John Lyttleton present songs of chivalry, humor, and nobility, accompanied by good friends.
description_web: M. Rosalind Jehanne and M. John Lyttleton present songs of chivalry, humor, and nobility, accompanied by good friends. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: Open Torch
description_book: During any unused class times, torches, tools and glass will be made available to experienced lampworkers for open torch time!
description_web: During any unused class time, torches, tools and glass will be made available to experienced lampworkers for open torch time.

name: Valkyrie's *Vinyasa* Yoga
description_book: Flow sequence of very athletic poses. Some prior yoga experience is a plus but not necessary. Bring mat, towel, and water. You will sweat!
description_web: Flow sequence of very athletic poses. Begins with a breathing exercise followed by yoga poses. Some prior yoga experience is a plus but not necessary. Bring a mat, towel, and water. Extra mats available but very limited. Be prepared to move and sweat!

name: Combat of the Thirty
description_book: This is a 30-versus-30 deed of arms inspired by the original Combat of the Thirty between French and English forces that occurred in 1351.
description_web:
This is a 30-versus-30 deed of arms inspired by the original Combat of the Thirty between French and English forces that occurred in 1351. Combat standards are a modified counted-blows scenario that employs rules for capturing opponents and ransoming of captured parties. Participants must be acceptable to the captains of the French and English forces. Armour must be a reasonable attempt at a complete 14th-C harness, and weapons are restricted to ones that closely resemble their medieval counterparts. Final say on weapons and appropriate harness will be at the sole discretion of the captains.
    Requirements: All participants must wear a 14th-C kit. Greaves are required and all are encouraged to wear chausses and braies. All weapons must closely resemble their medieval counterpart and are restricted to bastard swords, polearms of period design (axes, hammers, etc.), spears under 7', daggers and single-handed swords. All participants should be prepared to pay a ransom that they feel is appropriate to their station in the event that they are "captured" during this deed of arms. Rules of combat will be explained to all combatants before the CotT begins.

name: Atlatl Battle
description_book: This will be an Atlatl battle on the battlefield near the castle.

name: 16th-Century Embroidery Pattern Books
description_book: In fall 2015 the Met exhibited pattern books, and related lace and embroidery. If you missed it, here is your chance to see pictures.
description_web: In the fall 2015, the Met Museum exhibited their extensive collection of 16th-century pattern books, along with period laces and embroideries created from the patterns. I will show my photos of the exhibit and we can discuss the significance of the books for the history of embroidery and lace making. Handout will include a few sample patterns. I'm not an expert, just inspired by this incredible resource, so please share what you know, too.

name: Glass Workers Meet 'n Greet
description_book: Calling **all** glass workers! Join us for the Meet 'n Greet. Food, friends and fun! What could be better?
description_web: Calling **all** glass workers! Join us for a few hours of fun at this year's Meet 'n Greet. Catch up with old friends and make new ones! We will have snacks and maybe even some fun games with some prizes to win! We would also encourage you to bring some small tokens, and maybe even some little cards with your contact information to share with others. We look forward to seeing you!

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Duke Moonwulf and Michael Longcor
description_book: The concert that has become a Pennsic tradition! Songs, stories, history and hijinkery with Duke Moonwulf, Michael Longcor, and surprise friends.
description_web: The concert that has become a Pennsic tradition! Songs, stories, history and hijinkery with Duke Moonwulf Starkaadhersson along with his special guest/alter ego, Michael Longcor, and surprise friends.

instructor: Mistress Jenna MacPherson of Lions Towe
name: A Night with Knights
description_book: We invite members of the Chivalry of all kingdoms to come share your expertise on the Youth Combat field.
description_web: We invite members of the Chivalry of all kingdoms to come share your expertise on the Youth Combat field. Sparring between adults and youths will be allowed only under these special training conditions. All weapons, calibration, and conventions will be as per Pennsic Youth Combat Rules. *Youth fighters*, invite a Knight or Master of Arms from your group, kingdom, camp, or household to come along!

name: Known World Youth Combat Meet and Greet
description_book: An informal get-together with the Society DEM for Youth Combat. Get the latest updates, meet other youth marshals, and ask questions.
description_web: An informal get-together with the Society Deputy Earl Marshal for Youth Combat. Get the latest updates, meet other youth marshals, and ask questions.

name: Beginner's Ball
description_book: Never danced? Meant to learn? Want to impress a date? We can help! Every dance taught for this ball. No partner needed! Easy-to-learn dances!
description_web: The perfect ball for people eager to dance but still learning. Never danced? Not a problem! Have you been meaning to learn but never made a class? That’s okay! Maybe you’d like to take your partner out onto the floor? You’re both welcome! For the Beginner’s Ball we teach all of the dances and everyone is welcome. No partner is needed. You are encouraged to bring your friends! The more the merrier!

name: Known World Siege Marshal Social
description_book: A social meeting for informal discussions about siege combat and marshaling.
description_web: To promote convivial dialogue amongst the various groups of siege marshals in the Known World, THL Diccon de Reinport is pleased to announce the 7th Annual Known World Siege Marshal Social to be hosted at the Holt Heroetus encampment at Pennsic War 45. Please join us for informal discussions about siege combat and marshaling and any other topics of interest.

name: *Guedra*: North African Trance Dance
description_book: Brief instruction in dance followed by participation in *Guedra* ritual. All levels. Bring water. Bring a veil if you want to dance. Women only.
description_web: Dance and chant will be taught, as well as some background info. New information this year, as Mistress Jadi Fatima joins us. 30-45 minutes instruction (men welcome during instruction only) followed by performance of *Guedra*. Until our voices give out, we'll chant the *Guedra* for 1 to 4 dancers at a time. Bring a veil if you think you might want to dance. Everyone must participate in chant; no singing talent required, no dancing experience necessary. Bring water. Avoid wearing large jewelry.

name: Efenwealt Wystle and Aénor d'Anjou
description_book: For over 25 years these loopy Laurels have been making musical magic with their mix of sundry other songs. Join in the annual concert fun!
description_web: For over 25 years these loopy Laurels have been making musical magic with their mix of medieval melodies, buffoonish ballads, terpsichorean tirades and sundry other songs for SCA folk. Join in the fun for their annual Pennsic concert!

name: Celebration of Life: Countess Aidan ní Leir
description_book: Our sister Aidan was taken from us too soon, and her passing gave us insufficient time to mourn. Join us to raise a glass, sing a song, tell a story.
description_web: By the grace of Their Majesties, we will gather in Æthelmearc Royal at 8:30 pm on Sunday, 7 August, to remember Countess Aidan, OR, OL, OP, etc., and the many contributions she made to the East, Æthelmearc, and the Society. We call for all her many friends to join us for a drink (or two) and light refreshments.

name: *i Sebastiani!*
description_book: *i Sebastiani!* The greatest *Commedia dell'Arte* troupe in the entire world!
description_web: Buon giorno! O, you lucky people! Truly you are blessed among the living, for into your lives has come *i Sebastiani*, the Greatest *Commedia dell'Arte* Troupe in the Entire World! Join us as we improvise, from the thinnest of outlines, a wondrous entertainment in three acts. You will be glad that you did! *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12*.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.
description_web: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

location: Thunder Bird Atlatl  (Thunder Bird Atlatl Booth #80)
name: How to Make an Atlatl Dart
description_book: How to make an atlatl dart from start to cast. Limit of four students participating in each class.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Lists open for melee activities.
description_web: Lists open for melee activities.

name: A Hand A Day: Rotunda Minuscule
description_book: Beginning calligraphers will use a marker to learn the techniques to successfully write this late-period Italian script. All materials provided.
description_web: Need to learn a late-period Italian script for those MoD scrolls? Today, students will use a calligraphy marker to learn the techniques needed to write the lower-case letters successfully; tomorrow's class will focus on the capitals. Specialty nibs will be available for purchase for those wishing to try an unusual variation.
fee_itemization: IInterested students may purchase the marker for an additional fee.

name: Playtime with Period Pigments
description_book: This is an hour to sit and play with period pigments. I will have my extensive palette with materials, and will field questions as you play.
description_web: This is an hour to sit and play with period pigments. I will have my extensive palette, brushes, pergamenata and Bristol board, plus some pre-printed designs on card stock for those who wish to see what it is all about, and try using the “real thing.” I will be glad to field questions as we paint. Handout on CD, optional. Sample palettes, $20 each, **limited quantities**, optional.
fee_itemization: 5 for OPTIONAL CD of of information, $5 for in-class consumables

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia*, before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.

name: The Bayeux Tapestry
description_book: Construction and history of this embroidered wall hanging from 1066, including hints and tips for making your own tapestry.

name: Bridging the SCA Generation Gap
description_book: Newcomers and veterans can learn from each other to make our Society better. Learn how one Barony became more welcoming and grew by leaps and bounds.

name: Lampwork Basics
description_book: Explore making lampwork beads. Class is hands-on. Wear natural fibers with hair back, closed-toe shoes, and loose fabric tied up.
fee_itemization: Fee covers gas and glass. Limited to the first 8 students

name: Where's Lord Waldo?
description_book: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.
description_web: A look at the history and trivia of SCA geography.

name: Equestrian Research Sources
description_book: We'll focus on the sources available to the researcher concerning equestrian arts and equipment used in the Middle Ages.
description_web: This class will focus on the sources available to the researcher concerning equestrian arts and equipment used in the Middle Ages. The emphasis is on locating sources for documentation of projects and as a guide to creating your own equestrian related pieces. The last part of the class will feature a roundtable discussion of favorite sources of participants.

name: Roses, Part 1: Then and Now
description_book: A survey of roses that were available and/or cultivated during our period and how they compare to roses commonly grown today.
fee_itemization: Handouts are in color so fee to cover that expense

name: The Very New Persona
description_book: You're brand, spanking new, and you don't know who you want to be? No worries! I'll talk through good starting points, and then we just chat. Relax!
description_web: You're brand, spanking new, and you don't know who or what you want to be? No worries! I'll talk through common considerations and good starting points for information. After we go through the basics, we just chat about our thoughts. Relax! It's not supposed to be work!

name: So What Is This Research Thing Anyway?
description_book: Are you new to the SCA, or just new to research? Do you know what you want to research, or maybe not know at all? This class will get you started!
description_web: Are you new to the SCA, or just new to research? Do you know what you want to research, or maybe not know at all? This class will get you started on a path right for you. The class will be individualized by the attendees' interests. Participation will be encouraged. Research is fun! Let's start your research path together! Please bring your own notebook and pen to bring home your brainstorms.

name: How to Make and Use Stencils for Printing Garb
description_book: Learn to make stencils and use them for garb and more. Covers methods of making and printing. Extensive materials list. Please join Facebook group.
description_web: We will make stencils for printing textiles: garb, banners, walls, tabards, floor cloths, etc., **and** we will print with them. Students will need to bring some design ideas already printed out. Keep it simple as you will be cutting it out with your scissors and/or a razor knife. This class is not child-friendly. Extensive materials list. Please join Facebook group: Printed Textile Classes for Pennsic 45.
fee_itemization: Five sheets of transparency paper for $1 as needed.

name: Children's Doll Meet
description_book: Open to children ages 3-18 years old. Please bring your favorite doll to the class, as you will be making something for your doll.
description_web: Open to children ages 3-18 years old. Please bring your favorite doll to the class, as we will be making something for them. All dolls are welcome: ball jointed, cloth, plastic, porcelain, anime. Please note: an adult may be required to help with the craft.

name: Off-Grid Solutions for Disability Support
description_book: Off-grid power solutions: class and discussion. Please bring a power adapter or clear picture. Solutions for specific needs will be created.

name: How to Carve a Viking Horse
description_book: Learn whittling basics: Make a Viking toy horse in the Trondheim style. Includes discussion of tools, techniques, sharpening. All materials provided.
description_web: Learn the basics of whittling by making a Viking toy horse in the Trondheim style.  We will also discuss Viking tools, techniques and sharpening. All tools and materials will be provided. Warning! Very sharp knives are involved. Students must be at least 14 years old and have their mother's or wife's permission to attend. Bandages will be provided.

name: Why Never to Make a Bargin with Loki
description_book: An analysis of Loki's silver-tongued bargains and bedevilry as expressed in the Poetic and Prose Eddas.
description_web: An analysis of Loki's silver-tongued bargains and bedevilry as expressed in the Poetic and Prose Eddas.

name: Bouncy Children's Dances
description_book: You're never too young to be welcome in the dance tent. Come play and learn with a variety of energetic dances for all ages.

name: Thumb Ring Archery
description_book: Learn how to shoot like a Mongol. Requires a horse bow and arrows at least 4" longer than your finger draw. Some rings will be available for sale.
description_web: Learn to shoot the way Mongols and other steppes and horse archers did. Lord Naran Numuchi, Bow Khan of the Great Dark Horde, Companion of the Order of the Yew Bow (Atlantia), Ponte Alto Baronial Marshal, and many times Archery Champion, has been shooting thumb ring since 1998, and has focused on the use and history of static-eared recurve bows the whole time.

name: Heraldic Road Show
description_book: Come watch and participate as the Sovereigns of Arms decide a letter. This is highly entertaining and very educational. All are welcome.
description_web: Come watch and participate as the Sovereigns of Arms explain by examples how decisions are made for names and devices. This is highly entertaining and very educational for heralds of all levels. All are welcome.

name: Coal and Charcoal for Forging
description_book: A review of my experiments with charcoal manufacture and the pros and cons of each fuel.

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: *Rajasthani* for Performance
description_book: Ages 4 (with parent) to 100, come learn a dance to a song from India. Bring two scarves or one large skirt. We will perform at the Expo or a hafla!
description_web: Any gender, ages 4 (with parent) to 100, come learn a dance to a song from India. Bring two scarves or one large skirt if you can. We will perform at the Expo or a hafla! Come have fun!

name: Card-Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and, using cards, you will weave a trim strip.
description_web: Warp a loom and weave a small strap or trim piece. Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave a trim strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own. Fee covers string and cards; take your work home with you.

name: Charity Tournament
description_book: Triple elimination, progressive weapons tournament with a donation ($5 recommended) to "buy" your place in the tournament.
description_web: The Freescholars of Atlantia invite you to participate in the 11th annual Freescholar Charity Tournament. A donation ($5 recommended) secures your place in this contest. The format will be triple elimination, with progressive weapons forms following Atlantian rapier conventions. Combatants start first with single sword. Upon taking a loss, the combatant may take up a defensive secondary. Upon taking a second loss, the combatant may take up an offensive secondary.  All proceeds will be donated to Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation (JDRF). This is a cause very close to the heart of one of our own.

name: Populace Throw
description_book: Declare your side, throw three weapons (axe, knife, spear) in all three styles; up to four rounds in total throughout the days allotted.
description_web: Open to everyone able to throw. A round consists of 3 throws each of axe, knife and spear at hard targets. You will be permitted to throw 4 rounds throughout the days the competition is open or all within a single day. There will be a special range set-up just  for this competition. Scoring will be a simple 3-­2-­1 system. If you stick, you get points.

name: Thrown Weapon Marshal Training: Part 2
description_book: Learn kingdom rules to be a thrown weapons marshal. Parts 1 and 2 are required with on-the-range training and a written test on Friday.
description_web: Learn kingdom rules to be a thrown weapons marshal. Parts 1 and 2 are required with on-the-range training and a written test on Friday.

name: Brass Band: Drop-In Playing
description_book: Sackbut and cornetto drop-in playing. Tired of all of those crazy loud double reeds? Enjoy some sublime brass-only ensemble playing. Bring your chair.
description_web: Sackbut and cornetto drop-in playing. Tired of all of those crazy loud double reeds? Enjoy some sublime brass-only ensemble playing. High pitch sackbuts (alto) especially welcome. Bring music if you have any you would like to try. Bring a chair (maybe). Not for beginners!

name: So You Think You Might Want to Scribe?
description_book: This is a light introduction to the scribal arts with some practical exercises. Designed for those who have an interest in exploring the scribal arts.
description_web: This is a light introduction to the scribal arts with some practical exercises. Designed for those who have an interest in exploring the scribal arts but find it intimidating to approach. You will **not** feel intimidated after an hour with me! Come find out about the fun side of calligraphy and Illumination. Handout on CD, optional.
fee_itemization: $3 for CD handout and $2 for in-class consumables

name: Fool's School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/10, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Poetry Day
description_book: Knowne World Poetry Competition. Demonstrations of styles of poetry used within our time period.

name: Drop Spinning 101
description_book: Want to learn to drop spin or have had a hard time picking it up? Come and learn using a high whorl spindle. Spindles and wool will be provided.
description_web: Want to learn to drop spin or have had a hard time picking it up? Come and learn using a high whorl spindle. Spindles and wool will be provided. Spindles can be purchased for $3.00.

name: Sexy, Silly, Scheming Saints
description_book: Think saints' lives are boring? Think again! We'll explore saint stories from *The Golden Legend* that would fit right in on prime time TV.
description_web: Slept through Sunday school? Think saints' lives are boring? Think again! In this class, we'll explore saint stories from the medieval bestseller, *The Golden Legend*, that would fit right in on prime time TV. (Some themes not appropriate for children.)

name: Event Finances: Before, During and After
description_book: From budget to gate to the event report. A discussion of event finances, based on Chapter 9 of the *Local Exchequer Handbook*. Includes NMS/AMD.

name: Introduction to Shoemaking
description_book: We will discuss the tools, materials and techniques necessary to make the simple turnshoe (#99) from "Shoes and Pattens."
description_web: We will discuss the tools, materials and techniques necessary to make the simple turnshoe (#99) from "Shoes and Pattens."

name: Roses, Part 2: How to Grow Period Roses
description_book: How to plant and grow varieties of period roses; where to find period varieties, what to do about pests (both insect and diseases).
description_web: We will discuss how to plant and grow varieties of period roses. I will cover where to find period varieties, how to plant and care for them, what to do about pests (both insect and diseases), and, if there is time, propagating rose plants.

name: Period Patterns: 16th-Century Tailoring Books
description_book: A practical look at the patterns of Juan de Alcega, et al, exploring what they meant in period, and what they can mean for modern construction.
description_web: Juan de Alcega and other master tailors of the 16th century produced tailoring books rich with detailed instructions and complete patterns. These were widely used to construct garments of the time, and they can help us improve our garment construction today. Will cover patterns for both men's and women's clothing!

name: Pulling the Teeth out of Stage Fright
description_book: We'll pin down this ugly-muggly monster, dissect some elements of anxiety, wrestle common buggaboos, and practice some spook-busting techniques.
description_web: The vast majority of us experience **some** level of stage fright or performance anxiety, whether it's in a bardic space, or the CEO's office. We'll pin down this ugly-muggly monster, dissect some of the elements of anxiety, wrestle our most common buggaboos into the daylight, and practice some spook-busting techniques.  Focused on Bardic Arts, but applicable to all performances.

name: *Cholis*: Yes, They Are Period; You Can Make One!
description_book: Drawing on historic artwork, this class will provide an overview of *cholis* followed by pattern construction demonstrations for two different styles.
description_web: Drawing on historic artwork, this class will provide an overview of a selection of women's *choli*/upper body garments, covering a broad range of times and places within medieval India. Documentation gained from historic artwork will be discussed followed by a demonstration of pattern construction to ensure a well-fitting and comfortable garment.

name: Make It / Take It: Small Flat Splint Basket
description_book: Learn to make a small square basket out of flat reed splints.
description_web: Learn to make a small square basket out of flat reed splints.

name: English Country Dance for Three Couples
description_book: Come to the dance tent to learn intermediate dances *Stingo, Chestnut* and *Burley Mariners*. Dancers of all levels are welcome.
description_web: Come to the dance tent to learn intermediate dances *Stingo, Chestnut* and *Burley Mariners*. Dancers of all levels are welcome.

name: Laugh and Lie Down
description_book: A simple trick-taking card game played with a tarot deck, fun for children and adults.
description_web: A simple trick-taking card game played with a tarot deck, fun for children and adults.

location: Good Friends Camp (N-01, usually on St. Lawrence)
name: Coptic Sketch Book
description_book: Students will learn to build a small Coptic sketch book with wood covers and exposed spine.
description_web: New just last year, students will build a small Coptic sketch book with wood covers and exposed spine using techniques used in Egypt in the 4th to 8th centuries. The beauty of this book is that it can lie flat for sketching or note-taking.
fee_itemization: Fee includes wood boards, paper, linen thread, and a handout.

name: MOAB
description_book:
This battle will consist of 3 field segments plus the castle. The field segments will 
include a mountain pass, a town, and a wall.
description_web: This battle will consist of 3 field segments plus the castle. The field segments will include a mountain pass, a town, and a wall. The attacking army will start at the entrance to the mountain pass. The defending army may divide their forces anywhere within the three field segments at the start of the battle. The attacking army will have unlimited resurrections. The defending army will have one life outside the castle and one life inside the castle. When killed outside the castle, a defender should move to the castle. Attacker resurrections will take place at the entrance to the mountain pass. Attacker resurrections will be spontaneous. Once the castle is captured (i.e., the last defender killed), the sides will flip and run the scenario again. The victor in the battle is the side which captures all four zones in the least amount of time. The attacking force must proceed through the mountain pass, then through the town and then through the wall. There will be no time stoppage before proceeding from one field segment to the next. Attackers do not have to kill all defenders in a segment before proceeding to the next field segment. All field segments have to be captured (i.e., all defenders killed) before attacking the castle. After all defenders are killed in the field segments, there will be a 10-minute break before the castle segment begins. Attacking siege weapons may be set up inside the mountain areas. Siege placed in these areas may be targeted by defending siege weapons and may be moved out of these areas as desired. Siege weapons set up in this area may not attack defending troops in the mountain pass. They  may start attacking the town as soon as defending troops in the town are engaged by attacking troops. In the town, attacking siege weapons may move up to the northern edge of the northernmost row of buildings. In the town, combat archers may not fire over the walls of the  buildings but may fire through the doorways. At the wall, combat archers may not fire over the wall but may fire through the openings. Siege may fire over the wall. If destroyed, attacking siege weapons must get a combat inspection before they may resume firing. Defending siege weapons may be placed in the town or behind the wall at the beginning of the battle. If destroyed, they may be moved off of the field into the castle for the castle segment. Gleaning of siege ammo is allowed for both the attackers and defenders. On the castle wall there will be three siege targets. The target on the left will be used for the left side of the castle. The target in the center will be used for the gate. The target on the right will be used for the right side of the castle. The targets must be struck three times to be considered destroyed. Destroyed targets will be lowered or removed. Attackers may not cross the road until at least one of the siege targets has been destroyed. Attackers may not pass the front edge of the castle in a given area before the siege target for that area has been destroyed. Defenders may leave the castle in an area to harry or harass attackers once the siege target for that area has been destroyed. Defending combat archers and siege may fire on the attacking army as soon as the castle segment beings. Defenders may not cross the road during the castle  segment. Attacking siege engines will be set up across the road from the castle. Defending siege may be set up in the castle during the break. There will be a no-fly zone for CA and siege on the east side of the castle as determined by the marshals. All holds during this battle are general. The clock stops during holds. Start time: 10 am. Time limit: None, battle is run twice. Resurrection: Attackers have unlimited resurrection. Defenders have one life outside castle and one inside. Combat archery: Yes.  Siege weapons: Yes

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.  Student Performance, Thursday, 8/1,1 6-7 pm at the Amphitheater. Bring a blanket or chair to enjoy the performance on the green.

name: Pennsic Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! Singing in the Choir is an intense and rewarding experience with a concert Thursday War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! This year's concert theme is "Of Love and Whimsy." The repertoire includes pieces by Morley, Marenzio, Scandello, Gesualdo, Dowland, and the ever-popular Anonymous. Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on Thursday evening of War Week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is helpful, but not required if you learn the music in advance. Sheet music and audio tracks are available online now at https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsicxliiichoirs

name: I.33 Training and Slow Play Session
description_book: Explore sword and buckler fencing in the style of the *Walpurgis Fechtbuch* (Ms. I.33) and discover the joys of martial development through slow play.
description_web: Run by an avid practitioner of I.33 and disciple of the discipline of slow-play fencing, this workshop will breakdown the fundamental assumptions of I.33 sword and buckler fencing, explore a number of partner drills, and conclude with slow-play session designed to apply the art in a safe and inspiring manner. Fencing gear, a buckler (approx 14" max) and an arming sword (approx 32" max) are the suggested equipment, but some loaner gear will be provided.

name: Beginner Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn to throw axes, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.
description_web: Learn to throw axes, basic care of your weapons, and basic rules. A hands-on session is included. Limit of 25 participants; no experience necessary.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Beginning Drumming
description_book: Basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. A 4-part class; different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum.**
description_web:
Learn the basic rhythms used most often in drum circles and music within the SCA. This is a 4-part class that teaches different rhythms each day. **Bring your own drum**.
Day 1- *Saidi, Beladi, Maqsum*
Day 2- *Chiftitelli, Masmoudi*
Day 3- *Ayub, Malfouf*
Day 4- *Kashlimah* and other strange stuff

name: Scribal Abbreviations Practicum
description_book: Learn how to apply medieval scribal abbreviations to Latin and English texts. Hands-on class; familiarity with Gothic scripts a prerequisite.
description_web: Abbreviations were extensively used in medieval Latin texts, particularly in charters and books. Learn the principles of abbreviation and then apply them by copying actual texts in Latin and English (no knowledge of Latin required). We will also talk about the approaches to large-scale scribal projects such as books.  Skill level: Intermediate to advanced. You should have a good working knowledge of Gothic script(s). Bring your own pens and paper; some limited supplies will be available to borrow.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): Pennsic *Commedia* All Stars
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Archery Populace War Point
description_book: Three challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the one War Point for each shoot.
description_web: All archers young and old are encouraged to come and lend their support to their kingdom's efforts, and to display their skill at archery. There will be three challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the one War Point for each shoot.

name: Recreating Anglo-Saxon Glass Beads
description_book: Class begins with a lecture-style overview of resources and information on Anglo-Saxon glass beads. We will then spend time recreating a few beads.
description_web: This class will begin with an overview of resources and information on Anglo-Saxon glass beads. I will review different bead types and information about how necklace styles changed over time during the Anglo-Saxon period. I will bring some of my own projects and documentation to share with the class in the hope of encouraging students to take up some Anglo-Saxon-related recreation projects. During the second half of the class we will spend some time recreating a few Anglo-Saxon beads. The number of people who can make beads during the second half of the class will depend on the number of torches available in the hot glass tent. Those who wish to make beads should (at the very least) be comfortable making and shape a basic bead. More experienced lampworkers are encouraged to help out during the hands-on portion of the class and to bring any Anglo-Saxon-related resources and projects to share with the group.

name: Periodness of the Pennsic Homes
description_book: Did anything exist in the pre-17th-century European world that looked like a Pennsic House? Yes! Come to the class to find out when and where!
description_web: Many people love to see the Pennsic homes - those houses built on trailers - but how "period correct" are they? Did anything even remotely similar exist in the pre-17th-century world? Yes, it did. Handouts will be given showing various depictions of homes on wheels in illuminations.
fee_itemization: $3 for paper printouts of illuminations in color with text desciptions

name: From Queen Teuta of Illyria to Grainne Ni Mhaille
description_book: This class will explore the rich history of women in piracy.  Why they took to the sea and how they shaped their own stories.

name: Historical Uses of Poisons
description_book: A rundown of the weaponization of poisons in history garnered from various resources.
description_web: A review of the weaponization of poisonous plants (and two rocks) as recorded in history. A summary garnered from various resources, the compilation paints a unique picture of warfare and weaponization techniques from several cultures.

name: The SCA's Greatest Hits
description_book: An overview of some of the most popular songs and singers in the SCA available on CD or as downloads. There will be recorded music and information.
description_web: An overview of some of the most popular songs and singers in the SCA available on CD or as downloads. Artists will incude Heather Dale, John Inchingham, Hector of the Black Height, Ken Theriot, Lisa Theriot, Lorelei Skye, Efenwealt Whystle, Baldwin of Erebor, Aneleda Falconbridge and a host of Calontiri. There will be others, too. (Two hours, but you'll get a lot if you can just stay one hour.)

name: Divination: Palmistry
description_book: History, theory, and practice of one of the most ancient of divinatory arts, palm reading. Hands-on class. Learn to read each other's palms in class.
description_web: History, theory, and practice of one of the most ancient of divinatory arts, palm reading. Learn to read the secrets of a soul, writ upon the hand for only the wise to see. This is a hands-on class where you will actually read each others' palms.

name: Medieval Business Practices
description_book: Explore how modern accounting practices evolved following the changes in business during the Middle Ages and Renaissance.
description_web: The most basic accounting techniques used by businesses worldwide today had their start in 12th- and 13th-century Europe, and continued being refined throughout the Renaissance. This class teaches about the sweeping changes in trade that made this evolution necessary...and also changed the face of Europe.

name: Early Period Irish Roundtable
description_book: An informal roundtable for anyone interested in pre-Norman Ireland. Show off projects and bring your favorite research resources.
description_web: An informal roundtable for anyone interested in pre-Norman Ireland. Show off projects and bring your favorite research resources. Come discuss any aspect of early period Ireland that strikes your fancy and meet some people whose eyes won't glaze over when you talk about it.

name: New to the SCA? A Class on the Basics
description_book: Learn about what essentials you should have for an event, basic customs and protocol, how to get involved, persona and heraldry, as well as much more.
description_web: Are you new to the Society, or have you only gone to a few events? Still confused about what there is to do and what we are about? Learn about what essentials you should have for an event, basic customs and protocol, how to get involved, persona and heraldry, as well as much more. Come with questions or sit and listen. We promise you will learn a lot!

name: *Belicha*
description_book: *Belicha* is an original choreography by Mistress Rosina del Bosco Chiaro, approximating the style of Italian dance from ca. 1400.

name: Gold Leafing: Period to Modern
description_book: Learn application methods for a perfect finish both period and modern. Period fish glue, garlic, glair and modern permacol for paper or parchment.
description_web: Understand gold leaf and its use in illuminations. Class focuses on period fish glue, garlic, glair, plus modern permacol and *miniatum* for paper and parchment. Learn methods for application of glue, and tips for a perfect finish in both period and modern methods. Bring your gilding questions and problems! Students will create a small gilded sample on parchment and paper. All materials included.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
