description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Double-Reed Musical Instruments: Loud and Soft
description_book: Learn about the crumhorn, cornamuse, shawm and *Rauschpfeife*. Show and Tell. Where to buy, how to play, and care and feeding. Bring a chair.
description_web: Have you ever wondered about period woodwinds other than then recorders? Double-reed instruments come in several flavors: loud or soft, windcapped or open reeds. What is better: a natural or synthetic reed? Learn a little about the care and feeding of the crumhorn, cornamuse, kortholt, shawm and *Rauschpfeife*. A limited number of instruments will be available to try. Bring a chair.

name: Very Basic Naalbinding
description_book: Introduction to naalbinding for those with no prior experience. I will demonstrate a simple naalbinding stitch and discuss basic techniques.
description_web: Introduction to naalbinding for those with no prior experience. Naalbinding is a craft which creates a stretchy fabric by using a large sewing needle and yarn. This predates knitting and is found in a variety of medieval cultures. I will demonstrate a simple naalbinding stitch (Oslo stitch) and discuss the basic techniques.

name: Device Design
description_book: How to draw and design your device or badge for submission. Learn the Core Style rules from SENA and how to avoid redraw returns.
description_web: This class will teach you how to draw and design your (or a client's) device or badge for submission. We will go over the Core Style rules from SENA and learn how to avoid redraw returns.

name: Wire-Wrapped Jewelry
description_book: Learn the basics of wire-wrapped jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. Bring tools and materials if you have them.
description_web: Learn the basics of wire-wrapped jewelry and make a bracelet or medallion hanger. *Note: Class does not include wrapping a stone or bead*. Please bring tools, wire and beads if you have them. There will be some tools available to borrow and some to purchase at cost.

name: Twelve Plants through the Ages
description_book: Follow twelve plants through time from Galen to the modern day. How plants were used for medicine in period, and how that is supported today.
description_web: Follow twelve plants through time from Galen to the modern day. What plants were used medicinally in period, and which of these uses have been proven by contemporary science. I am covering 12 plants this year, and plan additional material in following years.

name: *Memento Mori*: Death Becomes Her
description_book: *Memento Mori* Series, Part 1: In-depth look at the death culture during 1300 - 1500 based on the study of *The Danse Macabre des Femmes*, fr. 995.

name: Dining with the Sultan: 15/16th-C. Ottoman Cuisine
description_book: The development of Ottoman cuisine, including market food, with a particular focus on palace dishes of the 15th and 16th centuries. Plus some recipes.
description_web: A look at the development of Ottoman cuisine from Central Asia to the Empire. Includes food available to all in the marketplace, with a particular focus on palace dishes of the 15th and 16th centuries. Handout has some recipes from the circa 1430 manuscript by Mehmet bin Mâhmud Shirvânî

name: Use of Basic Silversmithing Tools
description_book: Silversmithing on a budget. Survey and demonstration of tools for use with nonferrous metals. Soldering and fusing demonstrations will be included.

name: Nigel's Fire-Starting Class
description_book: You too can start a fire with flint and steel. We will explore the history of fire and how to start a fire with flint and steel. You will make fire.
description_web: Formerly titled “How to Start a Fire Like a Moderately Intelligent Saxon”. Yes, you too can start a fire with flint and steel like a Saxon, Roman, Viking, or any other civilized culture in the Middle Ages. Includes history of fire and the flint-and-steel mechanics of starting a fire. Hands-on class; you will start a fire. You must be at least 14 years old and have your parents' or wife’s permission.

name: Basketry 101: Market Basket
description_book: Learn the basics of basket weaving and make your own 8"x12" market basket to take home. Bring an old towel and scissors for cutting reed.
fee_itemization: Oak D handle, dyed basket reed, plain basket reed, rim filler, tool usage and handouts

name: Hedeby Apron: A Simple Construction
description_book: A new cutting/sewing layout for a Norse apron-dress, based off of the Hedeby fragment. Only two measurements, one cut, and three seams!
description_web: A new cutting/sewing layout for a Norse apron-dress based off of the Hedeby harbor fragment. We will briefly discuss the extant fragment and why it is interesting to the historical costumer, and then learn how to construct the garment using a new construction/layout. Only two measurements, one cut, and three seams! Good for both beginning and advanced tailors.

name: Closing Your Clothes
description_book: Survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for.
description_web: Survey of period clothing closures and how to use them. Covers antiquity to 1600, and all the cultures that I have time for. Includes information on where to purchase these items. I will pass around actual closures and demonstrate their use.

name: Shiny Hats and Medallions: A Guide to SCA Regalia
description_book: Covers Society award structure, what all the medallions and coronets mean, using titles appropriately and court etiquette.
description_web: Keeping everyone’s names straight can be confusing, but then when you add titles to the mix it takes on a whole new level. This class will cover Society award structure (so you know why people are clapping in court) as well what all the medallions and coronets mean. We will also discuss some of the differences in awards across the different Kingdoms. In addition there will be a section on using titles appropriately and court etiquette. That way, when you are called up for the first time, you know what to do!

name: Beginning to Drum Solo: *Malfuf, Syrto, Chifti*
description_book: An intro to the beginnings of solo techniques for *Malfuf, Syrto*, and *Chiftitelli* rhythms. An intermediate class, but all levels welcome.

name: Choral Ball Prep
description_book: The band and choir will be practicing for the evening's ball. Dancers are welcome to come learn the dances too!

name: Annual Barter Town Swap Meet
description_book: It is time once again to barter. Come enjoy the Barter Bazaar and swap those unwanted items for that lost treasure!
description_web: It is time once again to barter. Come enjoy the Barter Bazaar and swap those unwanted items for that lost treasure!  Everyone is welcome!

name: Nine Days Wonder: Day 5
description_book: Dancing tour of the High Meadow. Start location: 3-way intersection of Chandler's Rd., Brewer's Rd., and High Rd. (E09). Stop location: (E24).
description_web:
We are re-enacting William Kempe's famous "Nine Days Wonder"! Kempe was an actor who worked with Shakespeare and who danced 100 km from London to Norwich as a publicity stunt in 1602. Dance 5 out of 9 days and receive a souvenir token! Check the book/web for start locations. We dance at noon each day.
Today: Dancing tour of the High Meadow. Start location: 3-way intersection of Chandler's Rd., Brewer's Rd., & High Rd. (E09). Stop location: Corner of Abandon Hope & Great Eastern Hwy (E24)

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.

name: *Saidi* Dance: From Start to Stage, Part 4 of 4
description_book: Four-part series of classes to learn the movements of Egyptian *Saidi* dance with sticks and prepare a performance for the ME Dance Expo on 8/9.
description_web: **Day Four**: In this four-part series of classes, you will learn the basic movements of *Saidi* dance, how to manage a *tahteeb* or stick, learn a short choreography, and, for the daring among you, perform it at the 20th Annual Middle Eastern and World Dance Exposition. If possible, bring a wooden dowel the length of your navel to the floor (3/4 inch round for ladies, 1 inch round for men). A limited number will be available for purchase. If you want to perform, please have a kaftan-style garment (full length t-tunic) and a hip sash.
fee_itemization: Fee is for a dancing stick (dowel) if students have not brought their own.

name: Circle Drumming
description_book: Let's have fun circle drumming. We will use Near-Eastern rhythms as base, and play around them. Open to all levels. Bring any type of drums.
description_web: Let's have fun circle drumming. We will create songs, using Near-Eastern rhythms as base - well, most of the time - and play around them. Open to all levels. Bring any type of drums. Kids are welcome, but please bring your grownup.

name: Vocal Projection and Presence
description_book: Getting more attention and more volume from your "instrument". Care and feeding, period singing style, stage fright, and more. Heralds welcome, too!

name: Rehearsal (Closed): ME&WDE Tech and Lighting Check
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: Dumbek Rhythm Changes
description_book: We'll focus on changing from one common rhythm to another. Handouts will be supplied.
description_web: We'll focus on changing from one common rhythm to another. Handouts will be supplied.

name: Voices and Viols: A Story in Song
description_book: Featuring 15th-16th-century French and Spanish theatre music. Sight-singing a plus for singers, but not essential. Viols tune to A=440. Bring a chair.
description_web: Two great sounds that sound great together! This year, we will focus on 15th-16th-century theatre music, playing/singing a sequence of songs that, performed together, make a story. One session for French theatrical chansons, the other for Spanish. Sight-singing a plus for singers, but not essential. Viols tune to A=440. *Vielles*/violin family instruments are also welcome! Bring your own chair.

name: Gothic Hybrid Drolleries and Grotesques
description_book: Where the ideas for the fantastic creatures in the margins of illuminations came from and why they are there. Short drawing exercise at end of class.
description_web: Have you ever wondered where the ideas for the fantastic creatures often found hiding in the margins of illuminations came from? Do they serve a purpose other than making people giggle? Find out the answers to these questions and more.  And, if you'd like, participate in a fun little drawing exercise.
fee_itemization: 5 page (double sided) handout and a hand bound flip book for creating original grotesques

name: Juggling Practice
description_book: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.
description_web: Come together to meet with other performers and swap tricks, including ball, club, ring, *diablo*, flower sticks, and more. Part of the Fool's School.

name: Japanese Paper: What Is Period...Show and Tell
description_book: Hands-on show, tell and feel! History of Japanese paper and what would have been used in period. Examples will be on hand.
description_web: Hands-on show, tell and feel!  History of Japanese paper and what would have been used in period. Examples will be on hand.

name: Charge Group Theory
description_book: Types of charge groups in armory and how to identify them. We will break down armory into parts.
description_web: Types of charge groups in armory and how to identify them. We will break down armory into parts.

name: Navigating by the Stars
description_book: Learn a critical medieval skill - how to navigate by the stars and moon! All skill levels covered, from "I can't find Orion" to "I built a telescope."
description_web: Learn a critical medieval skill - how to navigate by the stars, moon, and sun! All skill levels covered, from "I can't find Orion" to "I have built my own telescope." I will explain simple and advanced navigational tricks so that anyone can orient themselves at any time.
fee_itemization:
$1 for handout covering what is discussed and citations
$1 for magnetized cork and needle "water compass."

name: Power of Clear Glass
description_book: Clear glass is beautiful, but it's also a useful tool. Students should be well experienced and very confident with dot placement and bead shaping.
fee_itemization: Fee covers gas, glass, and handouts. Limited to the first 8 students

name: Introduction to Research
description_book: A class for people who either hate research or don't know how to get started.
description_web: A class for people who either hate research or don't know how to get started. Learn to do good research by understanding what research is for (and what it isn't for!) and an introduction to ways you can tell the difference between good sources and bad.

name: *Pysanky*: Period Dyes and Techniques
description_book: A review of dye/application methods available to period writers of *pysanky*, and how the dyes appeared on the shells.
description_web: A review of dye/application methods available to period writers of *pysanky*, and how the dyes appeared on the shells.

name: Historical Facets of *Commedia dell'Arte* Troupes
description_book: Ideas on how to manage *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes in the SCA based on *commedia* troupes in the 16th century.
description_web: Have you been interested in joining, creating or potentially finding new members for a *Commedia dell'Arte* group? *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes differ from traditional theater in many ways. This class will present research from Robert Henke's book, "Performance and Literature in *Commedia dell'Arte*" pertaining to the structure and practices of early *commedia* troupes. Members of *Vagando Stolti* will discuss ways to run an SCA troupe based on the structure and profession in period. Whether you are *Comici* or a *Capicomico*, learn how to interact in a troupe with courtesy, diligence and commitment to the art. All students are welcome to network and discuss practices with artists from various kingdoms.

name: Ink Painting for Beginners
description_book: Basic review of how to make Japanese ink paintings with easy to obtain materials.
description_web: With a few basic items you can create Japanese ink paintings. These could be used as just paintings or the scribe could do this artwork for scrolls.
fee_itemization: Paper packet for producing ink paintings. Brushes can be purchased for additional cost.

name: Coaching and the Art of Constructive Criticism
description_book: Discover proven NPS coaching techniques to cultivate critique that aids and inspires rather than crushing talent before it can bloom. Coach the dream!
description_web: We all hear the cries of the populace - or at least the artists-to-be and the volunteers-to-be - that they tried and were rendered low by sharp criticism. Here you can discover proven coaching techniques from a National Park Service Registered Coach. Learn to shape artistic performance and presentation or volunteer service into something that serves the dream rather than drives people away!

name: SCA 101: Very Basics for Newcomers and Chatelaines
description_book: Starting with what SCA stands for, how it started and what we do, this is the class to take if you are new to the SCA or teach newcomers.
description_web: Starting with what SCA stands for, how it started and what we do, this is the class to take if you are new to the SCA or teach newcomers. We'll also talk about navigating your first Pennsic.

name: Early Period Arts and Sciences Day
description_book: An exploration of pre-1000 AD European arts and sciences. Take a class, watch a demonstration or bring a project to work on. Teachers wanted!
description_web: An exploration of pre-1000 AD European arts and sciences. Take a class, watch a demonstration or bring a project to work on. Teachers wanted!

name: *Itamae*: Fundamentals of Japanese Cuisine
description_book: Samurai Chef: Japanese cookery, spaces, and utensils. The origin, use, and seasonality of ingredients including seasonings, spices, and beverages.
description_web:
Samurai Chef: Japanese cookery, spaces, and utensils. The origin, use, and seasonality of ingredients including seasonings, spices, and beverages. 

What did *Pimiko, Shotoku-taishi*, the Shining *Genji*, *Dogen*, and *Hideyoshi* eat? An introduction to pre-modern Japanese food and food culture.
fee_itemization: Covers production cost of the handout. I have been advised to include a handout for this class.

name: Introduction to *Shogi*
description_book: We'll go over the basic rules of *Shogi* or "Japanese Chess", and describe a few historic variants.
description_web: We'll go over the basic rules of *Shogi* or "Japanese Chess", and describe a few historic variants.

name: Rapier Ruins Battle
description_book: This will be a resurrection battle. The field will be 600’ N­S x 300’ E­W between deployment/resurrection lines.
description_web: This will be a resurrection battle. The field will be 600’ N­S x 300’ E­W between deployment/resurrection lines. The only entrance to the fort during this battle will be the main gate. Outside of the castle gate will be a 30’x30’ tower. The tower will have two 9’ doorways in its east and west walls. There will be a 30’ wall extending south from the center of the southern wall of the tower. There will be a broken field (i.e., “orchard”) extending approximately 40’ from southern edge of wall. The field will have a scattering of sets of 3 bales making corners. These bales are assumed to be trees and may not be fought over. Each side may deploy 125’ in from the sides of the field. The East and allies will start on the west side of the field. The Midrealm and allies will start on the east side of the field. Fighters may resurrect at their deployment lines. There will be 5 flags placed on the field. Possession of the flag is determined by one or the other flag being at the top of the flagpole. One flag will be placed in the fort. One flag will be placed in the tower. One flag will be placed 60’ south of the tower flag. Two flags will be placed in the open field south of the orchard 60’ apart. Each flag will be checked at 5 random times during the battle.The side that possesses the majority of flags at a checkpoint wins that checkpoint. The side that wins a majority of the checkpoints wins the battle. The times of the time checks will be determined by the marshals and will not be revealed to either army. Immediately following the third time check, the battle will be stopped. The armies will swap sides of the field before continuing. There will be a 10-minute break for this swap.The side that is behind in overall war points will be given their choice of deployment areas. In the event of a tie, a coin flip will determine who has that priority. Non-­medical holds are local and do not stop the clock. Medical holds are battlefield-wide and stop the clock. Start time: 1 pm. Time limit: 70-­90 minutes. Resurrection: Yes.  DFB: Yes.

name: Intro to Tribal Belly Dance
description_book: The basics of tribal dance, including posture, rhythm, and isolation technique.
description_web: Tribal belly dance is an improvisational dance format that uses visual and verbal cues to communicate moves to other dancers in a group formation. We'll cover basic movements, posture, transitions, and isolations, while breaking moves down into easy-to-bite counts to match the music. Beginners are welcome, as is anyone with knowledge of other styles of belly dance.

name: Pennsic Children's Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: Children's Choir is open to children up to age 13 who love to sing. Experience the world of singing medieval and Renaissance music. All are welcome!
description_web:
Pennsic Children's Choir is open to all children up to age 13 who love to sing. Experience the world of Renaissance and medieval vocal music with Director Emeritus Erlan Nordenskald of the Known World Choir. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/11, in the PAT; further details TBA during regular rehearsals.) Parents must attend rehearsals with children under 12.
Music and more information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-children-s-choir

name: PA Afternoon Series: Bardic Arts Exhibition
description_book: Come and enjoy an amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of bardic arts and artists from around the Known World!
description_web: Come and enjoy an amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of bardic arts and artists from around the Known World!

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Known World Courtesan Social
description_book: Open house style, “meet ‘n greet” open to anyone interested in courtesan history and/or persona. Light refreshments available; feel free to B.Y.O.B.
description_web: Join our 4th Annual Social for an afternoon of leisure, food and fantastic company. This open house-style, “meet and greet” is open to anyone who has an interest in courtesan history and/or persona. Some light refreshments will be available; feel free to B.Y.O.B. More details can be found at http://courtesans.weebly.com.

name: Intermediate Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn to throw knives and spears. A hands-on session is included. Must have taken the beginner class. Limit 25 participants.
description_web: Learn to throw knives and spears. A hands-on session is included. Must have taken the beginner class. Limit 25 participants.

name: Hafla Songs for All Instruments by Lady Melissa!
description_book: New songs for haflas! Bring drum, zills, band or orchestra instruments! Sheet music available. *Alf Layla Wa Layla, Sao Roma Ederlezi*, and more!
description_web: New songs for haflas!  *Alf Layla Wa Layla, Sao Roma Ederlezi, Erev Shel Shoshanim* and more. Bring your drum, zills, band or orchestra instruments! Sheet music available to purchase. Let's make beautiful Middle Eastern music together.
fee_itemization: Sheet music and drum rhythm sheets

name: East/Midrealm Round-Robin Tournament
description_book: Their Majesties invite Youth Combatants to vie for Honor and Victory in a round-robin list for Divisions 1 - 3.
description_web: Their Majesties invite Youth Combatants to vie for Honor and Victory in a round-robin list for Divisions 1 - 3.

name: Tablet Weaving Letters
description_book: Demonstration of how to tablet weave letters onto a band. Each student is encouraged to try their hand at it on my loom.
description_web: Demonstration of how to tablet weave letters onto a band. Each student is encouraged to try their hand at it on my loom. Should have previous card weaving experience.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Æthelmearc Scribal Tea
description_book: All scribes and those who are interested in the scribal arts are welcome to stop by, enjoy some refreshments, and socialize with fellow scribes.

name: Whose Line Doth It Be? - Open Auditions
description_book: Think you are a great improviser? Here's your chance to audition for "Whose Line Doth It Be?" Performance slots are limited.
description_web: Think you are a great improviser? Now here's your chance to audition for the improvisational show, "Whose Line Doth It Be?", taking place at 7:00 pm in the Amphitheater. Performance slots are limited, so sharpen your wit!

name: 14th-Century Venetian Clothing and Sumptuary Laws
description_book: A discussion of the differences in style and aesthetic between Northern Italy and Western Europe, and comparison of sumptuary laws between regions.

name: Introduction to Kingdom-Level Commenting in OSCAR
description_book: This class is intended for beginner-level heralds to learn the basics of positive and helpful in-kingdom commenting in OSCAR.
description_web:
This class is intended for beginner-level heralds to learn the basics of positive and helpful in-kingdom commenting in OSCAR. Learn who to contact about getting into the commentary system, best practices for commentary, and how to not be That Person in an online commentary discussion.

This class does not cover Laurel-level commentary.

name: V&A Study Room: See the Embroideries
description_book: See photos of over 100 period embroideries from the Victoria and Albert Textile Study Room.
description_web: See photos of over 100 period embroideries from the Victoria and Albert Textile Study Room. Due to low light conditions, color values are not always great, but the stitches can be seen in many of the close-ups. The handout lists each, with access codes and background information, for easy Internet access back home.

name: Constructive Feedback: How to Give It and Take It
description_book: Getting the most out of A&S relies on good communication between judge and competitor. Learn how to do both. Part class/part roundtable
description_web: Getting the most out of A&S relies on good communication and feedback between judge and competitor. Good communication can generate lifelong collaboration and learning. Bad communication can have consequences that last just as long. This class and roundtable discussion is designed to cover not only how to be a good judge in A&S competitions/displays, but also how to be ready and willing to receive feedback for your work.

name: Teaching in the SCA
description_book: How to design and deliver a good class in the SCA, no matter what the topic is. Will include lesson plan blanks and a discussion of hands-on teaching
description_web: Class will be taught by an experienced high school history teacher and will focus on how to plan lessons and deliver instruction to different groups. Will include discussion of hands-on teaching for Arts & Sciences and fighting classes.

name: Introduction to Card Weaving
description_book: What is card weaving and how to get started. You'll walk away with the knowledge and materials to finish making a small belt.
fee_itemization: cards, yarn/string to make a belt

name: Bardic Symposium #1: Meet & Greet; Video Etiquette
description_book: The Bardic Symposium is an open gathering for special forums, topics, and discussions for the Bardic Community. Day 1: Meet & Greet; Video Etiquette.
description_web:
The Bardic Symposium is an open gathering for special forums, topics, and discussions for the Bardic Community. 
Day 1: Meet & Greet; Video Etiquette.
Introductions, Meet & Greet:
Meet your fellow bards. While many of us already know each other, this is a time to say hello to returning friends and give newcomers a chance to match names to faces. Host: Provost, Master Cerian Cantwr

Videoing of our Performances:
Welcome to the age of the cell phone. Whether we like it or not, well-meaning people are going to video our performances and, often as not, stick them on YouTube. Is there a way to manage this? Are there reasons we want to be recorded? Are there reasons we don’t? What sorts of recording etiquette should we attempt to encourage?

name: Henna: The Good, the Bad, and the Awesome
description_book: Interested in henna as hair dye? Already using henna? Want to learn more? Discover some recipes and tips on how to make it work for your hair type!

name: Paternosters: The Evidence
description_book: Lecture class on evidence for prayer bead construction from Europe prior to 1600, and the benefits and challenges of each source.
description_web: We will discuss what evidence we have for the construction of prayer beads in Europe prior to 1600 and the benefits and challenges of using each kind of source. Lecture-style class.

name: Paper Making
description_book: Students will make paper using traditional techniques and materials.
description_web: We will discuss the history of paper making, from its start in China to its spread into Europe, as well as become familiar with processing raw materials. Students will make sheets of hand-made paper in class.
fee_itemization:
Handout is a printed pamplet.
Materials include paper pulp sizing, and pigments.

name: Teaching European Dance
description_book: The workshop focuses on how teachers can improve their abilities as dance instructors.
description_web: The workshop focuses on how teachers can improve their abilities as dance instructors. The class is particularly useful for beginning dance teachers but can help polish anyone’s skills. Some of these notes, or "best practices" as I call them, may seem obvious or come to you naturally, but I have tried to break down the process as simply as possible.

location: Dark Horde Moritu (E09 - Brewers Rd & Chandlers)
name: Basic Mongolian Garb for Men and Women
description_book: How to fit, cut, select fabric, and decorate 13th- to 14th-century Mongolian clothing.
description_web: Cothing from the Mongolian Empire (13th to 14th centuries) is practical for an active lifestyle and can be luxurious. Come find out how to fit, cut, select fabric, and decorate your own basic outfit.

name: Crossing Cultures in Storytelling
description_book: We'll discuss moving stories across cultures. I will focus on my character, Isu Odinnson, and the steps I took to create his stories.
description_web: This class will discuss moving stories across cultures. I will focus on my character, Isu Odinnson, and the steps I took to create his stories.

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 19 to learn period vocal music and perform as part of the Known World Choirs Concert.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 19 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella*. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/7, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.)  More information can be found here:  https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: Anthropology and Archaeology for Reenactors
description_book: We'll discuss how these sciences are used for historical reenactment, Including how to apply art, extant, and related sciences to documentation.
fee_itemization: .50 per person for photo copy of handout.

name: Morning Cry: Service and Performance
description_book: The task of a cry herald is to get important information about the event to its attendees as quickly and effectively as possible. Come learn how!
description_web: The task of a cry herald is to get important information about the event to its attendees as quickly and effectively as possible. Come learn how to successfully prepare and deliver an effective and memorable morning cry.

name: Open Torch
description_book: During any unused class times, torches, tools and glass will be made available to experienced lampworkers for open torch time!
description_web: During any unused class time, torches, tools and glass will be made available to experienced lampworkers for open torch time.

name: Organizing Your A&S Display
description_book: How to organize and lay out your research, show your process, display your creation, and present your work.
description_web: This class will demonstrate how to plan your Arts and Science display. Research, work-in-progress photos, failed attempts, process, and what you learned should be carefully laid out and presented. My background is in architecture, portfolio design, and verbal presentations.
fee_itemization: Recommended reading and visual examples of layouts.

name: Mustards and Sauces Roundtable 101
description_book: Mustard? Medieval sauces? Informal meeting for those interested in making mustards and sauces. Sample some; share recipes and information.
description_web: Mustard? Medieval sauces? Informal meeting for those interested in making mustards and sauces. Sample some; share recipes and information. We highly encourage folks, if they so desire, to bring samples of mustards and sauces they have made. Not required at all but the more things to sample the better! We will be making up booklets to hand out at class. If any mustardiers or sauciers have recipes to share, please contact me at bookshop@charter.net to have these included in the booklet.

name: Roman Roundtable
description_book: Come talk about all things Roman with other Romans from around the Known World. Share your research on food, clothing, daily life, armor, and more.
description_web: Come talk about all things Roman with other Romans from around the Known World. Share your research on food, clothing, daily life, armor, and more.

name: A&S Competitions for Judges, Part 2 of 3
description_book: How A&S competition judges can support and encourage entrants to partake in fun and educational activities. Part of a series.
description_web: We’ll be talking about how A&S competition judges can support and encourage entrants to be a part of educational activities while still having fun. Discussion will cover ideas on how to give feedback to entrants. We want to help everyone have a fun time while also encouraging an educational atmosphere. This class ties in with "A&S Competitions for Organizers" and "A&S Competitions for Entrants". You can attend any one or all three.

name: Viking Age Feast Gear: Archeological Evidence
description_book: A survey of feast gear and cookware options from among the archaeological finds of the Old Norse World.
description_web: A survey of feast gear and cookware options from among the archaeological finds of the Old Norse World. We will look at items from Birka, Gotland, Oseberg, York, and other sites.

name: 15th-Century Italian Dance Beginner: Part 1
description_book: No experience necessary. Dances will include *Anello, Amoroso, Petit Riens, Petit Rose*.

name: Morris Games
description_book: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic tac toe).
description_web: We will teach Nine Man's Morris and other games of that family (which include the modern tic tac toe).

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: Shimmy Lab
description_book: Explore the exciting variations and dynamics of the shimmy. This drill class will get you moving, sweating and thinking.

name: Known World Recorder Ensemble Rehearsal
description_book: Recorder players intermediate and above invited to join this ensemble for inaugural Pennsic appearance. Join us in having fun making music together!
description_web:
Recorder players of intermediate and above abilities are invited to join this ensemble for its inaugural Pennsic appearance. Join us in having fun and making music together! We will meet for three rehearsals: Monday - Wednesday; dress rehearsal Thursday. More information on site. We'll prepare for a brief concert, 6 pm, Thursday, 8/11, in the PA Tent. Age limit: 12 and up. 
A limited number of soprano and alto recorders are available for loan; contact instructors by July 10 to reserve one. If you play more than one instrument, bring them all, and be prepared to play something other than soprano. Please bring a music stand if you have one, or you may need to share. Sheet music (easy to advanced) will be provided. $3 for music packet, or free PDF available prior to Pennsic. Email the instructors: Lady Jolicia atte Northclyfe <Washington.julie@gmail.com> and Lady Siri Toivosdotter <JoniSyngs@aol.com>
fee_itemization: $3 for music packet, or free PDF download prior to rehearsals (email the instructors):  Lady Jolicia atte Northclyfe <Washington.julie@gmail.com> and Lady Siri Toivosdotter <JoniSyngs@aol.com>

name: Inkle Weaving Basics
description_book: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip.
description_web: Using the continuous warping method, you will warp the loom and weave an inkle strip. Classroom loaner looms available or bring your own.

name: Turkish Split-Finger Drum Workshop
description_book: Intro to Turkish split-finger technique for *doumbek*. This series is aimed at those who already know *doumbek* basics and want to open a new horizon!
description_web: Turkish split-finger technique for those who already have experience with *doumbek/darbuka*. Day 1: Left hand splits and new ways of producing familiar rhythms. Day 2: Right hand splits and interlace rolls. Day 3: Opening the possibilities and a fun Turkish rhythm -- *Kerfes*.

description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: Medieval Pottery Kiln Firing
description_book: We will load and fire the kiln built earlier with pottery made on site or brought dry. Partial attendance OK. Make pots or tiles to fire here.
description_web: We will load and fire the kiln built earlier with pottery made on site or brought dry. Partial attendance OK. Make pots or tiles to fire here - a real Pennsic souvenir!

name: Best Practices for Transitions of Offices
description_book: Finding successors for local group offices, and making smooth, low-drama hand-offs -- it can be done. We'll talk about how.
description_web: Finding successors for local group offices, and making smooth, low-drama hand-offs -- it can be done. We'll talk about how to improve the odds of success (defined as a smooth transition with low drama and minimal negative impact on any affected constituency or on the local group's ongoing operations, with the successor having a clear understanding of the job requirements and feeling competent and confident in their new position).

name: How to Be a Baronial Herald
description_book: What is the job of a baronial herald? How to be a good herald for your barony; includes around table discussion.
description_web: A class on what the job of baronial herald entails. There will be a discussion of each responsibility of the baronial herald and what you as the baronial herald need to do. The class concludes with a roundtable discussion.

name: History of Gunpowder and Gunpowder Weapons
description_book: The instructor will document the origins and history of gunpowder and gunpowder weapons from their earliest use to ca. 1600 CE.

name: Japanese Prints of the Floating World
description_book: What's so great about The Great Wave? Explore the process, history, & artistry of Japanese prints. Get your hands on an 1858 Hiroshige block replica.
description_web: What's so great about The Great Wave? Japanese woodblock prints of the Floating World have captivated us for centuries with their playful subjects, ephemeral colors, and delicate artistry. Explore the fascinating breadth and history of Japanese prints and their artists with breathtaking examples from the world-renowned collection of the Art Institute of Chicago. Learn all about the traditional printing process from A to Z and get your hands on a laser-etched replica of an 1858 carved block by Hiroshige.

name: Power and Leadership in the SCA
description_book: Learn how to make your mark in the SCA, be a good leader, and have fun doing it.
description_web: We will talk about power structures in the SCA, the nature of power in the SCA, responsive leadership, and how that fits into SCA structure. Also learn about identifying the needs in your SCA group or Kingdom, and how to determine if you are the right person for the job.

name: Rethinking SCA Events
description_book: Let's take a strategic look at SCA events to identify how we can create new opportunities to adapt to current trends and membership needs.
description_web: It is important to take a critical look at how we run SCA events to make sure that they are not only reflecting the mission of the SCA in general, but the needs and desires of our local and regional groups. This class will take a strategic look at SCA events to identify how we can create new opportunities in our event structures to adapt to current trends and membership needs.

name: *Xia*: The Chinese Knight-Errant
description_book: An examination of the history and motivations of Chinese *youxia*.
description_web: Join us for a discussion of how chivalry was practiced in China in the Middle Ages.  This class will cover how *Xia* is different from Western chivalry, how it is the same, and ways to incorporate these into your persona.

name: XXX Rated *Commedia*
description_book: Did you know a few scenarios include fornication, enemas, and other risqué topics? Join us to discuss *lazzi* you'd never perform for an event.
description_web: This is "not your mother's scenario" class! Did you know a few *commedia* scenarios include fornication, enemas, defecation and other risqué topics we couldn't even air on modern television? Join us for a discussion of *lazzi* rarely performed at SCA events but perfect for certain Pennsic parties. **No one under 18 will be allowed at this class. Must present ID!**

name: Relief Carving Techniques for Teens
description_book: Participants will use basic relief carving techniques to create a clay tile. Class is geared toward teens 12-18. All youth guidelines apply.
description_web: Participants will use basic relief carving techniques to create a clay tile. This class is geared toward teens 12-18. All Pennsic University guidelines for youth classes apply.

name: Henna Body Art for Beginners
description_book: From mixing paste from the best ingredients, to safety instruction and building your first designs, we will focus on the basics for great henna.
fee_itemization: $5 per henna cone provided to students. This is my usual rate.

name: Trans, Intersex, and Third Gender in History
description_book: An in-depth exploration of the evolution of sex and gender throughout history. Discussing viragos, eunuchs, "trans saint" motif, and more.
description_web: We will build upon the themes introduced in Trans, Intersex and Third Gender in the SCA. This class will explore in-depth sex/gender minority groups focusing on but not limited to viragos, eunuchs, and the "trans saint" motif.

instructor: Lord archer bear horseman of rockbr
name: Make Your Own Custom Flemish String for Your Bow
description_book: Learn to make your own Flemish string for your recurve or long bow. B-50 dacron string material provided and is safe for all bows. Multiple colors.

name: Feastocrat 101
description_book: So you want to be a feastocrat? This is a step-by-step class for those who are considering running their first feast! Handouts available.

name: The *Yezidi*, People of the Peacock
description_book: The *Yezidi* (in Bible as the *Ezid*) are a reclusive, Zoroastrian minority of pre-Sumerian origin that still exist in Iraq, Kuwait, and abroad.
description_web: The *Yezidi*, biblically known as the *Ezid*, are a reclusive, Zoroastrian minority of pre-Sumerian origin that still exist in Iraq, Kuwait, and abroad. Learn about these interesting people, their customs, and why they are believed to be "Devil-Worshipers."

name: How to Create Modern Recipes from Period Ones
description_book: We take a period recipe through the steps to create a modern recipe with quantities and directions. This is hands-on, so bring a cover-up if cooking!
description_web: We'll go through the steps to take a period recipe and create a modern interpretation that anyone can follow. This will be hands-on starting with discussing ingredients and cooking methods as applies to the recipe, testing the choices by cooking, and finally how to write it all down. Emphasis is on staying as true to the original recipe as possible while making something tasty.

name: Trios by Domenico da Piacenza
description_book: Covers several exciting dances for three people by Domenico including *Jupiter, Belfiore, Leoncello Novo* and possibly others.

name: 10-Man Unbelted Melée Tourney
description_book: Sargents of Saint Aiden 10-Man Unbelted Melée Tourney.
description_web: For the third year The Sargents of Saint Aiden sponsor the Ten Man Melée Tourney. The fight will be for the Sargents' chest. Each year the coat of arms of the winning team are added to the chest. At this time Atlantia and Æthelmearc are the two kingdoms on the Chest. Will one of these two Kingdoms be the first to form a Dynasty in this tourney, or will a new kingdom emerge as champion this year?

name: Pennsic Archery Champions Practice/Tryouts
description_book: All archers wishing to make the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices.
description_web: All archers wishing to be on the Pennsic Archery Champions Teams should attend these practices. See either the East Kingdom Captain General or the Midrealm Lt General for more details.

name: Pennsic Lost and Found Auction
description_book: Selling of lost and found items accumulated at past Pennsics.

name: Battlefield Set-Up
description_book: **Volunteers** are **needed** to set up the Main Battlefield. Come out and be part of the magic; be a Hay Bale Hero!
description_web: Ever wonder how the Battlefield is magically set-up prior to each War Point? Be part of the action! Volunteers are needed to set-up the Main Battlefield. Come out and be part of the magic; be a Hay Bale Hero!

name: Dance of the Drum
description_book: Focus is on blending and weaving various rhythms into a musical whole by learning to listen and, just as important, how **not** to listen.
description_web:
Drumming is about so much more than playing rhythms. It is also about letting your hands dance on a drum. Having fun and letting go of inhibitions? 
This is what separates the technically-skilled musician from a great artist,  the one who can move you in ways you didn't think possible, because they
were having fun and let go of their ego. Class focuses on learning how
to weave complimentary and odd rhythms together into a musical whole. **All dancers and musicians are welcome**. Please bring any instruments you wish to add to the mix.

name: The Irish Frau: Aibhilin inghean Daibhidh
description_book: Aibhilin, the Irish Frau, debuts mix of music for harp and voice with period songs, SCA works, rousing SCA war songs, with a little humor thrown in!
description_web: Aibhilin, the Irish Frau, performs a mix of music for harp and voice from period songs, modern SCA compositions, to rousing *a capella* SCA war songs. And of course, a little humor thrown in!

name: Non-European Dance and Music in the SCA Context
description_book: A collaborative overview of what we know, what we don't and how this fits in the SCA, including music, choreography, song, culture, research and more.
description_web: A collaboration of musicians, singers and dancers present their knowledge to date in a discussion format with examples of research, images, and scores, if possible. Some actual performing will take place. The teachers may change depending on availability so feel free to attend both classes. We will be approaching the discussion of SCA culture and research (or lack thereof) as a concern.
fee_itemization: We may have CD's, research papers or other material on CD or on websites listed depending on who is teaching. there may be a fee.

name: Advanced Crumhorn Ensemble Playing
description_book: Crumhorn drop-in playing for the advanced player. Own your own crumhorns, be able to play one to a part, sight read. Not for beginners. Bring chair.
description_web: Crumhorn drop-in playing for the advanced player. Own your own crumhorns, be prepared to play one to a part, and be able to sight read. Not for beginners. Bring a chair.

name: Dwarves vs Giants
description_book: This is a series of combats and melées between fighters five and a half feet and under and fighters six and a quarter feet and over.

name: How to Build an Accurate Sundial
description_book: You too, can build a sundial like the one on Okewode Hall that can be read as easily and accurately as a mundane digital watch.
description_web:
You may have noticed that large sundial at Okewode Hall. This is an advertisement to convince people that it is possible to make a dial that can be read as easily as a modern watch. The trick is to include all the astronomical corrections into the design of the dial, so they do not need to be applied after the dial is read. I intend to describe how I built this dial, and how you can do the
same for your camp. I want enough people building and maintaining public dials for Pennsic, that they become the normal way for people to tell time.
I will describe how to calculate the time-marks, lay them out on the dial, mark them with nails, and set the gnomon to the correct angle and calibrate the whole thing once it's hanging on the wall. I will cover construction details and various safety considerations to prevent it from falling and injuring someone.
There **will** be math, specifically some high school-level trigonometry, but you should not let that frighten you away.

name: Knitting in the 16th Century: An Overview
description_book: Not only is hand-knitting period, the 16th century has a wealth of items to choose from. We'll look at a wide range of caps, gloves, and hosen.
description_web: Not only is hand-knitting period, the 16th century has a wealth of items to choose from. We'll look at a wide range of caps, gloves, and hosen. Interested in Eleanora of Toledo's stockings? I wrote down the pattern!
fee_itemization: I have a handout with extensive bibliography.

name: Glass Fusing for Total Beginners
description_book: An intro to glass fusing, including some vocabulary associated with the art. Students will assemble a small piece to be fused on site.
description_web: This class, which covers introductory glass fusing, is very, very basic. It is geared toward total beginners with no glass experience. Students will learn basic terminology as well as assemble a small piece to be fused on site.

name: Birka Posaments
description_book: Knotted metal wire trims were found in graves in Birka. Come learn more about the so-called posaments and some of the currently available resources.
description_web: Wonderful knotted precious metal wire trims were found in Birka, a 8th-10th-century market town in modern day Sweden. Come learn more about the so-called  posaments and some of the currently available resources.

name: Facial Tattoos
description_book: The Bedouin women of Iraq have facial tattoos for beauty. I'll explore some of the symbols and other cultures with facial tattooing.
description_web: The Bedouin women of Iraq have facial tattoos for beauty. I'll explore some of the symbols and other cultures with facial tattooing.

name: 15th-Century Italian Dance for Three
description_book: Dances perfect for smaller and odd numbers at practice. Often more fun because of how they handle the odd person out. Beginners especially welcome.
description_web: This class focuses on 15th-century Italian dances, specifically those calling for three people. These choreographies are perfect for smaller and odd numbers at practice. They can often be more fun because of how the dance handles the odd person out. All are welcome, especially beginners, but a familiarity with 15th-century Italian dance steps and choreography will make the class easier. We will learn *Belfiore, Vita di Cholino*, and *Voltati in Ca Rosina*. Expect these to be fun, quirky dances.

name: Sing We And Chant It VI: Madrigal, Part-song, Jam
description_book: Come one and all who enjoy part-singing to sing along for an evening of madrigal, part-song, and *a capella* favorites performed by you, The Audience!
description_web:
Come one and all who enjoy madrigal and polyphony / part-singing to sing along for an evening of part-song and *a capella* favorites performed by you, The Audience! Join hosts and conductors Mistress Gianetta Andreini da Vicenza, THL Lorelei Skye, Professor Pieter van Doorn, and other guests for an evening of musical variety. Come and make joyful music, or sit and enjoy the harmony of multiple *a capella* voices!  (Some music will be available to share, or bring your own!) 
Optional meet-and-greet and rehearsals: Friday, 8/5, Performing Arts Rehearsal tent ("PAR"), 2-3:30 pm; and Sunday, PAR, 3:00-4:30. Look in the class listings for more information. 
You do not need to attend a practice to participate in the Jam.  
2016 current song list available here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1o3qDzNt4mNvigshaX_2h6LsJlAgzUhxxjW09ejqONjA/edit?usp=sharing

name: Efenwealt Wystle Comedy Music at the Ampitheater
description_book: Can't wait for ʺWhose Line Doth it Beʺ to get your giggle-fit started? Let Efenwealt's goofy songs help you ease into the appropriate mood.
description_web: Can't wait for ʺWhose Line Doth it Beʺ to get your giggle-fit started? Let Efenwealt's goofy songs help you ease into the appropriate mood.

name: Whose Line Doth It Be? Performance in Amphitheater
description_book: The improv comedy show where anything can happen! Audience members should bring seating. Would-be contestants selected from Auditions at 2 PM.
description_web: Welcome to 'Whose Line Doth It Be?', the improv comedy competition where anything can happen. Audience members should bring seating. Would-be contestants must attend the Audition at 2PM. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12*.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period runes were rarely used for divination, but many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system for using runes this way.
description_web: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to create magickal tools, effect change at distance, work weather, awaken inanimate objects, world walk, heal/ relieve pain (even migraines), and more. An optional booklet, with additional information, will be available for $5. [Note: This class is not medical training. I am not a doctor and don't even play one in the SCA.]

name: Glass Painting (thru Æthelmearc Scribal College)
description_book: Learn "Basic Glass Painting", the same technique used for stained glass scrolls. Taught in cooperation with Æthelmearc Scribes' College.
description_web: Learn "Basic Glass Painting", the same technique found to do wording and faces in churches. Also, **scribes**! Learn how to put words on glass. You'll work on a small piece that will get fired onsite. If you've seen any stained glass scrolls given out in court, this is the method I use. (Scribes, please bring a nib holder and some nibs.)
fee_itemization: supplies including glass and glass paint.

name: Propaganda in Roman Art
description_book: A look at how imagery was used in Rome to influence politics and popular sentiment.
description_web: A look at some of the earliest use of propaganda from ancient Roman art and discussion of how the ruling class influenced the populace's opinion with the power of suggestion.

name: Judging an SCA Brewing Competition
description_book: Judging historical brews - differences from modern judging. Some emphasis on Æthelmearc rubrics. Actual judging will take place.
description_web: There is very little difference in the judging of home-brewed beverages between the modern hobby and the historical practice – at least from a technical perspective. However, unlike our modern counterparts, we have the additional consideration of having to account for historical documentation, legacy equipment, and period practices. Additionally, in Æthelmearc, the A&S office has published rubrics designed to allow for some consistency in judging from one competition to the next, and has defined within those rubrics many of the thresholds required for accurate scoring. Over the course of this class, we will look at the technical issues involved in judging as we as discuss these additional considerations
fee_itemization: Materials include copies of judging sheets, disposable cups, and saltless crackers (palate cleansers,)

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: *Muhekian*: The Taste of Tea
description_book: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothes with white socks or *tabi*, and bring a fan if you have one.
description_web:
Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothes with white socks or *tabi*, and bring a fan if you have one. Hideyoshi banned weapons from tea rooms, and jewelry is generally avoided in tea rooms as well.

*Matcha* appreciation was one of the preeminent cultural activities of late medieval Japan and played an important political role in Japanese society. Tea embraces a variety of art forms including: poetry, calligraphy, flower arranging, pottery, and architecture. Experience the *wabicha* approach to tea perfected in the sixteenth century.
fee_itemization: Cost of tea and sweets - 12 per sitting.

name: Hunters Home Youth Polearm Tourney
description_book: Youth Polearm Tourney to be held at the youth fighting point. It will run as a bear pit-style fighting.
description_web: The Shire of Hunters Home will be hosting its Third Annual Youth Polearm Tourney.  It will be conducted under a bear pit-style tourney with a break.The winner will be determined by the youth fighter with the most points. Points are determined  by receiving two points for a win and one point for a loss.

name: The Debatable Choir
description_book: Naughty? Nice? The Debatable Choir performs French part songs, Italian *canzonas*, English madrigals, German *lieder*, and a Latin Gloria by Machaut.
description_web:
Naughty or Nice? The Debatable Choir performs French part songs, Italian *canzonas*, English madrigals, and German *lieder* about drinking, reveling, and sex! And then atones with a Latin Gloria by Machaut. Lyrics are primarily innuendo, so it's mostly safe for the kids, but you may not want to have to explain some of it to the littlest ones... 
*Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12*.

name: *i Fenice*: The Bird of Play
description_book: *i Fenice*, Known World's newest *commedia* troupe, offers our finest first performance. Tickle your fancy, and make history of history! Join the fun!
description_web: *i Fenice*, the Known World's newest *commedia* troupe, offers you our finest first performance ever. Faces new, faces familiar, and faces conveniently hidden behind masks will tickle your fancy and cast safe-words to the winds as we make history of history. Join the fun! *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12*.

name: Choral Ball
description_book: Join us for a unique ball experience. All dances will have a choir singing the music, along with the live band!
description_web: For the first time in Pennsic history, the original lyrics to our familiar dance tunes will be sung while dancing! A choir will be joining the live band to create a unique ball experience. You don't want to miss this one!

name: *i Genesii*
description_book: *i Genesii*: Love! Money! Greed! Sex! Murderation! Overwhelming beauty! Underwhelming intelligence! All in one magnificent *Commedia dell'Arte* show!
description_web: Love! Money! Greed! Sex! Murderation! Overwhelming beauty! Underwhelming intelligence! All in one magnificent *Commedia dell'Arte* show, as only *i Genesii* can do! Join us for an evening of wondrous wackiness, fabulous funniness, and tenuous tastefulness! *Show Contains Adult-Themed Content*.

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.
description_web: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.

name: Glass Cutting: Any Level
description_book: Want to learn how to cut glass? Know how to cut glass and wish to take your skills to the next level? Take this class! And wear closed-toed shoes.
description_web: Want to learn how to cut glass? Know how to cut glass and wish to take your skills to the next level? Make time for this class! And wear closed-toed shoes, please. This is a rolling-style class, meaning it **will not** take every person 1.5 hours, but, as there are only 2 of us, and we have limited cutters and tools, each person will get about 10 minutes of one-on-one time to learn how to cut glass.
fee_itemization: Cost offsets glass used to practice on.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Lists open for melee activities.
description_web: Lists open for melee activities.

name: A Hand A Day: Rotunda Capitals Calligraphy
description_book: Beginning calligraphers will use a marker to successfully write the fancy capitals of this late-period Italian script. All materials provided.
description_web: Need to learn a late-period Italian script for those MoD scrolls? These fancy capitals, from the late-period manuscript *Mira Calligraphiae Monumenta*, take flourishes to a new level. Students will use a calligraphy marker to learn the techniques needed to write these letters successfully. Optional fee to purchase marker.
fee_itemization: Interested students may purchase the marker for an additional fee.

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia*, before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.

name: Archery Populace War Point
description_book: Three challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the one War Point for each shoot.
description_web: All archers young and old are encouraged to come and lend their support to their kingdom's efforts, and to display their skill at archery. There will be three challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the one War Point for each shoot.

name: Beginner Beadwork
description_book: History of beadwork within the SCA period. Techniques for beading on fabric.
description_web: History of beadwork within the SCA period. Techniques for beading on fabric. Focus on fill work, pearl work and glass beads.

name: Tips and Tricks for Making Garb Easier and Better
description_book: Not period, but helpful tricks for making the job of sewing your own garb easier, and the result better.
description_web: Not all methods are period, but this class aims to help the novice to intermediate sewer overcome some of the hurdles encountered when making simple garb.

name: So You Have The Dress, Now What?
description_book: You've completed your gown, now accessorize! We will discuss 16th-century Italian accessories, such as *zibellini*, fans and handkerchiefs.
description_web: You've completed your gown, now accessorize! We will discuss 16th-century Italian accessories, such as *zibellini*, fans and handkerchiefs.

name: If Looks Could Kill
description_book: Discussion of "evil eye" lore and amulets in antiquity.
description_web: Discussion of "evil eye" amulets and lore in antiquity. Slide show of amulets and hands-on examples.  Great way to take your persona to the next level.

name: Horse Furniture (Tack) from the Bayeux Tapestry
description_book: We'll focus on the type of horse equipment that was used in the 11th and 12th centuries based on evidence from the Bayeux Tapestry.
description_web: We'll focus on the type of horse equipment that was used in the 11th and 12th centuries. The Bayeux Tapestry, which provides a wealth of information on life and culture during the time of the Norman Conquest, also reveals a great deal about the type of equipment used on horses in the period. This class will concentrate on this source, but also discuss other evidence from sources of the period. This class is especially helpful to those looking to recreate a period "kit" for equestrian activities, but is also of interest to the scholar.

name: The Wild Hunt
description_book: The Wild Hunt is a folk myth with many variations involving interaction between humans and a group of supernatural, other-world riders.
description_web: The Wild Hunt is a folk myth with many variations involving interaction between humans and a group of supernatural riders. Sometimes *fae*, sometimes dead, sometimes associated with leaders from Odin to Mother Holle. We'll explore many aspects of this phenomenon.

name: ASHI Basic First Aid
description_book: Created to help students develop basic first aid knowledge, skills, and the confidence to respond. Cost is $20 for card only, $30 including book.
description_web: Basic First Aid was created to help students develop basic first aid knowledge, skills, and the confidence to respond. The program is an excellent choice for both the community and workplace setting, and is consistent with recommendations of the 2010 National First Aid Science Advisory Board and OSHA’s best practices for first aid training programs in the workplace. Class length: 6.5 hours. Cost is $20 for card only, $30 including book.
fee_itemization: Separate fee for card or course materials. Cost is $20 for card only, $30 including book.

name: A Short History of the Roman Catholic Rosary
description_book: We'll look at the development of the prayers and practices surrounding the rosary in the late Middle Ages and Renaissance.
description_web: We'll look at the development of the prayers and practices surrounding the rosary in the late Middle Ages and Renaissance.

name: *On Divers Colors*: An Overview of Theophilus
description_book: We will spend an hour with Theophilus, examining his instructions in mixing period pigments to create the various tones and shades.
description_web: We will spend an hour with Theophilus, looking through his instructions in mixing period pigments to create the various tones of figures and their settings. We will compare period colors with their modern gouache “equivalents” so that any scribe can create scrolls using period color theory.

name: Dancing for Kids that Like to Dance
description_book: Come learn a mix of Benjamin`s favorite dances. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)
description_web: Come learn some of Benjamin`s favorite dances. Those he will teach are expected to include *Ly Bens, Petite Vriens, Heart`s Ease* and *Rufty Tufty*.

name: Intro to Woodworking, Part A
description_book: Introduction to woodworking with only hand tools. Includes modern SOPs and safe practices for the purposes of building medieval-style furniture.
description_web: Two half days Tuesday and Wednesday; an overview of hand wood work, with an opportunity to try things out. We will start on Tuesday morning with a chunk of a log and by noon we should have some boards or other furniture parts using wedges, axes, froes, drawknives, spokeshaves and wood planes. On Wednesday we will look at making joints, boring, and maybe a bit of carving. Covers saws, chisels, and planes. Extensive instructions on the selection, use and maintenance of all these tools will be covered. The class will be taught both first week and again second week. Students who cannot attend the whole class are encouraged to drop in or out at their convenience.

instructor: Lady Nina Amaya of Bright Hills
name: *Rajasthani* for Performance
description_book: Ages 4 (with parent) to 100, come learn a dance to a song from India. Bring two scarves or one large skirt. We will perform at the Expo or a hafla!
description_web: Any gender, ages 4 (with parent) to 100, come learn a dance to a song from India. Bring two scarves or one large skirt if you can. We will perform at the Expo or a hafla! Come have fun!

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Blacksmithing: Taking the Hobby to the Next Level
description_book: Tips and tricks to take blacksmithing from a hobby to paying for itself and making a profit. Discussion on philosophy, techniques, and shop practices.
description_web: Tips and tricks on taking blacksmithing from a hobby to paying for itself and making a profit. Discussion on philosophy, techniques, and shop practices. Tips on time management and keeping it fun. Learn some of the secrets of 15+ years of professional metalwork.

name: Populace Throw
description_book: Declare your side, throw three weapons (axe, knife, spear) in all three styles; up to four rounds in total throughout the days allotted.
description_web: Open to everyone able to throw. A round consists of 3 throws each of axe, knife and spear at hard targets. You will be permitted to throw 4 rounds throughout the days the competition is open or all within a single day. There will be a special range set-up just  for this competition. Scoring will be a simple 3-­2-­1 system. If you stick, you get points.

name: Advanced Thrown Weapons
description_book: Learn advanced forms of throwing. A hands-on session is included. Must have taken the intermediate class. Limit is 20 participants.
description_web: Learn advanced forms of throwing. A hands-on session is included. Must have taken the intermediate class. Limit is 20 participants.

name: Brass Band: Drop-In Playing
description_book: Sackbut and cornetto drop-in playing. Tired of all of those crazy loud double reeds? Enjoy some sublime brass-only ensemble playing. Bring your chair.
description_web: Sackbut and cornetto drop-in playing. Tired of all of those crazy loud double reeds? Enjoy some sublime brass-only ensemble playing. High pitch sackbuts (alto) especially welcome. Bring music if you have any you would like to try. Bring a chair (maybe). Not for beginners!

name: Physically-Challenged Thrown Weapons Tournament
description_book: A thrown weapons competition for those who are physically challenged.
description_web: A thrown weapons competition for those who are physically challenged.

instructor: Baroness Juliana Rosalia Dolce di Siena
name: Redaction: A Recipe for Scrolls - First Course
description_book: Identifying the design elements of manuscript illumination styles. Covering Celtic Knotwork, French Gold Vine, Italian White Vine, Squashed Bug.
description_web: In this class we'll look at different illuminations and learn how to identify what the design elements are for each style. We'll also learn how to use parts of a larger illumination to create a scroll. Illumination styles: Celtic Knotwork, French Gold Vine, Italian White Vine, Squashed Bug

name: Fool's School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/10, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Circa 1200 Day
description_book: Circa 1200 Day will feature a daily life exhibit. Activities planned for this day include a woodworker, glass worker and weaver.
description_web: Sponsored by House Yew-Bend, Circa 1200 Day will feature a daily life exhibit in the period that runs roughly from 1150 to 1250 CE in Western Europe. Scheduled demonstrators include a woodworker, glassworker, weaver, "Daily Life on a Manor", and more.

name: Embroidery Day
description_book: All things designed and wrought with a needle: embroidery, whitework, blackwork, tapestry, stump work and more. Displays, demonstrations and teaching.
description_web: All things designed and wrought with a needle: embroidery, whitework, blackwork, tapestry, stump work and more. Displays, demonstrations and teaching. Day organized by Lady Jaqueline de Molières.

name: Spinning Day
description_book: Come try working with a drop spindle and see a traditional spinning wheel in action.
description_web: Come try working with a drop spindle and see a traditional spinning wheel in action.

name: Nalbinding for Lefties
description_book: Nalbinding isn't difficult, but can be confusing if you are left-handed. Learn the Oslo stitch specifically for lefties. Bring needle if you have one.
description_web: Nalbinding isn't difficult, but directions can be confusing if you are left-handed. In this class I will teach the Oslo stitch specifically from the left-handed perspective. Bring a nalbinding or darning needle if you have one.

name: *Meigaku*: Design and Document Japanese Names
description_book: *Koyūmeishi-gaku*: How the structure of Japanese personal and group names varied by time period and social status. How to design an appropriate name.
description_web:
*Koyūmeishi-gaku*: How the structure of Japanese personal and group names varied by time period and social status. How to design an appropriate name.

Do you want to design a Japanese personal name which is appropriate for a particular time and social role? Do you want to design a Japanese group name for your war band or theatre troupe? Are you a herald who wants to increase your repertoire of culture specific naming practices? Then this class is for you. We are reserving two hours to allow ample time for questions and discussion.

This class is offered as part of the Heraldry Track.
fee_itemization: Covers production cost of the handout. I have been advised to include a handout for this class.

name: Spin Like a Roman
description_book: A Roman hand distaff is light to use with delicate whorled Roman spindles. Great for fine warp yarns. Hands-on. Re-creations of archaeological finds.
description_web:
The Roman hand distaff is delightfully different in use and form for spinning well-prepared wool. Both light and very portable, its use continued in isolated areas of Europe (especially Italy) until modern times. When used with copies of archaeological finds, these removable whorl spindles produce a very delicate ‘laceweight’ yarn, suitable for warp. Demo, lecture and hands-on. Students can purchase examples in class. These examples range from $15-$50. It is helpful if students view my teaching videos online before class, but not necessary.
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjUCUOUGq_WC-sv2N_qfIhpJDi8LbR-9U
or search Youtube for missingspindle

instructor: Lord Anton LaFlamme de Saint Aubin
name: Etruscan Granulation
description_book: Granulation is the technique of patterning metal with tiny spheres. It dates back to the third millennium BC and was refined by Etruscan goldsmiths.
description_web: Stop staring at the pixels on your screen! Come to Anton's granulation class and learn how the Etruscans pixelated their artwork! Granulation is the technique of patterning metal with tiny spheres. It dates back to the third millennium BC and was refined by Etruscan goldsmiths. In this class, you will make your own design and walk away with a finished item.
fee_itemization: Cost of silver granules runs about $650 Dollars an ounce.

name: Duh! What's a Mead?
description_book: A basic, get-you-going mead class with hints and ideas on how to get you up and brewing once you get home.

name: Tool of the Flame
description_book: Discussion of tools and equipment needed to make glass beads.
description_web: Hands-on discussion of tools and equipment needed to begin making glass beads. Students may see and handle tools and discuss the cost of a start-up kit

name: Intro to Safavid Women's Clothing and Accessories
description_book: Learn the basics of Safavid Persian (16th C) dress and accessories, as well as the difference between Persian and Ottoman clothing.
description_web: Learn the basics of Safavid Persian (16th century) dress and accessories, as well as the difference between Persian and Ottoman clothing.

name: Deeper Look at Textiles & Trim of Viking Age Dress
description_book: By investigating extant textiles, this class will aid in making informed choices for selecting fabrics and adding details to Viking Age women’s garb.
description_web: By looking deeper at both the textiles and the details from extant items, this class aims to help individuals make informed choices for crafting their garments. Textile examples will clarify the weaves and weight of period fabrics and there will also be discussion of possible modern substitutions. Additionally, practical details for finishing or embellishing garments will also be explored and their history investigated. The goal of this class is to help the individual understand how daily life during the Viking Age could affect how textiles were crafted and worn.

name: 14th-Century Alliterative Poetry
description_book: Join the "Alliterative Revival"! Learn about the "Alliterative Long Line" - a high medieval poetic style with its roots in Anglo-Saxon poetry.
description_web: Chaucer wasn’t the only game in town for poetry in the 14th century. Join the "Alliterative Revival"! The “Alliterative Long Line” was a poetry style evocative of Anglo-Saxon verse, but with the distinctive imagery of the 14th century. We will discuss how to create the alliterative long line that appears in many poems from this period, as well as how to blend it with rhyming poetry such as in “Sir Gawain and the Green Knight”.

name: *Marudai* for Beginners (Also *Kumihimo*)
description_book: *Kumihimo* on a *marudai* stand for beginners. Braiding on traditional Japanese stand. Stands available for purchase.
description_web: *Kumihimo* on a *marudai* stand for beginners. Learn to braid beginning patterns on the traditional Japanese stand. Stands available for purchase from instructor for $125.00.
fee_itemization:
5.00 for class and handout
3.0 for handout only
125.00 if you choose to purchase stand

name: Telling Stories as Your Persona
