description_book: *i Sebastiani*, Greatest *Commedia dell'Arte* Troupe in the Entire World! Wondrous entertainment in three acts, **completely different** from Sunday!
description_web: Buon giorno! O, you lucky people! Truly you are blessed among the living, for into your lives has come **again** *i Sebastiani*, the Greatest *Commedia dell'Arte* Troupe in the Entire World! Join us as we improvise from the thinnest of outlines, a wondrous entertainment in three acts, **completely different** from the one we did on Sunday. You will be glad that you did!

name: Bedtime Stories for Children
description_book: Nightly telling of stories for children.
description_web: 7 pm nightly: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; must have adult escort.

name: Forest Law in England
description_book: Beyond Robin Hood, we'll explore forest law vs. village law, the animals of the forest and men who worked there.
description_web: Beyond Robin Hood, we'll explore forest law, as opposed to village law, and how those interacted. We'll also cover the animals of the forest and men who worked in the forests, and the shifts over centuries.

name: Learning *Lamma Bada Yata Thanna*
description_book: Learn the history and musical parts of the Andalusian song, *Lamma Bada Yata Thanna.* Singers, dancers, drummers, instrumentalists all welcome!
description_web: Calling all Middle Eastern performers! Learn about, perform, and dance to the Andalusian song, *Lamma Bada Yata Thanna.* The first part will be history, then we'll move into the lyrics, drum rhythm, melody, and dancing. Handouts, including sheet music, will be available for a fee. You can get the sheet music in advance from http://www.bellydancesheetmusic.com/.

name: Fifth Annual Depressing Song Competition
description_book: Once again, we send up an anguished wail for your most desolate, dolorous, and despairing songs. Prizes will be awarded. Sign up at Moongate Designs.
description_web: Once again, we send up an anguished wail for your most desolate, dolorous, and despairing songs. Prizes will be awarded before we succumb to sorrow. Sign up at Moongate Designs. *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

instructor: Mistress Jenna MacPherson of Lions Towe
name: Youth Combat Open Field
description_book: Youth combatants are welcome to come enjoy pick-up bouts, instruction and just fun fights in the evening session on the youth combat lists.

name: Two Brass Hats Went for a Walk
description_book: We discuss our recent walk on the Camino, the Spanish pilgrimage, the Way of Saint James. Includes history, preparation, and practical aspects.
description_web: A quick discussion about our recent walk on the *Camino*, the Spanish pilgrimage, the Way of Saint James. We will discuss history, preparation and practical aspects of the *Camino*. Be sure to bring plenty of questions. We will bring some answers.

name: Stories in the Bog
description_book: 6 pm - 6:45: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.
description_web: 8 pm -8:45 pm: Stories and fables for children. All are welcome to attend; youth must have adult escort.

name: Drake Oranwood: Troubadour Next Door
description_book: Drake Oranwood, wandering troubadour, will be singing up a storm, with a little help from his friends! Featuring songs from his album "Hidden Gold".
description_web: Drake Oranwood, wandering troubadour, will be singing up a storm, with a little help from his friends! Featuring songs from his album "Hidden Gold". *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

name: The Geometry Ball
description_book: Come join us for a selection of dances organized by shape. Dances will be divided into Circles, Squares, and Lines.

name: Clan Blue Feather Ball and Fashion Cotillion
description_book: Clan Blue Feather's annual Ball and Fashion Cotillion. Food, fun, dancing, music, free raffle and prizes. Wear what makes you look your best!
description_web: Join Clan Blue Feather once again for their annual Ball and Fashion Cotillion. Food, fun, dancing, music, costumes, revelry, a free raffle and special prizes for the most fabulous garb. Remember, you don't have to wear your best garb; just wear what makes *you* look your best!

name: Ken and Lisa Theriot (Sir Kenneth and M. Adelaide)
description_book: Sir Kenneth and Mistress Adelaide and friends perform entertaining, historically-themed original music, and music about life in the Society!
description_web: Sir Kenneth MacQuarrie and Mistress Adelaide de Beaumont (recording artists Ken and Lisa Theriot) and friends perform historically-themed original music, as well as music about life in the Society. Songs like "Band of Brothers" (adapted from Shakespeare's Henry V) and "The Feast Song" have completely escaped them and become standards in kingdoms where Ken and Lisa have never actually set foot. Some stirring, some funny, some sad, some spooky, all entertaining!

name: Yoga for Dancers, Fighters, or Pretty Much Anyone
description_book: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty.
description_web: Yoga to help us through the rigors of war--regardless of our activities. Please bring a mat or towel and dress for modesty. Children may attend with a parent/guardian if they both participate.

name: Coffee with Friends of Bill and Dr Bob
description_book: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.
description_web: Open discussion and fellowshipping. Meeting will be held under the Agnostic format.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): KWP
description_book: Space in use.
description_web: Space in use.

name: *Étude* 1 and 2 for Single Sword (Fencing)
description_book: These drill sequences will focus on form, balance, movement, and coordination. For beginners, intermediates, and teachers alike.
description_web: For beginner and intermediate fencers and those who teach them. These drills will focus on form, balance, movement and coordination. *Étude*1 (first week) is more linear; *Étude* 2 (second week) adds off line/lateral movement. Emphasis will be on learning the *études* for home drill, as well as taking elements out of the drill for more focused work in groups.

name: Youth Combat
description_book: Lists open for melee activities.
description_web: Lists open for melee activities.

name: A Hand A Day: Italic Calligraphy
description_book: Learn the basics of this beautiful and versatile late-period hand.

name: Figure-Drawing Salon
description_book: Draw from live models in medieval poses. Practice your sketching, get feedback, or just relax and work on your drawing. Bring drawing supplies.
description_web: Draw from live models in medieval poses. Practice your sketching, get feedback, or just relax and work on your drawing. Bring pencils, pastels, charcoal and paper of your choice. Some limited supplies will be available.﻿

name: Known World Chatelaines' Meeting
description_book: Come meet the new Society Chatelaine and talk to other Chatelaines from around the Known World to discuss issues, get ideas, and receive support.
description_web: Come meet the new Society Chatelaine and talk to other Chatelaines from around the Known World to discuss issues, get ideas, and receive support.

name: *Commedia dell'Arte* for Youth
description_book: Hands-on class giving the description and history of *Commedia*, before having the youth create and eventually perform their own skit. Ages 13-17.

name: Beaded Flowers
description_book: Make a miniature tea rose in the style of the beaded flowers of 15th-century Venice.

name: Feastocrat 101
description_book: So you want to be a feastocrat? This is a step-by-step class for those who are considering running their first feast! Handouts available.

name: Medicine, Physick, and Surgery
description_book: An overview of medicine as practiced by doctors, surgeons, and apothecaries.
description_web: An overview of the three "official" branches of healthcare (physicians, surgeons, apothecaries), with a look at other trades such as midwife, herbalist, etc. Handouts for all classes: http://www.3fgburner.net/#info.

instructor: Lord Anton LaFlamme de Saint Aubin
name: Wire Inlay in Metal and Wood
description_book: The technique of embellishing the surface of metal or wood by inlaying wire is common in period, including many examples from the Timurid dynasty.
description_web: The technique of embellishing the surface of metal or wood by inlaying wire is common in period, including many examples from the Timurid Dynasty. In this class, you will learn how to prepare the surface to receive inlay, and then inlay the wire and sheet to embellish the surface of your work. You will walk away with a finished item. Class size is limited to 15.

name: Gender Relationships in Heian Japan
description_book: An exploration of gender relationships in Heian (794 to 1185) Japan, including marital relationships, literature, and ownership of property.
description_web: An exploration of gender relationships in Heian (794 to 1185) Japan, including marital relationships, literature, and ownership of property.

name: Medieval Sewing
description_book: Learn the techniques used to hand sew all varieties of clothing. No previous experience needed! Bring scissors if you have them.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to know how medieval clothing was actually constructed? Learn the techniques used to sew all varieties of clothing. This class focuses on the 14th-15th centuries in Western Europe, but the methods are applicable to other periods as well. This class is hands-on, no previous sewing experience needed! The 1st hour we will learn the stitches, the 2nd hour we will make a pouch using medieval materials. Please bring scissors if you have them.

name: Courts of Love, Law, and Equity
description_book: Do Eleanor's Courts of Love in view of Henry's innovation of Courts of Equity reveal the birth of modern law in an epic 12th-century marital spat?
description_web: Do Eleanor's Courts of Love in view of Henry's innovation of Courts of Equity reveal the birth of modern law in an epic 12th-century marital spat?

name: Lucet: Beyond Square Cord
description_book: You can make good square cord; what's next? Flat and multi-strand cords. Bring your lucet. (We can slip a cord off and put it back on after class.)
description_web: You’re comfortable making square cord; what's next? We'll work on flat and multi-strand cords. Please bring your lucet. We'll also demonstrate how to slip a cord off, and put it back on after class.
fee_itemization: (4) colors of floss on cards, and handout

name: Thorsberg Trousers: Pants That Last!
description_book: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial!
description_web: Tired of repairing pants that rip in unmentionable places? Then you’ll love these pants based on trousers from an Iron Age burial! Learn what you’ll need to make them yourself: fabrics, seams, pattern, and construction.

name: Knowing about Norman Sicily
description_book: Crusaders, landless knights, politically powerful ladies, here's what you need to know about the history of Norman Sicily.
description_web: There was a Norman invasion before England, and it involved the Mediterranean and Sicily. If your persona is vaguely related to the Crusades, the kingdoms of Italy, the Holy Roman Empire, or Normandy, this is a foundational course to lay a groundwork of political understanding.

name: Pennsic on 10 Modern Items or Less
description_book: Join me to see how I'm doing midweek with only as many modern items as I can count on my fingers!  Discuss it and share your own period tips.
description_web: Join me to see how I'm doing midweek, after bringing to Pennsic only as many modern items as I can count on my fingers!  How and why I do this will be discussed. A wallet, keys, folder of class materials, lighter, some safety gear for the lists, and of course, a box of wine, lay out the foundation of my modern gear. What final few modern objects will I bring? I'm always comfortable and having fun despite not having modern "conveniences".  Please join me to discuss it and share your own period tips. The definition of what constitutes a modern object will be a side discussion. Optional field trip to my camp may follow.

name: ASHI CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer
description_book: ASHI's CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer. Cost is $20 for card only, $30 including book.
description_web: CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer program is designed for individuals in the healthcare or professional rescuer field who are required to have a professional-level basic life support training. Students learn how to recognize a life-threatening emergency, how to provide basic life support and what to do in case of an airway obstruction or choking. ASHI's CPR Pro for the Professional Rescuer has been approved for training for Emergency Medical Services personnel and is accepted by the National Registry of Emergency Medical Technicians (NREMT). Class length: 7 hours. Cost is $20 for card only, $30 including book.
fee_itemization: Separate fee for certification card or course materials.

name: Photographing Court: How to Be a Photo Ninja
description_book: Discuss the laws, etiquette, technology, and technique involved in getting those great shots of court while being unobtrusive, if not invisible.
description_web:
Court is one of the most SCAdian things we do. As photographers, we want to capture the pageantry and the moments that only happen there. How do we do this without distracting from the medieval atmosphere?
We will discuss the laws (mundane and Society), etiquette, technology (how to turn off lights/beeps, etc.), and techniques for getting that great shot while being unobtrusive.

name: Anglo-Saxon Saints
description_book: The saints of Anglo-Saxon England were not well-behaved. Come hear stories of miracles and mayhem: Dunstan, Walpurga, Caedmon and Caedwalla.
description_web: The saints of Anglo-Saxon England provide some of the funniest and most exciting stories available. The smith Dunstan was once said to have grabbed the devil by the nose with his pincers. Hermits and archbishops, warriors and abbesses, serial killers and herders of mice, martyrs, miracles and mayhem.

name: Children's Dance: Italian Chaos
description_book: Come learn very simple dance steps that are all one needs to know to do a dance. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)
description_web: This is a chance to learn very simple dance steps that are all one needs to know to do a dance. They can be as simple or as complicated as the dancers desire. Knowing these allow the students to dance at balls and are starting points to learn other dances. (Any youth in attendance require a responsible adult present.)

name: Pennsic Archery Champions' Shoot
description_book: The best of the Known World archers will compete in the Pennsic Archery Champions' shoot.
description_web: The best of the Known World archers will compete in the Pennsic Archery Champions' shoot. Teams will compete in a 10-station roving range, an unknown distance shoot, and a friend-or-foe shoot.

name: Intro to Woodworking, Part B
description_book: Introduction to woodworking with only hand tools. Includes modern SOPs and safe practices for the purposes of building medieval-style furniture.
description_web: Two half days Tuesday and Wednesday; an overview of hand wood work, with an opportunity to try things out. We will start on Tuesday morning with a chunk of a log and by noon we should have some boards or other furniture parts using wedges, axes, froes, drawknives, spokeshaves and wood planes. On Wednesday we will look at making joints, boring, and maybe a bit of carving. Covers saws, chisels, and planes. Extensive instructions on the selection, use and maintenance of all these tools will be covered. The class will be taught both first week and again second week. Students who cannot attend the whole class are encouraged to drop in or out at their convenience.

name: Christmas (Music) in July: Pt. 3 BVM Music
description_book: We explore SCA period music for Christmas, and other religious holidays, devoted to the Blessed Virgin Mary. Bring your voices and instrument.
description_web: Bring your singing voice or instrument to a music-reading session featuring SCA-period Christmas/Yule music for 12th Night or Wassail that focuses on the Blessed Virgin Mary (BVM). Public domain music, **large** handout provided for a small fee. This is a sequel to Christmas (Music) in July from Pennsic 42, 43, and 44.

name: Lucet Basics
description_book: Make a square cord and a two-color cord.
description_web: Make a square cord and a two-color cord. Classroom loaner lucets available or bring your own. No fee. String provided.

name: Populace Throw
description_book: Declare your side, throw three weapons (axe, knife, spear) in all three styles; up to four rounds in total throughout the days allotted.
description_web: Open to everyone able to throw. A round consists of 3 throws each of axe, knife and spear at hard targets. You will be permitted to throw 4 rounds throughout the days the competition is open or all within a single day. There will be a special range set-up just  for this competition. Scoring will be a simple 3-­2-­1 system. If you stick, you get points.

name: Loud Band Sensitivity Training: One on a Part
description_book: Shawms can sing! Players of shawms, *Rauschpfeiffen*, sackbuts/trombones, dulcians; go beyond Loud, explore ensemble & listening skills. Bring chair.
description_web: Shawms can sing! Players of shawms, *Rauschpfeiffen*, sackbuts/trombones, dulcians, go a step beyond Loud and explore ensemble and listening skills.  Everyone won't play every piece, but everyone will have a chance to play, and everyone will have a chance to listen in a supportive environment. Bring a chair.

name: Champions' Throw
description_book:
The Champions' Tourney is a War Point and as usual the format will be revealed at 
the time of  the competition.
description_web: The Champions' Tourney is a War Point and as usual the format will be revealed at the time of the competition. The Champions' Tournament will consist of teams of 12 throwers taken from each side. This throw is open to champions from all the realms.

name: Beginning Scribal...A Family Affair
description_book: Hands-on; learn to scribe; includes brief history on scrolls and how they were used in period. Create and paint. Family-friendly class.
description_web: Hands-on; learn to scribe; includes brief history on scrolls and how they were used in period. Create and paint; family-friendly class. We will create paint from berries, use shells and learn how to illuminate a scroll.

name: Fool's School
description_book: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Prepare a 5-minute skit to perform. All ages/experience levels welcome.
description_web: Are you a fool or a fool wannabe? Come to Fool's School to share and learn. Fools/performers of all types and experience levels are welcome. Jugglers, magicians, singers, freaks and geeks. Get help creating or honing a skit of no more than 5 minutes to perform in the Amphitheater, Wednesday, 8/10, 6-7 pm. You might even become a “Licensed Fool.” Performing is not mandatory.

name: Period Pigment-Making Day
description_book: Learn how to make pigments - even ochre - from Pennsic mud.

name: Glass Day
description_book: Working with glass to make handmade beads. Torches will be set up for demonstration and use; a display will showcase the various styles created.

name: Leatherwork Day
description_book: A chance for leather workers of all skill levels to meet, share knowledge and work on projects as well as for novices to learn and ask questions.
description_web: Leatherwork Day is a place for leather workers of all skill levels to meet and share knowledge and work on projects, as well as a great learning opportunity for novices. Stop by any time to look around, ask questions, or just hang out and work on your own projects. We plan on being there from 9 to 5.

name: *Kamon*: Designing and Documenting Japanese Armory
description_book: *Monshō-gaku*: The history and æsthetics of Japanese heraldry. How to use available resources to design and document a pre-modern Japanese *kamon*.
description_web:
*Monshō-gaku*: The history and æsthetics of Japanese heraldry. How to use available resources to design and document a pre-modern Japanese *kamon*.

Do you want to design and register a real Japanese *kamon*? Are you a herald who wants to increase your repertoire of culture specific heraldic design resources? Then this class is for you. 

The College of Arms allows you to register armory appropriate for specific cultures by providing documentation. This is called an Individually Attested Pattern, and SENA specifically mentions Japanese armory. We will be discussing patterns found in pre-modern Japanese armory along with currently available resources for documenting them. We are reserving two hours to allow ample time for questions and discussion.

This class is offered as part of the Heraldry Track.
fee_itemization: Covers production cost of the handout. I have been advised to include a handout for this class.

name: Dining With: Hands-On Culinary Anthropology
description_book: An in-depth discussion on how to form a cohesive group dedicated to producing a period-specific feast, including pitfalls and benefits.
description_web: An in-depth discussion on how to form a cohesive group dedicated to producing a period-specific feast, including pitfalls and benefits. Includes discussion of research methodology, cooking techniques, and the discovery process involved in creating food that people really want to eat.

name: Medieval Genealogy Roundtable
description_book: A discussion of medieval genealogy, sources and techniques as well as period examples.
description_web: A discussion of medieval genealogy, sources and techniques as well as period examples. As a follow-up to past classes on medieval genealogy, this class will start with a review of techniques and sources and will culminate in a roundtable discussion.

name: Those Crazy Neumes: Deciphering the Earliest Music
description_book: The first music notation is not quite legible today. We'll decipher as much as we can, comparing it to Gregorian notation. Bring a pencil.
description_web: The first notes were written as reminders by monks who had already learned the music by ear. We'll learn the names of some of the different squiggles, then compare them to current Gregorian chant notation to see how they match up. We'll watch the notation evolve as they gradually add staff lines, but lose something in the process. Bring a pencil.

name: The Pair of Bodies and The Farthingale
description_book: What did they look like? Where did they come from? How did they evolve? We'll trace them both through Europe from inception through end of period.
description_web: The pair of bodies and the farthingale are major influences that shaped late period fashion (literally and figuratively). But what did they really look like? When did they first show up? What kind of extant examples do we have of them? This class will give a general sense of how these two items evolved during the late period, touching on construction, materials, and variations in use and style in the centers of European fashion - and doing a little myth busting along the way.

name: *La Verdadera Destreza* Meet and Greet
description_book: Meet other fencers that share a common interest in the Spanish fencing style of *La Verdadera Destreza*. Open to any level; light snacks provided.
description_web: This will be an informal gathering of *Diestros* and people of any level who share an interest in the Spanish fencing style of *La Verdadera Destreza*. Bring yourself, possibly a favorite resource/manual, or just a desire to meet others that practice or want to practice this art within the SCA. Light snacks will be provided.

name: Being Your Persona
description_book: How to maintain the illusion, at an event, that you are a period person interacting with other period people.
description_web: How to maintain the illusion, at an event, that you are a period person interacting with other period people.

name: Tallow Candles with Gwen and James
description_book: Learn how to render suet, clarify tallow and dip candles.

name: Period-Like Printing with Computers
description_book: We will discuss the availability of typefaces for computers which approximate (or recreate) period-looking type.
description_web:
We will discuss the availability of modern typefaces for computers which approximate (or recreate) period-looking type. 
Printing in the SCA is one of the few aspects of our endeavor where we neglect period-ness, and in this class we will explore ways, using typefaces, art, and layout techniques, to make our publications look more period. (Please leave your Times New Roman and Helvetica at the gate!)
Bring a thumb drive to class, so you can download any of the free fonts we discuss!
fee_itemization: 24-page, hand-sewn chapbook containing the materials covered in this class.

name: *Belicha*
description_book: *Belicha* is an original choreography by Mistress Rosina del Bosco Chiaro, approximating the style of Italian dance from ca. 1400.

name: Alquerque
description_book: A intro to one of the most prevalent board games in period. Similar in complexity to modern checkers.
description_web: A intro to one of the most prevalent board games in period. Similar in complexity to modern checkers.

location: Good Friends Camp (Usually on St. Lawrence Way, east side of the Great Hall.)
name: Coptic/Greek Bookbinding
description_book: Make a wood-covered book with exposed stitching in 6th- to 12th-century style. Five-hour class, with handout and your own book to take home.
description_web: This Coptic/Greek bookbinding was popular from the 6th to the 12th centuries in the Middle East and Europe. Students will make their own book in this 5.5 hour-long class. No prior knowledge necessary, but will make it easier to do. All materials and tools provided by the instructor.
fee_itemization: Fee includes wood covers, paper for blank book, needles & thread to sew with, and a detailed handout.

name: Topics in Basic Heraldry
description_book: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory skills for consulting at Pennsic Herald's Point. Dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point.
description_web: These classes will teach basic name and/or armory submission skills necessary to consult at Pennsic Herald's Point. Exact dates and topics will be posted at Herald's Point at the beginning of the War. All newer heralds are strongly encouraged to attend at least one of these classes prior to volunteering at Herald's Point.

location: Herald's Point (Low Rd and Great Eastern Hwy.)
name: Pennsic Heraldic Walk - The Serengeti
description_book: Walking tour of heraldic display at War. We'll discuss use of heraldry, what various pieces indicate and leave tokens with camps that impress us.
description_web: Many camps at Pennsic go all out displaying their heraldry on silk, wood, stone, glass and more. We'll walk to various camps and discuss how they're using their heraldry, SCA heraldic traditions, and historic use of heraldry. We'll have tokens to reward our favorite displays. One tour will be on the 'Geti and another down in the Bog. Wear comfortable footgear.

name: Siege, Combat Archery, and Thrown Weapons Battle
description_book: This battle will consist of three scenarios: archery scenario, siege scenario, and combined scenario. Each scenario is allotted 30 minutes.
description_web:
This battle will consist of three scenarios: archery scenario, siege scenario, and combined scenario. Each scenario is allotted 30 minutes of fighting time. All of the usual heavy armor and weapon requirements apply. In these rules, the term “arrow” includes both arrows and crossbow bolts, and the term “pavise” includes both heavy combat shields and standing pavises.
Combatants: 
There are three types of combatants: Siege engineers/crew, combat archers, and shieldmen. Engineers may target any enemy combatant, under usual siege rules. A siege engine has 3 hit points and takes hits only from other siege engines. Engineers should call out the number of hits the engine has received whenever it is struck. When an engine is destroyed by being struck, it must be removed from battle and made safe. When there are too few surviving engineers to safely fire an engine, that engine is immediately considered destroyed. Ammunition bags or clusters that are struck by opposing siege fire are destroyed for the duration of that scenario. At the start of a scenario, engineers may be at the ready, but engines may **not** be cocked or loaded. Engines may be moved during scenarios. 
Archers may target all the usual heavy weapon target zones (i.e., face, body, and limbs). **Note**: Arrows may **not** be used against siege engineers **until** Scenario 3. 
Tubular arrows and bolts may be gleaned. Siege ammo of all types may be gleaned. Shafted ammo might be re-­inspected during the siege scenario, depending on marshal availability. At the start of a scenario, archers may be at the ready, but bows may **not** be cocked or loaded.
Shieldmen consist of shield carriers and pavise carriers. **No** rattan striking or thrusting weapons are permitted in this battle. **All thrown weapons or objects must be inspected and passed before use. Inspected** thrown weapons (e.g., javelins, including rattan-shafted javelins, axes, maces or "pork chops") are permitted, and **must be thrown at a minimum distance of 10 feet**. Hand-­held thrown rocks are **not allowed**.
At no time may shieldmen contact, impede or directly harass opposing combatants, nor approach within 5 yards of a siege engine. Thrown weapons may be used against siege engineers Thrown weapons may be gleaned at any time. All shieldmen must carry **only** one pavise or shield. The pavise must remain with the combatant at all times (even during resurrection). If a pavise is struck by siege ammunition, it is destroyed along with any munitions or weapons stored behind it, and its carrier is dead. Pavises are impervious to arrows. Each side is limited to 30 shieldmen.
Scenario 1: Combat Archery 30­-minute resurrection battle with **no** siege engines. Siege crew and engineers **may** take part in this battle if they are **only** throwing weapons. Victory condition: Control of a majority of buildings when time expires. Set-up: Open field with 5 village buildings. Each building has two doorways, which are on opposite sides. Arrows and thrown weapons must pass through doorways, not walls. Shieldmen may enter buildings, but only **one** may stand in any doorway. All combatants begin the battle along the resurrection line at the edge of the field. Resurrection is unlimited. At the conclusion of the battle, if there are opposing forces within a building, they will fight to the last man without exiting the building. If this engagement is inconclusive after 5 minutes, numerical superiority wins.
Scenario 2: Siege 30­-minute non­-resurrection battle with **no** combat archery Set-up: Open field. Engine position is restricted by a forward line and back line, which will be marked for each side. The forward lines will be ­30­ yards apart, and the back lines will be 25 yards from the front lines. No more than 3 shieldmen are permitted per siege engine. Shieldmen must be 5 yards away from any engine. Shields may be lifted to block shots but fighter and shield are dead. Shieldmen may carry and use thrown objects. Siege crews may carry and throw objects per SCA rules. Destroyed engines must be removed from the field. Living crew or engineers may remain in combat if their engines are destroyed. Victory condition: (1) All opposing engines destroyed. (2) At the end of 30 minutes, the side with fewest destroyed engines wins. (3) In case of a tie, sudden death overtime: All shieldmen are removed and the first hit wins the scenario.
Scenario 3: Combined battle 30-minute non­-resurrection battle. Set-up: Siege may shoot over building walls. Shieldmen may enter buildings. Only **one** shieldman in any doorway. All thrown objects and CA must go through doorways. Siege crews may be struck by thrown objects. Siege crews may throw objects in self defense.
Combat archers **may** shoot at siege crews. Victory conditions: (1) Last man standing . (2) Control of a majority of buildings when time expires. Siege engines are destroyed by 3 siege hits. Destroyed engines must be removed from the field. Living crew or engineers may remain in combat to throw objects if their engines are destroyed. Field: Engine position is restricted by a forward line and back line, which will be marked for each side. The forward lines will be ­30­ yards apart, and the back lines will be 25 yards from the front lines. No more than 3 shieldmen are permitted per siege engine. Shieldmen must be 5 yards away from any engine. Shields may be lifted to block siege shots but fighter and shield are dead.

name: Belly Dance Basics with Hadia!
description_book: Learn belly dance movements, techniques, muscle isolations, and combinations. Classes are for beginners to masters. Men and women are welcome!
description_web: Learn Middle Eastern belly dance movements, techniques, muscle isolations, and combinations while gaining strength, balance, flexibility, stamina, coordination, body awareness and basic movements. We will organize dance patterns, learn to improvise, and use mini-combos for any form of belly dance. Loose clothing encouraged. Hip scarves, shimmy belts, full skirts, etc., are all optional and very helpful for movement awareness. Class is open to beginners through the seasoned dancers who desire a review of basic belly dance movements and technique.

name: Storytelling Academy
description_book: Explore genres, tools, styles, and uses of storytelling. Cultural and medieval approaches, applications, performance coaching. New topics each day.
description_web: During this nine-day academy, students will gain knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Students may attend individual sessions or all of the academy. There will be guest teachers and time for students to practice and receive feedback. The academy will culminate in a student performance. No classes are repeated. The focus is on developing comfort, nurturing, and honing skills within the students’ capabilities. All levels are welcome. Students may pick up a class outline at the academy space, Minerva’s Spindle 158, where classes will also be listed on the message board. Seating is limited; feel free to bring your own chair.  Student Performance, Thursday, 8/1,1 6-7 pm at the Amphitheater. Bring a blanket or chair to enjoy the performance on the green.

name: Henna History and Application
description_book: Learn how and why henna was used in period, and how you can use it yourself. We will mix some henna in class; everyone gets some to try.
description_web: Learn how and why henna was used in period, including traditions, materials, and techniques, and how you can use it yourself today. We will mix some henna in class, which for me (becoming a professional artist) was the hardest part to learn; everyone gets some to use and take.
fee_itemization: One cone of fresh henna paste. You may also take the class without this, or bring your own.

name: Pennsic Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! Singing in the Choir is an intense and rewarding experience with a concert Thursday War Week.
description_web: The Pennsic Choir welcomes all interested singers! This year's concert theme is "Of Love and Whimsy." The repertoire includes pieces by Morley, Marenzio, Scandello, Gesualdo, Dowland, and the ever-popular Anonymous. Singing in the Pennsic Choir is an intense and rewarding experience. We rehearse two hours each day for a week, then perform a concert on Thursday evening of War Week. The ability to read music and sight-sing is helpful, but not required if you learn the music in advance. Sheet music and audio tracks are available online now at https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsicxliiichoirs

name: Gentlemen's Rapier Tournament
description_book: Come and compete to be the Man of the Moment, the Gentleman’s Gentleman, the Guy to Beat. Gentlemen only. Round Robin. Pennsic rules.
description_web: Come and compete to be the Man of the Moment, the Gentleman’s Gentleman, the Guy to Beat. While the ladies are competing in their tournament, come and join this tournament for gentlemen only. This will be a round robin format. Pennsic standard rules apply.

name: Zen Warrior Ladies' Rapier Tournament
description_book: This is a rapier tournament for the Ladies of the Known World to fight for the title of Ladies' Rapier Champion.
description_web: This is a rapier tournament for the Ladies of the Known World to fight for the title of Ladies' Rapier Champion.

name: Fight Like You Mean It: Cut and Thrust Tourney
description_book: This points-based C&T tourney uses the period-accurate after-blow convention to force combatants to display clean technique and sound defense.
description_web: Intended to showcase mastery of the art of defense, this Cut & Thrust tourney uses a points-based scoring system and the after-blow to ensure sound defensive technique. The tourney will be a standard, pooled, round robin, with the top fencers from each pool fighting off in a 2-pass, single-elimination final.

name: Known World Baronial Combat Champions' Tourney
description_book: Open to all Baronial adult and youth, armored and rapier champions. Tentative schedule is 10 to 12 – Rapier; 12 to 1 pm – Youth; 1 to 4 pm – Armored
description_web: A day to celebrate the Baronial Combat Champions of the Known World. Landed Barons and Baronesses are encouraged to bring their chairs and portable pavilions to help us choose the Pennsic 45 Baronial Champions' champion. Open to all Baronial adult and youth, Armored and Rapier champions. Set-up is at 9. Tentative schedule is 10 to 12 – Rapier; 12 to 1 – Youth; 1 to 4 – Armored.

name: Weed Walk
description_book: Wild plant identification. Wear walking shoes and hat; leave from Univ. Point. Different teachers on different days; walk with us more than once!
description_web: Cooper's Lake abounds with medicinal and food plants that were used by various primitive and medieval cultures. Learn to identify them during a walk around the campsite. The walk will take place rain or shine. Please wear sturdy shoes and a hat. Meet at University Point for the start of the class. We have three wonderful new teachers this year, enabling us to offer this class more times!

name: Whitework Illumination
description_book: Painting with white on colored backgrounds. Simple crisp line designs and shaded designs (cameo). Easy as painting inside the lines.
description_web: Tips and tricks that will help scribes paint crisp, clean white embellishments on colored backgrounds. We will also experiment with monochromatic shaded and blended designs (cameo). But don't worry, I promise it will be as easy as painting inside the lines.
fee_itemization:
Multi page handout
Paints, brushes, pre-printed watercolor paper

name: Rehearsal (Closed): *Commedia* All Stars Dress 1/2
description_book: Rehearsal (Closed): *Commedia* All Stars Dress Rehearsal; AMPI space in use.

name: Concepts of Mental Health First Aid
description_book: An overview class that teaches members of the public how to help a person with a mental health problem or in a mental health crisis.
description_web:
An overview class, instructed by a licensed Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner that teaches members of the public how to help a person with a mental health problem or in a mental health crisis. Intended to teach people how to offer initial support until appropriate professional help is received or until the crisis resolves. 
In mental health crises, such as a person feeling suicidal, deliberately harming themselves, having a panic attack or being acutely psychotic, someone with appropriate mental health first aid skills may be able to reduce the risk of the person coming to harm. Additionally, increased public understanding of mental health problems may help decrease stigma and discrimination. This class does not include certification in Mental Health First Aid. 
See note -

name: Medieval Gardening: An Introduction
description_book: An overview and introduction to medieval gardening, its topics, sources and values to our Society. Includes medieval gardening practices.

name: Basic *Kumihimo*
description_book: For the beginner at *kumihimo*. This is a basic how to get started class. Materials and instruction will be available for those who need.
fee_itemization: covers cost of  instruction sheet, the bobbins, weights, and disk

name: Evolution of Black Powder Arms from 1320-1600
description_book: History and development of black powder arms from 1320-1600. This is a **non**-shooting lecture/discussion class covering period firearm technology.
description_web: History and development of black powder arms from 1320-1600. This is a **non**-shooting lecture/discussion class covering period firearm technology. Handouts for all classes: http://www.3fgburner.net/#info.

name: History of Painted Cloth and Printed Textiles
description_book: A discussion with extant examples of the making and use of painted cloth and printed textiles in the Middle Ages.
description_web: A discussion with extant examples of the making and use of painted cloth and printed textiles in the Middle Ages. Documenting the spread of textile painting and printing from the Far East into Europe: the methods, the materials, the extant examples and the confusion. Please join Facebook group: Printed Textile Classes for Pennsic 45.

name: Beyond Sumer Is I-Cumen In
description_book: Learn some lesser known Middle English songs, including pronunciation, and a songbook.
description_web: Learn some lesser known Middle English songs, including pronunciation, and a songbook. There are a wealth of Middle English songs for exploration. There will be a handout and we will hear as many as we can fit into an hour!

name: Knowing about the War of the Sicilain Vespers
description_book: Pirates, seafaring, the mix of Mediterranean and North African cultures, the Holy Roman Empire - this one has it all.
description_web: Later medieval Sicily saw a combined forces war that affected the highest political levels and the lowest tactical ones. Join to understand how the Sicilian Vespers may have affected your persona - even in far-away France.

name: Intermediate *Kumihimo*
description_book: Students will continue to learn more braids on foam disk. There will be four braids taught in this class.
description_web: Students will continue to learn more braids on foam disk. There will be four new braids taught in this class. Students will also learn how to finish braids in many different styles.
fee_itemization:
10.00 for materials & handout
3.00 for handout only

name: Stalking the Wild Audience
description_book: The secrets techniques for finding and entertaining an audience, and making them glad you did so.
description_web: Performers: Learn how to track, capture, tame, and ultimately entertain that most elusive of creatures, the free-range audience. All the secret tools and techniques you need to hunt your prey in its natural habitats, from camp, to revel, to feast hall, to court, with an introduction to the toughest venue of them all, the street.

name: Homeless Monks: The Mendicant Revolution
description_book: In the early 13th century two men challenged a church council edict and radically changed the face of western monasticism for centuries to come.
description_web: In the early 13th century two men challenged a church council edict and radically changed the face of western monasticism for centuries to come. The influence of Francis and Dominic is still evident today.

name: Exchequer 101
description_book: This is a short explanation of accounting for Exchequers with a demonstration on how to keep the books for a small group.
description_web: Were you told, “Just put expense A on line 15 – it’s easy!”? Have you ever been confused by SCA financial reports? Would you like to understand them? This is a short explanation of accounting for Exchequers with a demonstration on how to keep the books for a small group.

name: Introduction to Royalty in the SCA
description_book: Come and meet some of the Royals and Royal Peers of the Knowne World. It is something that you will not soon forget!
description_web: One of the things that makes Pennsic stand out from other events is the large number of Royals and Royal Peers in attendance from all over the Knowne World. To many, they are the “stars” of the SCA that many only get to see from a distance. This is your opportunity to not only meet some of them, but to talk to them and ask them questions. It is something that you will not soon forget!

name: *Squilina*
description_book: *Squilina* is an unusual, fun, and energetic dance for three by Fabritio Caroso. Knowledge of 16th-century footwork highly recommended.

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Beginning Loud Band
description_book: Ever wanted to try the Loud Band? Bring your own. A limited number of instruments will be available to try. Music provided. Bring a chair.
description_web: If you can play a recorder, you can play a Loud Band instrument. Musicians of all levels are welcome. The class will begin with a Q&A session about loud instruments including shawms, *Rauschpfeiffen* and sackbuts (trombones).  There will be a limited number of instruments available to try. Bring instruments and a music stand if you have them. Easy music will be provided, and the class will play some songs. Listeners welcome. Bring a chair.

name: Juggling 101: Beginner
description_book: Learn to juggle three balls in the simplest pattern. Equipment available for use or purchase.
description_web: The most basic 3-ball cascade juggling. Juggling balls will be made available for use by the class and may be bought afterward from the instructor.

name: Basic Fiber Preparation and Spinning Techniques
description_book: Hands-on demonstration and discussion about how to prepare different types of fiber for spinning on a spindle or a wheel.
description_web: Hands-on demonstration and discussion about how to prepare different types of fiber for spinning on a spindle or a wheel. Discussion includes animal and plant fibers ranging from wool and silk to cotton and bast fibers (flax, hemp). The entire process of preparation will be discussed from washing to preparing to spin including methods and tools.

name: Intro to Conflict Checking Armory
description_book: The basics of conflict checking: types of charge groups, breaking down armory, identifying conflicts, and finding them (or not!).
description_web: This class will cover the basics of conflict checking. We'll talk about the types of charge groups and how to identify them. We'll talk about some approaches to conflict checking, and how to define the possible set of conflicts by working backwards from the Rules. By the end of this class, you should have an idea how to break a piece of armory into charge groups and how to find and evaluate possible items that a submission could conflict with.

name: What's in a Robe?
description_book: High-status English in 13th-14th century wore items described in clothing lists as "robes". What was meant by this and what are the implications?

name: *Cloisonné* Enameling: Torch-Fired
description_book: Introduction to the technique, tools, and materials of *cloisonné* enamel. Kits are available for students to create a small piece.
description_web: Students will be introduced to the technique, tools, and materials of *cloisonné* enamel. Kits are available for students to create a small piece of their own. You are encouraged to bring wire working tools such as pliers and cutters.
fee_itemization: Kit Includes handout, blank disk to apply enamels, cloisonne' wire and use of instructor's enamel colors and propane torches

name: Viking Age Textile Tools
description_book: A survey of textile tools found in Norse and neighboring sites, including spinning, weaving, and cutting tools.
description_web: A survey of textile tools found in Norse and neighboring sites. We will look at cards, combs, looms, loom weights, shears, shuttles, skein-winders, smoothing stones, spindles, and whorls from Birka, Coppergate, Dublin, Hedeby, Lund, Novgorod, Oseberg and Ribe.

name: SCA History Roundtable
description_book: For those interested in documenting SCA history and individual groups: Come and discuss ways to achieve that goal.
description_web: This roundtable will give those interested in documenting the history of the SCA and individual groups a place to come together to discuss ideals for preserving our history.

name: Nap/Story Time with Tempus
description_book: This is an hour with Tempus. Good time to have a nap while he rambles on about anything. Adventure, excitement and really wild things...
description_web: This is an hour with Tempus. Good time to have a nap while he rambles on about anything. Adventure, excitement and really wild things... Maybe some hand-kissing and stories of travel; might do some science, or hear about his cabins. Or it may just be a good time for an afternoon nap.

name: Baba Yaga: Not for the Faint of Heart
description_book: We all know the stories, but what was the history of the Baba Yaga? Where did her stories come from and why? Come to the class to learn more.

name: *Romani*: An Introduction to Gypsy Persona
description_book: Don't know how/where to start with this persona? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.
description_web: Want a Gypsy persona, but don't know how/where to start? Learn about the *Rom*, their history, common pitfalls, and the fun of this fascinating persona.

name: Takin' It to the Street
description_book: How to street perform and pass the hat. You will be entitled to an individual director session to work on your street show in the Pennsic Market.
description_web: In period, in the SCA, or modernly, there can be no tougher venue than street performing and passing the hat, and none more rewarding to the artist. Persons taking this class will be entitled to an individual field lab session in the Pennsic marketplace, in which Dr Best will personally assist you in attempting your act on the street.

name: You Are What You Eat: Humoral Doctrine
description_book: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition through food.
description_web: An overview of the theory of balancing the human condition through food.

name: The Very New Persona
description_book: You're brand, spanking new, and you don't know who you want to be? No worries! I'll talk through good starting points, and then we just chat. Relax!
description_web: You're brand, spanking new, and you don't know who or what you want to be? No worries! I'll talk through common considerations and good starting points for information. After we go through the basics, we just chat about our thoughts. Relax! It's not supposed to be work!

name: The Laundry Project: Linens
description_book: Starting at Gulf Wars, I have been experimenting with how few clothes I can have at War by washing, brushing, airing, etc.
description_web: Starting at Gulf Wars, I have been experimenting with how few clothes I can have at War by washing, brushing, airing, etc. I also have tried "recipes" for cleaning from period manuals. I will demonstrate washing, and some of the successes (and failures) for my experiments. Bring a white linen garment to wash!

name: Known World Children's Fête
description_book: A party full of fun for all the children of the Known World, 12-3 pm.
description_web: A party full of fun for all the children of the Known World, 12-3 pm. (Please ensure that all children have a parent or guardian present with them at the fête.)

name: Nine Days Wonder: Day 7
description_book: Dancing tour down Runestone Hill, around north part of lake. Start location: Corner of Servant's Path & Low Rd. (across from coffee). Stop: (W06).
description_web:
We are re-enacting William Kempe's famous "Nine Days Wonder"! Kempe was an actor who worked with Shakespeare and who danced 100 km from London to Norwich as a publicity stunt in 1602. Dance 5 out of 9 days and receive a souvenir token! Check the book/web for start locations. We dance at noon each day.
Today: Dancing tour Down Runestone Hill, around north part of lake. Start location: Corner of Servant's Path & Low Rd. (across from coffee). Stop: Y-intersection of Roman Rd. & Great Eastern Hwy. (W06/E15)

name: Beginning *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.
description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.

name: The Yin and Yang of Middle Eastern Dance
description_book: Structure and musicality combine to create a dance style that is personal and connected with history through classic combos and improv exercises.
description_web:
In this 2-hour class, Lady Erzulie and Lady Serene will bring together the Yin and Yang of Middle Eastern dance: structure and musicality, to help you create a Middle Eastern dance style that is both personal and connected with history.

Want to know culturally appropriate steps to use with Middle Eastern rhythms? What steps naturally go with *Saidii, Karsilama, Zar* (and more)?  Lady Erzulie will show us several classic movement combinations to help us add structure to our dance.

Does improve excite or frighten you? Learn to hear variations in music and use your intuition to bring musicality into your dance style. Lady Serene will lead us  through several improvisation and musicality explorations.

name: Circle Drumming
description_book: Let's have fun circle drumming. We will use Near-Eastern rhythms as base, and play around them. Open to all levels. Bring any type of drums.
description_web: Let's have fun circle drumming. We will create songs, using Near-Eastern rhythms as base - well, most of the time - and play around them. Open to all levels. Bring any type of drums. Kids are welcome, but please bring your grownup.

name: Mass Project
description_book: Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. Each day we'll study and rehearse a different movement.
description_web:
Hands-on look into the Mass as a musical form and its importance in Renaissance vocal music. Each day we'll study and rehearse a different movement, starting with early period *Kyrie* and ending with a mid-15th-century *Agnus Dei*. Five-part class. We are going to do a mini-performance at the European Music Expo and a movement or two at the **Known World Choirs Performance**. Sponsored by the Known World Choir. 
Rehearsal Tent unless noted:  8/4, 4-5 pm; 8/5, 12-1 pm; 8/7, 12-1 pm; 8/9, AMPI, 3-4 pm (bring a chair); 8/10, 12-1 pm.

name: Rehearsal (Closed): *Commedia* All Stars Dress 2/2
description_book: Rehearsal (Closed): *Commedia* All Stars Dress Rehearsal; PAT space in use.

instructor: THL Don Po Silvertop the Rogue
name: Æthelmearc Rapier Novice Tourney
description_book: For novices less than three years from first rapier authorization; have never received a Kingdom-level rapier award or won a published-event tourney.
description_web:
This tournament is open to any authorized rapier combatant with less than three years from their first rapier authorization, who has never received an award at the Kingdom level for rapier prowess, and who has never won a rapier tourney at a published SCA event. The tourney will be run as a multiple-bearpit tourney. Prizes will be awarded.

Note: This tournament will take place on the main battlefield near the rapier field

name: *Furioso all'Italiano*
description_book: Come learn *Furioso all'Italiano*, a 16th-century Italian dance for sets of three couples. Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.
description_web: Come learn *Furioso all'Italiano*, an elegant and elaborate 16th-century Italian dance for sets of three couples. Dancers of all ages welcome. This is an advanced class.

name: Scroll Personalization without Modernization
description_book: Learn techniques to create scrolls that will have a personalized touch without losing the period aspects of original manuscript pages.
description_web: Ever want to make a scroll special for the recipient but didn't want to do something so modern that it doesn't look like it came out of a manuscript or even out of history? In this class students will learn techniques to create scrolls that will have a personalized touch without losing the period aspects. We will touch on how to come up with ideas for personalization and decide what elements to add/subtract to and from period manuscript illuminations as well as how to inhabit an illumination with images of the recipients.

name: Iron *Commedia*: Creating a New 16th-Century Play
description_book: Join actors from your favorite improvisational *Commedia dell'Arte* troupes to craft, cast, perform, & premier a brand-new play in just one afternoon!
description_web: If you've ever laughed at the zany antics of improvisational *Commedia dell'Arte*, join members from your favorite troupes to craft, cast, and perform a brand-new *Commedia* play in just one afternoon with its world premier at at Pennsic that same day! Two sessions, two performances, one each week. Find a mask, put it on, and see what happens!

name: Baltic-style Patterned Warp-faced Weaving
description_book: Workshop-style class: Learn how to create a pattern, warp, and weave using the techniques and materials specific to this type of patterned weaving.
description_web: Class focuses on learning how to create a pattern using the techniques and materials specific to this type of patterned weaving and how to warp it onto a loom of any type. Graph paper and pencils/colored pencils will be provided for creating patterns. Participants should bring a loom (inkle loom, tape loom, box loom, small rigid heddle, belt loom) to warp up using the pattern created and begin to weave using pickup techniques. Prior inkle/rigid heddle weaving experience suggested. A narrow selection of yarn will be available.

name: Conflict Checking Armory with the Complex Search
description_book: Use Complex Search Form to do conflict checking for armory. Knowledge of charge group theory required; experience with conflict checking recommended.
description_web: This class will cover the uses of the Complex Search Form for the online O&A. We'll talk about categories, features, where to find them, and how to apply them for the fastest conflict checking ever. By the end of this class, you should have an idea how to use the Complex Search Form to find conflicts quickly.

name: Chivalry Then and Now
description_book: The SCA is based on an ideal of chivalry. But how does our idea of chivalry relate to history? We'll talk about what we can learn from the past.
description_web: Chivalry is a key ideal in the SCA. However, different people have different ideas about what chivalry means. The same thing was true in the Middle Ages. We'll spend time learning about some of the debates about chivalry in period and what they can teach us about our own ideals.

name: Powering Medical Devices at Pennsic
description_book: How to power your CPAP machine or other medical device in the middle of camp at Pennsic without an extension cord.

name: 16th-C Working Class Women's Garb Across Europe
description_book: What's the difference between 16th-century Italian, German, Lowlands, and English garb, head to toe? What's similar across all of them?
description_web: What's the difference between 16th-century Italian, German, Lowlands, and English garb? What's similar across all of them? We will walk you through the pieces of a typical working woman's ensemble head to toe.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Runes: Elder/Anglo-Saxon *Futharks*
description_book: EF runes were used for business, graffiti, and magic until the Vendel period. A/S runes were derived from the EF, with many variations.
description_web:
Runes: the Elder Futhark. From the origin(s) of runes to the early Viking period,
these characters have not only been used for mundane purposes (business
correspondence and shipping labels, indicating ownership of jewelry, etc.) but also for magic. We will explore both angles in this class, as well as the origins and meanings of the individual runes themselves. The Anglo-Saxon *Futhark* was derived from the Scandinavian-Continental Germanic Elder *Futhark*. These have the  earliest documented rune names, and perhaps the widest variety in rune numbers and forms.

name: The New Bard's Road Map
description_book: A how-to primer for new/aspiring bards. Developing repertoire, finding performance opportunities, seeking mentors and patrons, joining the community.
description_web: A how-to primer for new or aspiring bards. Developing a repertoire, finding performance opportunities, seeking mentors and patrons, gaining visibility, becoming part of the bardic community.

name: Make a St. Birgitta Coif
description_book: Make a simple linen coif appropriate for all classes of women from the 13th-15th centuries. Recommended: knowledge of basic hand-sewing.
fee_itemization: Material fee $3 covers materials for cap and handout.

name: *Sources et Recherches pour la SCA*
description_book: Class given in French. Historical sources and how to do research papers. Welcome to everyone, particularly if you want to practice your French skills.
description_web: Class given in French. Historical sources and how to do research papers. Welcome to everyone, particularly if you want to practice your French skills.

name: Button Up!
description_book: Learn to make self-stuffed cloth buttons and hand-stitched buttonholes.
description_web: This class will cover the techniques used to make self-stuffed cloth buttons appropriate for clothing from the 14th century onward. We will also use the buttonhole stitch to make hand-sewn buttonholes.
fee_itemization: Kit contains materials to make several sample buttons (fabric, thread, and needle) as well as practice making buttonholes.

name: *Banchetti* Ravioli
description_book: Rich ravioli, another rich ravioli, and a oblong Lombardy-style ravioli from the 1549 Italian cookbook *Banchetti*.
description_web: A ravioli made of beef fat, eggs, cheese, raisins, and spices for covering all kinds of fowl or by itself. A ravioli made from capon breast, hard cheese, fatty cheese, pork belly, eggs, herbs in oil, and spices. A ravioli made with Swiss chard, hard cheese, eggs, sugar, and spices.

name: SCA 101: Nothing Bad Happens In Court
description_book: The general ins and outs of court the SCA, and why you shouldn't be nervous.

name: *Itamae*: Japanese Meal Planning and Execution
description_book: Samurai Chef: Meal planning, service, and structure. Includes various types of meals, when and by whom they would be eaten, rituals, and etiquette.
description_web:
Samurai Chef: Meal planning, service, and structure. Includes various types of meals, when and by whom they would be eaten, rituals, and etiquette.

What is *Honzen Ryōri*? What are *Tenshin*? Replicating a pre-modern meal involves more than just cooking a bunch of pre-modern recipes. Pre-modern meals were composed of a variety of food items assembled together and presented in a manner specific to a particular culture, the occasion of the meal itself, and often reflected dietary theory along with religious and secular strictures. We will discuss the structure of pre-modern Japanese meals, the various types of meals consumed, and the cultural background for these meals.
fee_itemization: Covers cost of the handout. I have been advised that I should produce a handout for this class.

name: Period Card Games: *Losing Loadem*
description_book: Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period, trick-avoidance card game.
description_web: Looking for something to pass the time at events? Do you like to play cards? Come learn to play this late-period card game based on a reconstruction from Francis Willughby’s *A Volume of Plaies* (~1665).

name: Pennsic Children's Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: Children's Choir is open to children up to age 13 who love to sing. Experience the world of singing medieval and Renaissance music. All are welcome!
description_web:
Pennsic Children's Choir is open to all children up to age 13 who love to sing. Experience the world of Renaissance and medieval vocal music with Director Emeritus Erlan Nordenskald of the Known World Choir. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/11, in the PAT; further details TBA during regular rehearsals.) Parents must attend rehearsals with children under 12.
Music and more information can be found here: https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-children-s-choir

name: Vocal Projection and Presence
description_book: Getting more attention and more volume from your "instrument". Care and feeding, period singing style, stage fright, and more. Heralds welcome, too!

name: *Kumihimo* Basics
description_book: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk.
description_web: *Kumihimo*: cord braiding on a disk. Make a basic round cord. Disk and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: Atlantian 5-Man Melée
description_book: Bring your best five-person fencing team and compete against the Known World. No more than two Masters of Defense per team. Special Twist this year.
description_web:
A Pennsic tradition. Bring your best five-person rapier team and compete against the Known World. No more than two Masters of Defense per team. (This **does not** include Chiv, BR, DS, MoB, OGR, or WS. Yes, you can have your "5 Left-Handed Knights" so long as there are less than two MoD in the mix.) We will split the field into at least four fields to run separate Round Robins to advance the top two teams into a single elimination finale.
    DFB will be in effect.
    Knee walking **to engagement** will be in effect.
    No RBG or combat archery.
    Have a team name, or our MoLs will name you.
    If you don't have a team we will find you a team.
    
**Special Twist**: Each field will have a special bonus team made up of 5 MoD from that list. (If there are not 5, the marshal will hand-pick their Champions.) They will fight each team in that list. While they **cannot** advance, if your team defeats them, you will automatically be added to the final Single Elim Finale.

name: By the Book Tourney
description_book: It’s time once again for the annual By the Book rapier tournament where scholars take the prize (best period style, best period dress, most wins).
description_web: It’s time once again for the annual By the Book rapier tournament where scholars take the prize. Whether you’re a fan of Fabris or an advocate of Agrippa, come out and show off your studies. Fabulous prizes will be given to the best period style, best period dress and the most wins.

name: Baronial Thrown Weapons Champions Tournament
description_book: A thrown weapons tournament between the Baronial Champions of the Known World.
description_web: A thrown weapons tournament between the Baronial Champions of the Known World.

name: Katana for SCA Combat
description_book: This is a non-armored class to show how Japanese single sword can be used in SCA armored combat.
description_web: This is a non-armored class to show how Japanese single sword can be used in SCA armored combat. Topics such as defense, attack, movement and proper thought will be covered.

name: Knowne Worlde Ladies of the Rose Tournament
description_book: Each Rose will sponsor one Unbelted Heavy Fighter and one Duellist. The tourney will be run in a Bedford points-style. 12:00 pm sign-in.
description_web:
Sign-in table opens at 12:00 pm. 
Roses, Diamonds, Edelweiss, etc., are welcome to be a part of the tourney as are all sitting Queens and Princesses, both Heirs and Territorials who are not yet members of the Orders.
Each Rose will sponsor one Unbelted Heavy Fighter and one Non-MOD\White Scarf (or WS equivalent) Duellist. To answer the question before it is asked - we have chosen to include the WS\Ogre\Etc. in with the MOD for this year and possibly next. Please contact me if you have any further questions on the topic. 
The tourney will be run in a Bedford points-style to maximize the number of bouts for the fighters.
The tourney will be run to Atlantian/Eastern standards.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Intro to Celtic Knotwork: 5-Dot Technique
description_book: This is an intro class to get you started down the rabbit hole to creating beautiful Celtic knotwork for any use you can imagine.
description_web: This is an intro class to get you started down the rabbit hole to creating beautiful Celtic knotwork for any use you can imagine. If you have ever wanted to create your own knotwork design for illumination, embroidery, leatherwork, wood carving, bone carving, or just because it is fun, this is the class for you.

name: On the Evolution of Jewish Names
description_book: Traces the evolution of Jewish names from the Biblical period through the medieval era, with references for a variety of cultures.
description_web: This class shows how Jewish names evolved from the simple names used in the Hebrew Bible (Old Testament to Christians) through the Greco-Roman period and into a variety of European and Middle Eastern cultures. The class is intended for persons trying to develop a registerable Jewish name and for heralds as a help with clients working with clients who want a Jewish persona.
fee_itemization: The five dollar cost is for an 18-page handout, complete with tables and footnotes.

name: Nalbinding Rings and Spots
description_book: There are more ways than stripes to enhance your nalbinding! Must know at least one stitch. Bring 2 needles if you can.
description_web: There are more ways than stripes to enhance your nalbinding! Take your projects to the next level by adding colored rings and spots. Stitches will not be taught, so you must know at least one stitch to participate. We will discuss how your choice of stitch affects your outcome. Bring 2 nalbinding or darning needles if you have them, as we will be working with 2 colors at once.

name: Photographers' Roundtable
description_book: Want to take better SCA photos? Want to talk shop with other photographers? Come hang out for a chat. No topic too big, no camera too small.

name: German Saxon Gown
description_book: The construction techniques and layers I used to create the iconic German Saxon Gown of the 1520s.
description_web: The construction techniques and layers I used to create the iconic German Saxon Gown of the 1520s from skin out.

name: Bardic Arts In Your Persona
description_book: How to use period works for inspiration or adaptation to fit your SCA persona and bardic repertoire, whether in song, storytelling, or poetry.
description_web: Discussion on how to adapt period works to fit your personal SCA persona and bardic repertoire, from using period sources as inspiration for original pieces (song, poetry, and/or storytelling) to transliterating, abridging, and "re-poeticizing" period works for the modern ear.

name: Introduction to 14th-Century German Brickstitch
description_book: Intro to 14-15th-century German brickstitch. First hour is hands-on; the second is open discussion with my references and research.
description_web: A basic introduction to a simple counted-thread technique used in 14-15th-century Germany. In the first hour the class will cover the basic stitches, and work on a project to take away to finish. In remaining time there will be an open discussion of the design features and history, and lots of pictures to look at (**New research! New patterns!**). Fee includes handout and materials. The number of kits is limited, but the class is open to all (or as many as will fit).
fee_itemization: Covers the cost of materials for the embroidery kit

name: Building Yurts on a Budget
description_book: Learn all you need to know to build and decorate a quality yurt on a tight budget.  Class handouts will include detailed plans and cost analysis.
description_web: Learn all you need to know in order to build and decorate a quality yurt on a budget. We will discuss building materials, design options, and cost-saving methods so that almost anyone can own their own custom-built yurt. Class handout will include a full and comprehensive shopping list as well as detailed instructions and plans to get you started.

name: Gift-Giving to Royalty
description_book: A discussion of what is good and not so good to give to seated royalty.

name: Designing and Building a Pavilion
description_book: An overview of pavilion styles, followed by detailed discussions of design considerations for several different styles.
description_web: An overview of medieval and Renaissance tent and pavilion styles, based on what we see in period portraits and in a few surviving examples. The presenters will discuss their experience in building a variety of pavilions. After the class, students are welcome to visit several pavilions on-site to continue discussion of design details and challenges.

name: Weaving on a Warp-Weighted Loom
description_book: Warp-weighted looms can be large and strange. Let's learn how to weave on one of a smaller scale. (Follow-up to "Warping" class. Others welcome!)
description_web: A full-size warp-weighted loom, as built in period, can be imposingly large and strange. We're going to learn how to weave on one of a smaller and more human scale. Using the warp we created in the previous class, we'll be working in pairs, learning how to weave a tabby weave, with discussions on working with more complex weaves. We'll have space for up to 12 people working hands-on. This is a follow-up class for the "Warping a Warp-Weighted Loom" class.

name: Learn to Spin
description_book: Introduction to spinning on a spindle, focusing on the park and draft method.
description_web: Focusing on the park and draft method, we’ll walk through the basics of how to spin wool into yarn.This is intended for people who have never spun before, or people who need a refresher from that spindle you bought 3 years ago and never quite figured out. We will focus on basic spinning techniques, not necessarily period techniques. Spindle and fiber will be provided, but feel free to bring any spinning implement or fiber you may already possess.

name: Beginner Dance: English Country Dance
description_book: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns and then teach simple English Country Dances.
description_web: Never danced before? No problem! This class will start with basic steps and patterns and then teach simple English Country Dances. Dances include *Gathering Peascods, Sellenger's Round* and *Goddesses*.

name: Pennsic Youth Choir: Open Rehearsal
description_book: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to ages 12 - 19 to learn period vocal music and perform as part of the Known World Choirs Concert.
description_web: The Pennsic Youth Choir is open to youth ages 12 - 19 who enjoy learning and singing period vocal music *a cappella*. We will be performing as part of the Known World Choirs Concert on Thursday evening of War Week. (Dress rehearsal Thursday afternoon, 8/7, in the PAT; details TBA during regular rehearsals.)  More information can be found here:  https://sites.google.com/site/kwcpennsicchoir/home/pennsic-choir/pennsic-youth-choir

name: PA Series: Known World Harp Celebration
description_book: Come celebrate the harp! Harpers of the Known World will display the wonders of the instrument we love. Open to all harpers of the Known World!
description_web: Come celebrate the harp! Harpers of the Known World will display the wonders of the instrument we love. Open to all harpers of the Known World! Audience and non-performing harpers welcome.

name: Johannes Liechtenauer Longsword 101
description_book: An introductory class to the longsword of Master Liechtenauer. We'll cover footwork, guards and master cuts.
description_web: This is an introductory class to the longsword of Master Liechtenauer and will cover footwork, guards and master cuts.

name: Painting Italian Renaissance Gems and Pearls
description_book: Learn how to paint *trompe l'oeil* strands of pearls and gems in golden settings. It's not as hard as it looks!
description_web: Learn how to paint *trompe l'oeil* strands of pearls and gems in golden settings as often seen in the borders of Italian Renaissance manuscript pages. It's not as hard as it looks!
fee_itemization: Paints, brushes, ready to paint designs on watercolor paper

name: Meet the Mayor
description_book: Meet and ask questions of the Mayor of Pennsic.
description_web: Meet and ask questions of the Mayor of Pennsic.

name: Coronation Ceremonies from Period Sources
description_book: Creating "authentic-as-possible" SCA coronations from period services. Methods of converting period liturgies to secular forms. Sources and examples.
description_web: Creating "authentic-as-possible" SCA coronation ceremonies from period *ordines*. Methods and philosophies of secularizing period liturgies. Examples and sources. The presenter has designed several successful "verbatim as possible" ceremonies in several kingdoms for Anglo-Saxon, Holy Roman Empire, English, Danish, and other personas.

name: Cuttlebone Bronze Casting
description_book: Carve a cuttlebone mold and cast a bronze piece.
description_web: Cuttlebone is a very easy-to-carve, period material for metal casting. Students will be carving molds and the instructor will be casting bronze into the molds. No carving experience is needed, as cuttlebone can be carved with a pencil or similar tool.

name: Building a Household: An Oldcastle Model
description_book: There are many kinds of households in the Society. We will discuss several of them, focusing primarily on Clan Oldcastle, the one I know best.

name: Conversational Russian
description_book: Covers the Russian alphabet and basic modern-day Russian conversational phrases, plus words and phrases more related to the SCA.
description_web: The class will cover the Russian alphabet and basic modern-day Russian conversational phrases, responses and questions. After that, we will go over words and phrases more related to the SCA which can be used to flavor one’s persona. There will be time reserved at the end of the class for questions.

name: Responsible Performing in the SCA
