description_book: This is a resurrection battle. It will take place in the upper woods only. There will be 3 flags placed in the woods.
description_web:
This is a resurrection battle. It will take place in the upper woods only. There will be 3 flags placed in the woods so that each is equidistant from the resurrection points. There will be checks for each banner at semi­-random times during the battle. The checks will be at 20 minutes +/­- 8 minutes, 40 minutes +/­- 8 minutes, and 65 minutes +/­- 8 minutes. The times for all checks will be determined by the marshals prior to the battle and will not be revealed to the combatants. There will be DFB in this battle. The side that is behind in overall war points will be given their choice of deployment areas. In the event of a tie, a coin flip will determine who has that priority.
The side that holds a flag for 2 of the 3 time checks will be awarded that flag. The side that wins a majority of flags wins the battle. 
All holds should be local if possible and will not stop the clock. Major/general holds (i.e., medical  holds) will stop the clock.
Start time: 1 pm.  Time limit: 65 minutes +/­- 8 minutes.  Resurrection: Yes.  DFB: Yes.

name: Slavery in Viking Culture
description_book: Discussion of slavery and how it was treated in Viking culture. Co-taught by Grimhild Gunnvoldsdottir.
description_web: A class discussing slavery in Viking cultures. It includes how it was started in myth as well as the laws and devices used in the slave trade. Recreation of items from the time may be available for use as examples.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Intro to Celtic Knotwork: 5-Dot Technique
description_book: This is an intro class to get you started down the rabbit hole to creating beautiful Celtic knotwork for any use you can imagine.
description_web: This is an intro class to get you started down the rabbit hole to creating beautiful Celtic knotwork for any use you can imagine. If you have ever wanted to create your own knotwork design for illumination, embroidery, leatherwork, wood carving, bone carving, or just because it is fun, this is the class for you.

name: Period *Commedia* Performed for Modern Audiences
description_book: Making a period *commedia* scenario from 1611 work for a modern audience.
description_web: Case studies of *commedia* scenarios from 1611, “The Fake Magician” and “He Who Was Believed Dead”, tweaked and performed successfully for modern audiences. See what’s necessary for filling in the gaps left by Flamino Scala and adjusting for modern tastes.

name: I Do Not Think That Means What You Think It Means
description_book: An exploration of the inter-kingdom anthropology of the usage of regalia and other tokens and designators of rank as used within the SCA.

name: Motley, Checks, and Rays: Non-Monochrome Cloth
description_book: Medieval cloth was far from monochrome. Take a look at motley, checked and rayed fabrics. We will discuss both shopping and historic uses in 1300s.
description_web: We will examine the written, archaeological, and visual record (1300s) to show that medieval cloth was far from monochrome, even for the lower classes. Most of this class will focus on translating the historic account to our modern shopping experience and how to apply it to our SCA personas and households. A second class, "Textiles of Elizabeth de Burgh's Household", will focus on the details of the historic accounts.

name: *Cloisonné* Enameling: Torch-Fired
description_book: Introduction to the technique, tools, and materials of *cloisonné* enamel. Kits are available for students to create a small piece.
description_web: Students will be introduced to the technique, tools, and materials of *cloisonné* enamel. Kits are available for students to create a small piece of their own. You are encouraged to bring wire working tools such as pliers and cutters.
fee_itemization: Kit Includes handout, blank disk to apply enamels, cloisonne' wire and use of instructor's enamel colors and propane torches

name: Drafting and Distaff
description_book: How you treat your fiber will change what type of yarn you end up with. Come experiment with drafting methods and using a distaff.
description_web: How you treat your fiber will change what type of yarn you end up with. Come experiment with a distaff and discover how silly modern spinners are for not using one. Try out cards vs combs and see the different preparations they make. Try different drafting methods and see how yarns behave differently. Attendees should know how to spin. Spindle and fiber will be provided, but feel free to bring any spinning implement or fiber you may already possess.

name: Livery Collars
description_book: An exploration of this elite accessory, with a focus on earlier examples and historical significance, plus a discussion of how to adapt to SCA use.
description_web: An exploration of this elite accessory, with a focus on earlier examples and historical significance, plus a discussion of how to adapt to SCA use. Some new information from previous years' classes.

name: A Squirrel Pelt by Any Other Name
description_book: Wardrobe inventories of the 13th and 14th C in England include a fascinating variety of specialized vocabulary. I will share interesting examples.

name: Lenten Food in Period
description_book: For 40 days out of the year, medieval Christians gave up dairy, eggs, and meat. Find out what they did eat and how delicious it could be.
description_web: Can you imagine giving up cheese, scrambled eggs, and bacon for forty days out of the year? Many Christians from the 10th century into the 16th century did just this but that doesn't mean they went without some form of comfort food. Come to the class to find out what they did eat and how to make some medieval Lenten treats.
fee_itemization: Three dollars for each handout of medieval recipes with the historical recipe and the redaction

name: Distilling History: Cordial Making
description_book: 1st hour: History of distillation; 2nd hour: Beginning cordial-making technique and a tasting. **Must be 21 or over to attend**.
fee_itemization:
Distillation handout, 8 pages;
Cordial-making handout, 10 pages.

name: Intro to Bobbin Lace
description_book: Learn the basic stitches for bobbin lace. Make and take a friendship bracelet.
description_web: Learn the basic stitches for bobbin lace. Make and take a friendship bracelet.

name: Reconstructing Spiral Silver Posaments
description_book: How to make some of the spiral silver posaments from Birka. Ideally, take the lecture first. Experience with knotting or lace is helpful.
description_web: Reconstructing spiral silver posaments. Learn how to recreate several of the Birka  posaments with a silver-colored spiral wire.

name: Making an SCA Documentary
description_book: Explore the practical and legal realities of creating an SCA documentary.
description_web: Have you ever thought about making a documentary about the SCA? Do you enjoy bringing a video camera to SCA events and want to do something with all that footage? This class will explore the practical and legal realities of making a documentary of the SCA. From shooting to editing to proper procedure of working with the SCA, we will discuss what works and what doesn't to make your project go smoothly and come up with great results.

name: The Evolution of *Leoncello*
description_book: Originally choreographed by Italian master Domenico da Piacenza, *Leoncello* continued to be danced for decades, in many variations. Come learn a few!

name: Ten-ish Songs Everyone in the SCA Could Know
description_book: Ten cool, kingdom-neutral songs that have something to say about life in these current Middle Ages. We'll sing through them together.
description_web:
Ten cool, kingdom-neutral songs that have something to say about life in these current Middle Ages. We'll sing through them together.
The handout is at http://tilted-windmill.com/uploads/ten_songs_every_scadian_should_know_vol_1.doc
Please print it out in advance if you can.

name: Monody and the First Operas
description_book: 16th-century Italy: A group of intellectuals strives to recreate ancient Greek drama. Learn the characteristics and philosophy of the first operas!
description_web: Late in the 16th century, a musical genre developed in Italy. "Monody" represented a radically new way of thinking about music and led to the creation of the style we now call Baroque. Its roots were in the writings of the Florentine *Camerata*, an elite group of musicians and intellectuals who scrutinized the music of ancient Greece in an attempt to rediscover its mysterious power to move the emotions. Convinced that the musical potency of the Greeks reached its zenith in sung tragedies, they conceived a modern recreation: opera. Come learn about the characteristics and philosophy of early opera!

name: PA Afternoon Series: Storytelling Exhibition
description_book: An amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of storytellers from around the Known World!
description_web: An amazing afternoon display featuring a variety of storytellers from around the Known World!

name: Ladies of the Rose Happy Hour
description_book: 14th Annual Knowne World Ladies of the Rose Happy Hour! This is **not** a tea, ladies! Thursday, 8/11, from 3 to 6 pm, in Æthelmearc Royal (N04).
description_web:
Join us for the 14th Annual Knowne World Ladies of the Rose Happy Hour! This is **not** a tea, ladies :-)!  All current and former royal consorts including Principality Princesses and Viscountesses are welcome! You can leave your retainers at the door for this fun meeting of our little "support group" where we'll laugh, joke and catch up! This is a must-attend for all Royal Ladies past and present.
When: Thursday, 11 August; Time: 3 pm - 6 pm; Where: Æthelmearc Royal (N04)

name: Producing *Commedia* for Modern Audiences
description_book: 16th-C plays need some updating for 21st-C audiences, even in the SCA. A behind-the-scenes look at producing *commedia* today.
description_web: Sixteenth-century *commedia dell'arte* requires updating to perform for a twenty-first-century audience, even in the Society. A behind-the-scenes look at what goes into producing a *commedia* play today including staging for non-Scadian audiences.

instructor: Mistress Arwen Evaine ferch Rhys ap Gwy
name: Norse Divination Techniques
description_book: Grain casting, rune stick reading, and a variety of other techniques will be presented in a hands-on workshop.
description_web: Grain casting, rune stick reading, and a variety of other techniques will be presented in a hands-on workshop.

name: Heraldic Display in Medieval Japan
description_book: Learn about the history and design of Japanese banners and other heraldic displays and how authentic Japanese devices can be registered in the SCA.

name: Mythbusting Period Piracy
description_book: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined.
description_web: The differences between period and non-period piratical portrayals will be outlined. Common myths and mistakes about piracy in the SCA period will be highlighted.

name: Make your Embroidery Pop: Using Padded Work
description_book: Learn how padded work can be added to your embroidery to add that little something extra. Hands-on practice and historic references provided.
description_web: Learn how padded work can be added to your embroidery to add that little something extra. No experience necessary. A hands-on class to try various techniques. Handouts with historic references provided. Will have 15 kits available or bring your own hoop, embroidery needle and thread.

name: Yes Virginia, You **Can** Build a Yurt
description_book: Yurts are 18 shades of groovy, but quite expensive. The charming and talented Majester Alchamar will teach you how to build your own. You can do this.
description_web: If you're reading this, you probably already know what a yurt is: round, Mongolian-based tents that have no poles, guy lines, and no corners. But in addition to being 18 different shades of groovy, they cost a fair penny to buy. What if I told you that you could trade a bunch of the cash outlay for elbow grease instead? It's true, and I invite you to join the class to see how it's done. We'll touch on tools, materials, and techniques, using advanced technical terms like "... and remember, don't bleed on the saw". With a decade-and-a-half of yurt-building experience, I'll be your instructor and comic relief. I'm charming, talented, and incredibly handsome. And humble. But seriously, c'mon down, we'll have some fun expanding our list of Things We Can Do.
fee_itemization: The hand-out is just over 20 pages. It costs at least that much to print the things. It might have gone up since last year. But I plan to make free e-mail copies available to those who'd prefer it.

name: Chatelaine: Recruitment and Retention
description_book: We will explore the need for recruitment and retention strategies within the SCA at every level of the organization.
description_web: There has been a lot of fantastic work on how to recruit new members into the SCA, but not as much work on how to keep up membership numbers. The importance of recruitment should not be understated, but it should also be equally important to try to find ways to keep our current members by analyzing why we lose participants, and reevaluating our regional and local goals in order to keep our groups fresh and exciting for people that have been involved for one month, one year or decades! This class will explore the need for retention strategies within the SCA at every level of the organization. Topics to be discussed will include motivation, encouragement, recognition as well as the re-evaluation of event themes and lay-outs.

name: Spoon Carving: A Spoon Circle
description_book: Bring your spoon carving tools, and we will sit and do some carving. Every 5 or 10 minutes the work gets passed to the person next to you.
description_web: Bring your spoon carving tools, and we will sit and do some carving. Every 5 or 10 minutes the work gets passed to the person next to you. Share technique and design ideas with others, and come away with a spoon-shaped object. Beginners welcome!  Some loaner tools will be available.

name: Knitted Socks and Stockings
description_book: Socks from the top down (or from the toe up)! Heels and toes, plain or fancy, wool or silk or cotton, oh my! Get the "knitty gritty" below the knee.
description_web: Socks from the top down (or from the toe up)! Heels and toes, plain or fancy, wool or silk or cotton, oh my! Get the "knitty gritty" below the knee.

name: Tablet Weavers' Tea
description_book: A social gathering for tablet weavers of all levels to show off current work, see projects from other people, and schmooze.

name: Make a Simple Girdle Book
description_book: We will make a simple blank journal and create a fabric girdle to cover it. Bring 2' square of specific fabric or choose from the instructor's stash.
description_web: In this class we will first make a leather-bound journal and then craft a girdle to cover it that you may hang it from your belt. All materials will be provided by the instructor, but if you wish to have a specific kind of fabric to match your device or as the basis for further embellishment, please bring a 2' square of fabric. Instructions will be provided in a handout.
fee_itemization: Handout, binding supplies, leather, paper, fabric.

name: Lovelace Manuscript Dances
description_book: Covers some familiar and some new material from this earlier ECD source which demonstrates the evolution of this dance style.

name: Youth Combat at the Castle
description_book: The last Youth Combat session of the week is held at the Castle. Participants must have spent at least one full session at Youth Combat prior to this.
description_web: The last Youth Combat session of the week is held at the Castle. Participants must have spent at least one full session at Youth Combat prior to this.

name: Woodwork Shop Time
description_book: Bring your wood and your tools! I'll be around to help and to talk and to pass out advice.
description_web: When learning, we all need some time to try doing things while someone who has been there before is watching. This class makes some time at Pennsic for just that! Whether or not you have taken my classes, you are welcome to come in and use my bench(es) and ask for advice. This will overlap with a discussion on early work holding methods. All day both Thursdays!

name: Advanced *Repoussé* and Chasing
description_book: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.
description_web: Intro to pitch block working and forming, plus tool and hammer use. Produce a copper letter amulet.

name: Thirteen Songs From the (Mostly) 13th Century
description_book: Learn some fun and fairly easy period songs! Mostly in Latin or English, and many have a singable translation. Drinking, sex and religion!
description_web: Come learn some fun and fairly easy period songs! Mostly in Latin or English, and many have a singable English translation. Drinking, sex and religion! Plus unicorns!

name: Stick Weaving
description_book: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method.
description_web: Stick weaving is a simple, weft-based weaving method. Great for making belts and straps. Upgradable to make everything from shawls to rugs. Sticks and string provided; take your work home with you.

name: The Submission Process
description_book: This class explains the basics of documenting and submitting for registration a name, device or badge, and what happens to it afterwards.
description_web: So, you've worked with a herald to register your name and/or armory. What happens now? This class intends to explain the basics of documenting and submitting a name, device or badge, and what happens to it afterwards.This class is not limited to heralds. Everybody can learn how things happen.

name: Who is Henry Buttes?
description_book: Who is Henry Buttes and why is his book *Dyet Dry Dinner* (1599) really cool?

name: Backstrap Weaving
description_book: Narrow weaving without a loom. How to do fully-functional narrow weaving using two sticks and a tree.
description_web: Card- and inkle-weaving are readily done without use of an inkle loom; all you need are two sticks and something solid to tie your work to. Learn how to warp and card-weave, as well as some handy tips for setups. Prior knowledge of narrow weaving helpful but not essential. Bring a small shuttle if you can or have one you prefer. Optional fee, only if you wish to purchase equipment.
fee_itemization: Dowels, backstrap, small warped cardweaving set, shuttle.

name: A Sense of Humor: Humoral Temperaments
description_book: Come learn more about what is likely the first personality meme ever created.
description_web:
Come learn more about what is likely the first personality meme ever created.
Based in the ancient medical concept of Humoral Prinicipal, the idea that four bodily fluids affect human personality traits and behaviors, the Four Temperaments is a proto-psychological theory that suggests that there are four fundamental personality types.

name: Long-Armed Cross Stitch: Attractive, Authentic
description_book: More than just a background stitch in Assisi work, it goes faster, and is prettier, than common cross stitch. Versatile and widely used late period!
description_web: More than just a background stitch (as in Assisi work), it is a versatile stitch that was used in colorful embroideries. It goes faster, and is prettier, than common cross stitch. In late period, it was used on a broad variety of household objects, often to beautiful effect. We will look at photos of a wide variety of extant examples. Then, those new to the stitch will learn to do the stitch.

name: Bardic Symposium #4: Bardic and Performing Arts
description_book: The Bardic Symposium is an open gathering for special forums, topics, and discussions for the Bardic Community. Day 4: Bardic and Performing Arts.
description_web:
The Bardic Symposium is an open gathering for special forums, topics, and discussions for the Bardic Community.
Day 4: Relationships between Bardic and the other Performing Arts.
We are far from the only performers around. Allied arts like conjuring, *commedia*, theatre, madrigals, choral singing, and instrumental music share the performance space. Are there ways we can all benefit from one another? What are our differences and commonalities? Are there ways to incorporate aspects of other performing arts into our own works? How can we strengthen relationships between the various performing communities?
Lead Presenters: Mistress Fianna of Clare, THL Lorelei Skye of Sans Nomen

name: 16th-Century Western Erotica
description_book: An exploration of the *I Modi* and other erotic works of the 16th century.
description_web: *I Modi* (*The Ways*), also known as *The Sixteen Pleasures*,  a famous erotic book of the Italian Renaissance in which a series of sexual positions were explicitly depicted in engravings. We will examine images from this work and others that explore sexual art for its own sake. There are handouts available. Because of the nature of the class, no one under the age of 18 is allowed to attend.

name: The Very New Persona
description_book: You're brand, spanking new, and you don't know who you want to be? No worries! I'll talk through good starting points, and then we just chat. Relax!
description_web: You're brand, spanking new, and you don't know who or what you want to be? No worries! I'll talk through common considerations and good starting points for information. After we go through the basics, we just chat about our thoughts. Relax! It's not supposed to be work!

name: Introduction to Combat Archery
description_book: Learn the basics of combat archery. Covers the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules and basic tactics.
description_web: Have you ever wanted to be a part of the action on the battlefield, but didn't want to swing a sword? Have you ever wanted to shoot back at that pesky archer who keeps killing you? Give combat archery a try. The class will cover the basics of combat archery: what equipment you need, the rules, and basic tactics.

name: "Shatner" Bransles for Beginners
description_book: An Overacter's approach to dance: Learn the *Laundry Argument, Toss-and-Flirt*,  "Creeper" dances (*Washerwoman's, Official*, and *Pease Bransles*).

location: Denys the Decadent (Denys the Decadent's Camp)
name: 12-Step Meetings
description_book: 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs. AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.
description_web: Open meeting; all are welcome. 12-step meeting open to all recovery programs: AA, NA, OA, GA, SA, Alanon, etc.

name: Mixing your own Period Paints
description_book: Mixing paint from pigments both medieval and modern can be easier than you think! Come make a small set of watercolor paint, and learn about pigments.
description_web: Mixing paint from pigments both medieval and modern can be easier than you think! Come make a small set of watercolor paint, and learn about pigments.

name: The Annual Inter-Kingdom Kite Flying Festival
description_book: An afternoon of camaraderie and kites sponsored by the Great Dark Horde. Bring your own kite. (It doesn't have to be period.)
description_web: An afternoon of camaraderie and kites sponsored by the Great Dark Horde. Bring your own kite. (It doesn't have to be period.) The Annual Inter-Kingdom Kite Flying Gathering is open to everyone; however, children must be accompanied by an adult. Please keep your kite Family-Friendly!

name: Two-Handed Weapon Tournament
description_book: A two-handed weapon-only tourney using the classic overhead throwing style.
description_web: A two-handed weapon-only tourney using the classic overhead throwing style.

name: Beyond the Notes
description_book: A practical look at taking polyphonic choral music past just singing the notes, with tips for singers and directors to turn notes into music.
description_web: A practical look at taking polyphonic choral music past just singing the notes, with tips for singers and directors to turn notes into music. Text painting, vowel modification and other techniques will be explored.

name: Science in the Middle Ages
description_book: What would an educated, well-read, and well-traveled scholar know about science and the nature of the cosmos in late period Middle Ages in Europe?
description_web: What would an educated, well-read, and well-traveled scholar know about science and the nature of the cosmos in late period Middle Ages in Europe? Class includes a survey of scientific thought from the Greeks up until the 16th century for background. The class will be taught in persona, but with the assistance of someone who can bridge the gap to modern science where deemed appropriate.

name: Heraldic Charge Group Theory
description_book: If you want to conflict check heraldic armory, you have to understand charge groups. This course will help you understand the SCA charge groups.

name: Spin in Time
description_book: A roundtable discussion of spinners who have chosen to focus on (for their persona) period fibers and tools within the context of the SCA.
description_web: A roundtable discussion for spinners who have chosen to focus on (for their persona) period fibers and tools within the context of the SCA. Spinning on a modern wheel or spindle is one thing; looking to recreate spinning as your persona would have done it is another. This is an opportunity for spinners to come together and discuss what they have learned plus new theories and information they have come across.

name: Keeping Bees in the Knowne World
description_book: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.
description_web: Get an idea of what is involved in keeping bees in the here and now. I'll walk you through a typical year.

name: Spinning 101
description_book: Learn to spin yarn on a drop spindle. Class will include instruction on making and using a low-whorl drop spindle.
fee_itemization: Fee is for both drop spindle  and spinning supplies

name: Byzantine Military Treatises
description_book: An overview of Byzantine military treatises from the 6th-10th century, with a focus on *De Velitatione Bellica*, a 10th-century manual on skirmishing.

name: Zen Meals under Dōgen's Pure Standards
description_book: Learn the mealtime ritual for a Japanese Zen monastery from a 13th-C source. If possible, bring 1-3 bowls, 2 cloth napkins, a spoon, and chopsticks.

name: Advanced Henna Body Art
description_book: We will focus on period exemplars, a survey of modern styles and where they came from, plus suiting your henna to your persona.
fee_itemization: $5 per student for a henna cone; this is my mundane bulk rate.

name: The History of Prostitution
description_book: History of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 AD. Topics include brothels, daily life, garb, and courtesan culture.
description_web: A survey of the history of prostitution, from the late Roman era to 1600 AD. We will be covering such topics as the formation of red light districts, brothel management, contraception, municipal laws, church law, and the garb and identification of a prostitute within this time period.

name: Hounds Abound!
description_book: Interested in how hounds were kept? What were the different types of hounds? What is coursing? Come learn about all things canine!
description_web: Come learn about hounds in the Middle Ages! We'll be looking at different types of hounds, how they were cared for, how they were hunted and how they fit into everyday life.

name: DaVinci Code, Templars, and Archaeology
description_book: Find out the perspective of a field archaeologist (with an interest in the Crusades) on the bestselling murder mystery.
description_web: The ruined castles of the Knights Templar are scattered across the Middle East and Europe. Templar castles and churches provide insights into this order of Crusading knights. Master Michael has visited several of these archaeological sites and examined the ruins. Find out the perspective of a field archaeologist (with an interest in the Crusades) on the bestselling murder mystery.

name: *Parson's Farewell* and *Whirligig*
description_book: These are more interesting English country dances and make good performance pieces. Some prior ECD dance classes needed.

name: Storytelling Academy Student Performance
description_book: The student performance of Minerva’s Spindle's Storytelling nine-day academy on the green of the Amphitheater.
description_web: The student performance of Minerva’s Spindle's Storytelling nine-day academy from Minerva’s Spindle, 158. During the nine-day academy, students gained knowledge about the history and techniques for storytelling both in the SCA and the modern world. Bring a blanket or chair to enjoy the performance on the green of the Amphitheater! (Alternate rain shelter in the Rehearsal Tent nearby.)

name: Bizarre Religious Practices of the Middle Ages
description_book: Some medieval people flogged themselves, licked lepers, or got advice from bits of bone. Learn why these things made sense to the people we emulate.
description_web: Medieval Europeans had some religious practices that were downright weird. However, even the most outlandish behaviors were honest attempts to find spiritual connections or improve the world. Learn a bit about the context of some of the strangest religious practices of the medieval period. Due to time, we'll focus on western Christianity.

description_web: Come see the premiere performance of the Known World's Youngest *Commedia dell'Arte* troupe, and therefore the newest, and thus, the best! Because new is always better! We will be performing with the alumni of Pennsic Youth *Commedia* and with opening shenanigans from *i Verdi Confusi*! name: *Muhekian*: The Taste of Tea
description_book: Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothes with white socks or *tabi*, and bring a fan if you have one.
description_web:
Enjoy the taste of tea under the night sky. Please wear Japanese or loose-fitting clothes with white socks or *tabi*, and bring a fan if you have one. Hideyoshi banned weapons from tea rooms, and jewelry is generally avoided in tea rooms as well.

*Matcha* appreciation was one of the preeminent cultural activities of late medieval Japan and played an important political role in Japanese society. Tea embraces a variety of art forms including: poetry, calligraphy, flower arranging, pottery, and architecture. Experience the *wabicha* approach to tea perfected in the sixteenth century.
fee_itemization: Cost of tea and sweets - 12 per sitting.

instructor: Mistress Jenna MacPherson of Lions Towe

description_web: An evening of fun and games for youth combatants, marshals and parents. Games are for combatants of all ages. Some games have light boffer-style contact; head and hand protection is required. Other games require full armor.

name: Italian Shenanigans Ball
description_book: Come share the joy of 15th- and 16th-century Italian dances! No finesse required, just a willingness to join in these fun dances!
description_web: 15th- and 16th-century Italian dances can be beautiful, complicated and intimidating. They don't have to be! Bring your enthusiasm, and don't worry about the rest. Dance steps will be reviewed, but no one will be grading your footwork. (Dancers with great footwork also welcome and encouraged to attend!)

description_web: *Commedia dell'arte* at its best presented by those actors who are teaching and discovering *Commedia* with the greatest fervor anywhere in the SCA!  We come together just at Pennsic. This is our third year producing an improvised comic play in the style of 16th-century Italian theater for your amusement! *Some material may be inappropriate for children under 12.*

description_web: All archers young and old are encouraged to come and lend their support to their kingdom's efforts, and to display their skill at archery. There will be three challenging populace shoots to test skills. Each Kingdom will be competing to earn the one War Point for each shoot.

name: Thrown Weapon Marshal Training Final
description_book: Final class to become a Thrown Weapons Marshal; includes a written test.
description_web: Final class to become a Thrown Weapons Marshal; includes a written test.

name: Modern Food Safety for the Medieval Cook
description_book: Using Penn State's "Cooking for Crowds" curriculum, this class will focus on safe food prep/handling/storage for feast cooks and kitchen volunteers.
description_web: Using Penn State's "Cooking for Crowds" curriculum, this class will focus on safe food prep/handling/storage for feast cooks and kitchen volunteers. The course manual can be downloaded or purchased here: http://extension.psu.edu/publications/agrs-086/view
fee_itemization: $11 for bound copy of the Cooking for Crowds book published by Penn State - 5 available

name: Making a Period Kit, Armor, or Camp for $100
description_book: Historical authenticity is often seen as being too expensive to be achievable. This class will explore how to look more period for less money.
description_web: Historical authenticity is often seen as being too expensive to be achievable. This class will explore how to look more period for less money. Examples will be given from multiple periods on how to create a suit of clothes, a basic encampment, or a suit of armor for the lists, for around $100 each. Standard of authenticity for all of the above will be such that a person wearing the kit and standing in the camp could be photographed for an educational book about the Middle Ages. For example, sewing machine stitches are fine but flashlights are not.

name: The Fairy Tale and Legend Workshop
description_book: We'll review period instances and sources of fairy tales and legends, construct period-plausible fairy tales and tell them with period techniques.
description_web: We will briefly go over the history and definitions of fairy tales and legends, instances of fairy tales in period, how to look for period sources of both, and how to identify and use motifs to construct/reconstruct tales which could have been told/recorded in period. Will introduce and practice "composition in performance", a period storytelling technique. The participants in the workshop will construct a fairy tale and a legend.

name: *RúnValdr*
description_book: In period runes were rarely used for divination, but many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system for using runes this way.
description_web: In period runes were very rarely used for divination, but there are many examples of runes being used for magic. This is a system that shows how to use Norse or Anglo-Saxon runes to create magickal tools, effect change at distance, work weather, awaken inanimate objects, world walk, heal/ relieve pain (even migraines), and more. An optional booklet, with additional information, will be available for $5. [Note: This class is not medical training. I am not a doctor and don't even play one in the SCA.]

name: Field Battles
description_book: Field battles: fought as many times as fit within a 2-hour limit with a minimum of 5 battles. There will be a 10-minute reset time between battles.
description_web:
Field battles will be fought as many times as fit within a 2-hour limit with a minimum of 5 battles. There will be a 10-minute reset time between battles. Each battle will be fought to the last man. Once a battle is started the field is closed. There will be no time limit on each individual battle. Armies may start up to 100’ onto the battlefield. All holds will be general and kept to a minimum. 
Clock will stop during medical holds. Combat archery and siege engines are allowed in the first 3 battles. If the sides are tied at the end of the 2-hour clock, the Unbelted Champions' teams will fight a single melee to determine the victor. 
Start time: 10 am. Time limit: To the last man, run battles for 2 hours. Resurrection: No. Combat Archery: First 3 battles only. Siege weapons: First 3 battles only. Victory conditions: Winner of the most battles within the 2-hour limit.

name: Marshals' Closing Meeting
description_book: Meeting for all Thrown Weapons Marshals.
description_web: Meeting for all Thrown Weapons Marshals.

name: Germanic Lyre Performance Roundtable
description_book: For those interested in Germanic lyres: a roundtable to discuss technique, reciting or singing with accompaniment, and other performance issues.
description_web: For those interested in Germanic lyres: a roundtable to discuss playing technique, tuning and temperament, reciting or singing with accompaniment, and other performance issues.

name: Break Down Range
description_book: Following marshals' meeting, all hands to help break down the range.
description_web: Following marshals' meeting, all hands to help break down the range.

name: Nine Days Wonder: Day 9
description_book: Dancing tour of central public areas of Pennsic. Start location: Y-Intersection of Roman Rd. & Great Eastern Hwy (W06/E15).
description_web:
Final day! We are re-enacting William Kempe's famous "Nine Days Wonder"! Kempe was an actor who worked with Shakespeare and who danced 100 km from London to Norwich as a publicity stunt in 1602. Dance 5 out of 9 days and receive a souvenir token! Check the book/web for start locations. We dance at noon each day.
Today: Dancing tour of central public areas of Pennsic. Start location: Y-intersection of Roman Rd. & Great Eastern Hwy (W06/E15). We will end up somewhere in the middle of everything!

description_web: Hands-on class; we will make a copper foil rose.

name: Writing *Commedia dell'Arte* Scenarios
description_book: Quick and practical way to create period-plausible *commedia* scenarios for your troupe for practice, SCA event, or Pennsic performance!
description_web: Quick and practical way to create period-plausible *commedia* scenarios for your troupe for practice, SCA event, or Pennsic performance! We will define a basic structure of a *commedia* play, identify the main characters and their functions, and learn to construct the scenarios that highlight the strengths of your troupe, whatever size and/or composition!

name: Rapier Field Battles
description_book:
The field battle will be run 3 times with a 10-minute reset time between battles. 
Each battle will be fought to the last man.
description_web: The field battle will be run 3 times with a 10-minute reset time between battles. Each battle will be fought to the last man. There will be no time limit on each individual battle. Armies may start up to 100’ onto the battlefield. All holds will be general and kept to a minimum. Clock will stop during medical holds. There will be DFB in this battle. Start time: 1 pm. Time limit: None. Resurrection: No.  DFB: Yes.

name: Ladies Hour: Ten-ish Songs By and About Women
description_book: Ten (for sufficiently large values of ten) cool songs that have been written by and about women. We'll sing through them together.
description_web:
Ten (for sufficiently large values of ten) cool songs that have been written by and about women. We'll sing through them together. There are a number of amazing female bards in the SCA, and there's room for a lot more. Come and sing what some of them have written.  

The URL for the handout will be listed here once I've finished putting it together.

name: Known World Players: Open Auditions, Pennsic 46
description_book: Known World Players are seeking actors for Pennsic 46 production Shakespeare's classic comedy "Merry Wives of Windsor."  Audition materials provided.
description_web: The Known World Players are seeking actors to audition for Pennsic 46 production.  Audition for Shakespeare's classic comedy featuring some of his most memorable characters. Falstaff sets out to seduce two wives of the town. How will they respond?  How will their *husbands* respond? It is about love, seduction, jealousy, revenge, with hilarious and a great resolution. Audition material will be provided.

name: Beginning Engraving
description_book: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control, hammer use.
description_web: Hands-on class. Intro to tools, first cuts, graver control. Student will learn both hand-held and hammer-struck engraving.

name: Making *Commedia* Happen in the SCA: A Roundtable
description_book: Bringing *commedia dell’arte* to life in the SCA is a complex challenge few have accomplished. Talk to them here about what worked and didn't.
description_web: Come hear from *commedia* veterans about what worked and what didn’t in an organized discussion covering recruiting and keeping a troupe together, costuming and masks, writing scenarios, finding documentation, participating in A&S fairs, working with event staff for performance space, and where in the world to start.

name: Madrigal Sing-Along
description_book: Bring your "Oxford Book of Madrigals" and sing your favorite madrigals. Some extra books and sheet music will be available.
description_web: Bring your "Oxford Book of Madrigals" and sing your favorite madrigals. Some extra books and sheet music will be available.

name: Closing Ceremonies
description_book: Closing Ceremonies for the War. Immediately following the Rapier Field Battles.

name: Advanced Engraving
description_book: The continuation of the work started in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.
description_web: The continuation of the work started in the beginning class. Hand-engraving on copper plate. Letters and design work.

name: Engineering for a Mobile Theater Troupe
description_book: Methods for putting up a mobile stage, including a temporary backdrop curtain, footlights, signboards, and scenario boards.
description_web: So you have a troupe that goes to events and wants to present plays but you need to be able to have a stage setup that is transportable and relatively quick to set up and take down. This class is a presentation of how the *Commedia* troupe *I Firenzi* handles those things, including an adjustable backdrop curtain, footlights (for playing in the dark), announcement signboards, etc.

name: Bardic Symposium #5: Feast Entertainment; Wrap Up
description_book: The Bardic Symposium is an open gathering for special forums, topics, and discussions for the Bardic Community. Day 5: Feast Entertainment; Wrap Up.
description_web:
The Bardic Symposium is an open gathering for special forums, topics, and discussions for the Bardic Community. 
Day 5: Feast Entertainment and Heralding:
Feast is one of the first places in the Society where we see bardic performance. It is also one of the most difficult things we do. How does one perform for a feast? What material do you select? Do you perform for the entire hall or go from table to table? How does one sign up to do this? How to co-ordinate it with the feast herald? While heralding feast may not be bardic art, it is certainly a theatrical one - and an office bards are sometimes asked to perform. How does one do it?

Wrapping Up:
What can we improve? What’s missing? What classes do we want to see taught that aren’t? What topics do we want to discuss? How can we make the bardic arts and its class tracks even better?
Host, Presenter: Provost, Master Cerian Cantwr

name: Pennsic Youth *Commedia* Performance
description_book: This is the performance following a week of workshops and classes for youth in Pennsic *Commedia*. Come enjoy the show!
description_web: This is the performance following a week of workshops and classes for youth in Pennsic *Commedia*. Come enjoy the show!  (Youth *Commedia* Classes: Sunday - Thursday, 9-10 am, in the Amphitheater.)

name: Calf to Codex, A Concert
description_book: This concert presents songs and stories of SCA and Midrealm history illuminated in this remarkable achievement from work by over 20 Arts and Sciences.
description_web: As a gift to the people of the Midrealm for the SCA’s 50th anniversary, dedicated artisans from over 20 arts and sciences and throughout all the regions put their hearts and talents together to create a medieval book using entirely period techniques: *The Codex Mediterraneae*. This concert presents the songs and stories of SCA and Midrealm history chosen for illumination in this remarkable achievement.

description_web: Join the Known World Players as they present Ben Jonson’s riotous Elizabethan comedy of cons and swindlers, "The Alchemist." Curtain will go up at 8:00 pm.
